loans.name: Zebijon

texts.ru: Саидахмадова Зебиджон нроживает в городе Турсунзаде в возросте 31 лет, разведина имеет  двоих детей.Образования среднее, клиентка занимается торговлей, на местном рынке города, рынок Саховат уже более двух лет.На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, это поможет ей увеличить свойх клиентов.
texts.en:
Zebijon S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 31 years old, has secondary education, divorced, and has 2 children. She has been in the business of selling women's clothing at a local market "Sahovat" for more than 2 years. She would like to obtain a loan so she could increase her inventory to attract more customers.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been selling used clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 5 years. She belongs to Tuwe Wakweli Group Loan (Group code 2090). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$90. She works at her business every day for 12 hours.  

Amina is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business, pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  

Amina is 40 years old, married, and has two children: aged 23 and 21.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mboja

texts.en:
Mboja is a small fish seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Tumejidhatiti group loan. She works daily at her business and currently earns an average monthly profit of $250.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more small fish for her business. She is hoping to increase her profits and grow her business through this loan, as well as to pay school fees for her children and to save money for future use.

Mboja is 30 years old. She is single.

loans.use: To buy more small fish for sale and to expand her business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
K. julienne est née le 05/02/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. julienne est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Armelle âgé de huit (08) ans en troisième année du cours primaire et Fidélia âgée de cinq (05) en première année du cours primaire. Avant de connaître ALIDé, julienne servait dans un restaurant. Mais depuis qu'elle a eu de crédit à ALIDé, julienne s'est mise à son propre compte. julienne vend la pâte de maïs et du poisson frit devant son domicile. julienne a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a eu de ALIDé et avec lequel elle a commencé son activité de restauration populaire. julienne étant à ses débuts a toujours besoin de l'appui financier de ALIDé en crédit. julienne demande un deuxième prêt à ALIDé pour développer son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
K. Julienne was born on February 5, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and the mother of two children: Armelle, age 8, in the 3rd grade; and Fidélia, age 5, in the 1st grade. Before finding out about Alidé, she used to work in a restaurant. But since she has had loans with Alidé, she started off on her own. Julienne sells cornmeal mash and fried fish in front of her home. She has indeed repaid the first loan she had with Alidé. The loan was used to start her popular restaurant business. Being new at it, she still needs financial support from Alidé and is asking for a second loan to develop her business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of fish and sacks of corn

loans.name: Valihon

texts.ru: Негматов Валихон житель города Турсун-Заде. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей.Занимается животноводством уже четыре года. Покупает животных для откормки и перепродажи. Хочет купить дойную корову. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. На эти деньги он планирует взять породистую корову , которая в дальнейшем сможет давать породистое потомство.
texts.en:
Valihon N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has been in animal agriculture for the past 4 years. He buys animals so he could feed them until they reach appropriate weight and then sells them at a higher price. He decided to ask for a loan so he could purchase a milk cow. He plans to use the money to purchase a good breed, so he could later use this cow for further breeding.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Шодиева Малика проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 36 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей. Торгует на рынке "Саховат" города Турсун-заде. Привозит ткани из города Душанбе. Клиентка имеет опыт работы с кредитами. В данный момент она планирует получить повторный кредит и использовать его для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Таким образом она сможет завезти сезонный товар.
texts.en:
Malika S. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 36 years old, married and has three children. She has been in the retail business for five years now. She sells on the market Sahovat in the Tursun-zoda. She brings fabrics from Dushanbe. She has an experience working with loans. At this time she plans to get another loan and use it to increase commodity circulation. This way she can bring in seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! Bertha S. from Dar es Salaam is 39 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of 1½ and 22. Bertha has been running a shop since 2002. She owns a small duka, or neighborhood shop, in the city, where she sells common household and grocery items. She works 13-16 hours a day, 6 days a week, with the help of her husband.

Bertha currently earns about 100 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock for her shop. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Bertha thanks you for your support!

Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) is pioneering micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization supports the economic empowerment of women through leasing and leaseback micro-financing.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and limited access to basic resources and services for low-income women. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Норбабаева Мехриниссо проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 30 лет. Разведена , но живет с двумя дочками. Имеет высшее образование. Работает кассиром . Планирует купить корову , которая давала бы молоко. Но для этого она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Кредит поможет ей обеспечить детей молоком , а так же получить доход, так как лишнее молоко она сможет продавать соседям.
texts.en:
Mehrinisso N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, divorced and lives with two daughters. She has high education and works as a cashier. She plans to buy a cow which will give milk. She is asking for a loan for this reason. The loan will help her supply her children with milk and also get an income from the remaining milk which she can sell to the neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Botsou

texts.fr: A. est un jeune homme célibataire très dynamique qui travaille dur pour pouvoir subvenir à ses charges. Il a appris le métier de la menuiserie en 1996 et travaillait chez quelqu’un. Pour pouvoir mieux gagner de l’argent, il a ouvert son propre atelier qu’il a appelé « ELEPHANT MEUBLE », il ne dispose pas encore de certains outils. C’est pour cela  qu’il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter une machine défonceuse, une machine scieuse et divers outils.
texts.en:
A. is a young man, unmarried, and very energetic. He works hard to be able to support himself. He learned the trade of carpentry in 1996 and used to work with somebody. To earn more money, he opened his own workshop, which he calls “ELEPHANT MEUBLE”. He still lacks certain tools. This is why he’s requesting his first loan with WAGES, so as to buy a router, a power saw, and various tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a power saw and a router

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Ашурова Дилором житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 34 года, замужем и имеет пятерых детей.работает на рынке "Саховат".Торгует тканями, которые привозит из города Душанбе.Занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Этим она сможет обеспечить рынок современными и модными товарами. иИ таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Dilorom A. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 44 years old, married and has five children. She works on the market Sahovat. She sells fabrics which she brings from Dushanbe. She has been in this business for eleven years. She decided to get a loan to increase commodity circulation. By doing this Dilorom can supply the market with modern and trendy goods and also attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдурасул проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 24 года, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается животноводством. Опыт работы составляет два года. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить комбикорм. Это даст возможность работать без издержек. Кроме того используя качественный комбикорм даст возможность откормить животных быстрее и таким образом он сможет быстрее его продать и получить прибыль.
texts.en:
Abdurasul K. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He practices animal husbandry and has two years of work experience. He decided to obtain a loan to buy pre-mixed feed. That will clear his work expenses. Additionaly, high quality feed brings animals to market weight faster, allowing him to sell them and receive profit faster.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pre-mixed feed

loans.name: Bah Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Bah Oumou Sangaré a 46 ans, mariée et mère de huit enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs  enfants à Hamdallaye Extension, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette femme s’est initiée   aux activités de teinture et de vente de bazins teintés. Elle  a appris la teinture auprès de sa grande sœur il y a dix neuf  ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  pour la qualité de ses produits et reçoit beaucoup de commandes. En plus de son activité principale, elle fait le stockage et la commercialisation de céréales.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois  ans. Elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 2 pièces de bazins blancs “Riche Hollandais” , 10 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, 10 paquets de soudes caustiques. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) mais aussi à Sikasso auprès des grands commerçants avant de les donner différentes colories pour  ensuite les revendre au comptant, à crédit et sur commande à une clientèle composée de routiers et de Sikassois résidant ailleurs.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bah Oumou Sangaré, 46 , is married and the mother of eight children, 5 boys and 3 girls. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had to chance to do well in school due to socio-economic reasons, this lady learned to do dyeing and to sell hand-dyed damask ("bazin") cloth. She learned to do dyeing from her older sister 19 years ago. She is much in demand for the quality of her products and receives a lot of orders. Besides her main business, she warehouses and sells cereals.

Wishing to better satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to become a member of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. She is on her 5th individual loan and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed. With this loan she intends to buy 2 bolts of white damask "Riche Hollandais”, 10 boxes of various color dyes, and 10 packets of caustic soda. She does her buying in Bamako (capital of Mali) but also in Sikasso from the big merchants before dyeing the fabric in different colors and selling it for cash and credit and on order, to a clientele composed of long-distance drivers and of people from Sikasso who live elsewhere.

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan, investing any remainder back into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of un-dyed damask, caustic soda, and dye

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fried chicken. She hawks her fried chicken from street to street within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria.She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more fried chicken to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fried chicken to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Fatuma M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single. Fatuma has been running a women's handbags and clothes business since 2001. She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week. Fatuma currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes and handbags for her business. In the future, she plans to establish the same business in another place. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and handbags for her business

loans.name: Kaniba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kaniba Fané est un polygame de 50 ans, père de seize enfants (11 garçons et 5 filles) qui réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Fané est chauffeur de formation qui, après vingt ans d’exercice de cette profession en république de Côte d’Ivoire, de retour au bercail,  s’initie aux activités de petit commerce notamment l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique,  cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, sachets de lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savons, etc. Il est le représentant de la Société Nationale de Tabacs et Allumettes du Mali (SONATAM S.A.) au niveau de quartier où il habite il y a maintenant cinq  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 10 cartouches de cigarettes différentes, 2 cartouches du thé, 2 sacs du sucre, 2 sacs de riz, 5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumettes, 2 cartons de savon, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des garagistes et routiers puisque sa tablette est située aux alentours des garages auto et de la direction régionale de Douanes de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kaniba Fané is a polygamist aged 50, father of 16 children (11 boys and 5 girls) who resides with his family in Sanoubougou, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Fané is a licensed chauffeur who, after working 20 years in this profession in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire, came back to his roots and began to be a petty trader, notably buying and selling various items such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, envelopes of powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc. He has been the representative of the National Office of Tobacco and Matches in Mali (SONATAM S.A.) in the neighborhood where he lives for the past 5 years. He is much in demand with his customers for the quality of his products.

Wishing to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this loan, he intends to buy 10 cartons of various brands of cigarettes, 2 cartons of tea, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of rice, 5 packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches, 2 cases of bars of soap, etc. He buys his merchandise from local wholesalers before re-selling them retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of mechanics and long-distance drivers, since his display is located near the garages and the regional Customs Office of Sikasso.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various small articles for re-sale

loans.name: Saidakram

texts.en:
R. Saidakram is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of home-grown vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his three children. Saidakram has been characterized as a person who is hard-working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Saidakram is determined to raise the standard of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
M. Delphine est née vers 1960 dans le Département de l'Ouéme au Sud du BENIN. Delphine est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants dont deux encore à sa charge. Delphine vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de mayonnaise, de beurre, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, liqueurs, eau minérale, bougies, insecticides, etc.) dans sa boutique dans la zone de l'abattoir à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. La zone de l'abattoir devient de plus en plus habitée; ce qui rend la clientèle de Delphine plus importante. Pour mieux faire fasse à la demande de cette clientèle qui devient de jour en jour plus importante, Delphine a besoin de renforcer son fonds de commerce. C'est pourquoi Delphine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé en crédit. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
M. Delphine was born around 1960 in the Ouéme region in south Benin. Delphine is married and mother of four (04) children, two of whom she still takes care of. Delphine sells various items (candies, biscuits, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatos, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, pasta, detergent for clothes and dishes, soap, liquors, mineral water, candles, insecticides, etc) in her shop near the slaughter-house in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The area near the slaughter-house is becoming more and more populated, and this has grown her customer base. Delphine needs additional funds to meet the needs of her clients who are more numerous on a daily basis. This is why Delphine is asking for financial support as credit from ALIDé. The meaning of ALIDé in Fon, the local language of Benin, is that “a way always exists for the poorest”. Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria where the GDP per capita is at $1,500.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of packs of candy, biscuits, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatos, mayonnaise, butter, sugar, pasta and soap.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
S. Mastona is 26 years old. She is not married and has been running her own business for more than a year. Mastona has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began this business with financial support from her father. The reason for starting the business was to increase her family’s income, and the business has been gradually growing ever since. In order to grow her business she requests a loan of 1000 US Dollars. Mastona is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods for sale thus increasing the range of goods she has on offer. She thanks everybody who decides to support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Khanifa

texts.en:
A. Khanifa is 50 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her 4 children and provide for their education. Khanifa has an experience of 5 years in preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her customers are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month.

Today Khanifa requests 800 USD for a term of 9 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order increase the range of her goods. Khanifa expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
H. Mahbuba is 30 years old. She and her husband have three children. For more than three years, Mahbuba has been running her own business. Mahbuba has a small salon where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses and national wedding dresses. Traditionally, families in Tajikistan are large, consequently there are lots of marriages and Mahbuba has a lot of clients.

The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income. Today Mahbuba requests $800, which she will use to purchase new wedding dresses. Mahbuba would like to assure all who decide to support her that she will pay the loan in nine months.

loans.name: Ifayatu

texts.en: Ifayatu sells drinks and plantain. She makes most of her profit from the sale of drinks. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell. She is 35-years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and plantain to sell

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
K. Mahmud is 24-years old. He is married with two kids. Over the years he has tried various types of activities. Finally, two years ago, he started his business selling cell phones. Mahmud finds this business to be profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. However, Mahmud thinks that it is overly expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it would cut expenses considerably if the goods were purchased in China. With this in mind, Mahmud requests a loan of $800 US with a term of nine months. This is his first loan and Mahmud is grateful to all for supporting him. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.name: Buzurg

texts.en:
K. Buzurg, 45 and married with two children, has been running a beekeeping business for 20 years, having started the enterprise after experiencing difficulty finding employment. Family effort has been the key to his business's growth since everyone collaborates, and now he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. Currently, Buzurg is seeking a loan of $800 in order to expand his business, thereby allowing him to offer better services. He promises to repay this loan in seven months. Be a part of this family's achievements. They sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.name: Sharof

texts.en:
Sharof M. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has 4 children, the elder is studying at University and his youngest is still in elementary school. Sharof began a small grocery store 3 years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his wife and daughter (pictured) who help him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Sharof is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To increase variety of store inventory

loans.name: Wassiatou

texts.fr:
T. Wassiatou est agée de 33 ans et est originaire de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Wassiatou est  mariée à OKPEICHA Ibrahim, vendeur également des produits de quincaillerie. Wassiatou vend des produits de quincaillerie tel que les boîtes de colles forte, des clous, des marteaux, des vernis au carrefour le berlier à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Wassiatou a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a pu hisser son commerce au niveau où il est aujourd'hui. Les moyens financiers de Wassiatou ne lui permettent pas de bien répondre à la demande de ses clients. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et pouvoir acheter les autres articles que lui demande ses clients, Wassiatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Wassiatou, age 33, traces her roots to Ouémé in southern Benin. She is married to OKPEICHA Ibrahim, who is also a seller of hardware like Wassiatou, who offers merchandise such as cans of strong adhesives, nails, hammers, and varnish at the Berlier crossroads in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has had three loans with Alidé that she has repaid. With those loans, she was able to raise her business to the level at which it is today. Her funds prevents her from responding well to the demands of her customers. To boost her working capital and to buy other goods her customers demand, Wassiatou is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hardware products and a barrel of varnish

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
R. Naim is 23 years old. He is married and has a small child. Naim is a very diligent and hard-working young man. With his car he provides taxi services. For the last 5 years the current business had been the main income for the family allowing Naim to improve the living conditions of his large family. In addition to his wife and small child he is also supporting his parents.

As with any business generating income the business of Naim also requires some investments from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some repair. For this purpose Naim requests US $800 for the term of 9 months. Naim promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba S.  is a 44-year-old married mother of three children living in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past 10 years, Nasiba has helped her husband earn money by processing dried apricots and selling them at the market. Nasiba is now applying for a loan of $800 to expand her operation by buying more dried apricots to earn more and improve her standard of living. Nasiba says that this is the perfect time for her to take out a loan. By offering a better selection, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity. 

Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and more importantly, ensure that her four children will always be able to attend a good school. Nasiba is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Salma R. N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 6 and 10.

Salma has been running a charcoal-selling and a fish-selling business since 2004. She sells charcoal, which is used by many Tanzanians as a fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal), and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative! Salma works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two people. Salma currently earns about 250 USD from her business.

Salma is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to establish a new business. Salma thanks you for your support!


ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina owns a grocery store in the city of Chisinau. Her store carries a lot of food items, such as milk, meat, grain, sweets, vegetables, fruit, and many other products needed daily for human nutrition. There are no other stores in the region, so business goes quite well. Galina has borrowed a loan from Microinvest to supplement the stock of goods, and needs an additional loan to continue to expand.

loans.use: To increase the stock of grocery-store goods.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
T. Umar is 44 years old and is married with three children. Umar has been involved in the sale of spare parts for bicycles since 2004. Gradually the business expanded. Being hard-working and polite by nature, he has managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with the goods and the service. The income he derives allows him to provide for the family needs as he is the only bread-winner in the family.

Today Umar requests $800 for the term of 9 months. He is planning to spend the loan to purchase more spare parts for bicycles to increase his range of goods. Umar is counting on your help. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts for bicycles to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
T. Gulbahor is the happy mother of three children. She is 37 years old and married. Gulbahor is a teacher. Her salary is very little, which is why she has been running her own grocery business. For two years, she has been selling foodstuffs in her grocery store. Gulbahor’s wish is to increase her business by offering a variety of food items to the customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind: to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, along with the immense love she feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of $800 in order to increase the range of her goods. She promises to repay the loan within nine months. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Gulbahor.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is 30 years old and she is married. She sells loaves of bread to make a living. She hopes for the loan in the amount of NGN50,000 (US$350) to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi is a hair stylist. She also sells hair cream and hair extensions. She has two girls assisting her in the salon. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN (US$ 350) to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells cooked foods. She started this business in 2004. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN (US$ 350) to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ablavi Délali

texts.fr: Madame AMAGATSE ablavi exerce la profession de sage femme d’Etat, elle a eu son diplôme  et a commencé par exercer en 1986. Pour aider les malades n'ayant pas assez de moyens à se procurer des médicaments, elle a commencé à vendre des produits pharmaceutiques. Ne disposant pas actuellement de certains produits pharmaceutiques, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 boîtes du produit Artéméther, 50 plaquettes de Novagin injectable et d’autres produits pharmaceutiques. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle habite avec sa famille le quartier de cacavéli à Lomé
texts.en:
Ms. AMAGATSE Ablavi is a midwife by profession. She obtained her certificate and started practicing in 1986. To help the sick who lack enough money to acquire medicines, she started to sell pharmaceutical products. Currently lacking certain of these products, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 containers of Artéméther (a modern anti-malarial drug), 50 blister packs of injectable Novagin, and other pharmaceuticals. She is married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in the Cacavéli district in Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmceutical products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Ruth M. P. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of 13 and 20. Ruth has been running a batiki business since 2004. Batick pieces are traditional African clothing which is mostly worn by women. They look good when they are painted with dye and many people like them. Ruth works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Ruth currently earns about US$318 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase cloth and dye for making batik. In the future, she plans to establish a new business. Ruth thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dye for making batik.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies to cook and sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 42 years old and she is married with 6 children. She has a store where she sells provisions and food. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more provisions and food supplies to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Née le 04/02/1957 à Attitogon, Mme A. Améyo est mariée et mère de deux (05) enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit pour étendre son étalage de vente de chaussures et sandalettes pour augmenter son rendement. Le bénéfice servira à améliorer les conditions d’existence de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Born on February 4, 1957 in Attitogon, Ms. A. Améyo is a married mother of five children. She's requesting a loan to extend her display of shoes and sandalettes (flip-flop sandals) for sale, so as to increase her returns. The profits will serve to improve the living conditions for her entire family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes and sandalettes

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old young man living in Barja in Mount Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 and desires to open an Internet cafe. Today, Ahmad is requesting $1,200 to further expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

texts.en: Faith O. is a tailor and she also sells sarongs. She is 36 years old and married without any children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells drinks and provisions. She is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes to own a big super market in the future. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en: Mr. G. raises chickens at a poultry farm. The chickens are sold in the market from the region of Cahul town. In this activity Oleg has worked for more than 10 years. Oleg knows his work fairly well. Last year Oleg raised about 7,000 birds. This year he plans to increase the number of birds to about 15,000. He would also like to include turkeys and geese. To increase the number of birds, Oleg needs to increase the number of shelters for the hens. He would like a loan in the amount of 30,000 MDL to buy all the necessities.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make shelters for hens at poultry farm.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Doña Josefina Ordonez is 37 years old and is single with 3 children. When she was 3 years old her older brother accidentally cut off her hand with an ax. The hand was completely amputated, but Josefina is still able to weave and happily says that she functions the same as someone with 2 hands. 

About 4 years ago she became part of a women’s lending group with FAPE and received her first loan. A few years ago her nephew learned to make sandals and Josefina helped him to open his own shop so that he could make more money. They have been making sandals now in their own workshop for 4 years and she needs capital in order to buy materials like leather and rubber soles. 

They dream of selling their shoes in many of the local markets and of having a lot of employees. Josefina hopes that her children will be able to continue studying and that someday she will be able to expand her home so that each child can have their own room.

**********************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
**********************************************

Doña Josefina Ordóñez, es una señora de 37 años de edad, esta sola con, 3 hijos, ella por accidente cuando tenia 3 años su hermano mayor le corta la mano con un hacha, fue amputada, mas sin embargo, ella teje hasta este momento, hace 4 años se integra a un grupo de mujeres para un crédito, luego un sobrino, aprende hacer sandalias, ella lo impulsó para que se iniciaran un taller propio y no mas ser empleado, llevan 4 años de fabricar sandalias, ahora necesitan capital para comprar suelas y cuero para  elaborar Zapatos, el sueño que tienen es de poder vender en muchos mercados locales, tener muchos empleados, y que sus hijos puedan  seguir estudiando, una habitación cada hijo.

loans.use: Materials to make shoes

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Doña Eusebia R. is 37 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband is a truck driver at a sawmill. Eusebia never had the chance to go to school and, from a young age, she worked only in weaving. She wants her children to have more opportunities than she did.

She started her business selling her woven fabric in the market. Then she realized that there is good money in the sale of chickens, and so she began to work with a cousin on this second business. They run the business together, but split up to sell on their own. She has had this small business now for over three years and is looking for additional locations in which to sell the chickens. Her children also help by selling in other markets.

She is planning on using her loan to purchase more chickens so that they can all have more merchandise to sell and continue expanding. Her dream is to one day purchase some land, and she wants her daughters to continue to go to school.

********************************************
Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow.
********************************************

Doña Eusebia R., es de 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es piloto de un camión, en un aserradero, la señora se dedicaba en tejidos, no estudio, no quiere que su hijos se queden así como ella quedo, ella inicio, en el momento de vender su tejido en el mercado, se dio cuenta que la venta de pollo es buena, se ponen de acuerdo, con una prima, lo ejecutan el negocio, luego se separan para poder vender por su cuenta, busco nuevo local para ella, desde 3 años, tiene esta venta de pollo pero pequeño, ahora necesita capital para comprar pollos, así también tiene para mercadería para vender sus hijos, ya que iniciaron vendiendo en otros mercados, el sueño que tiene es que puedan comprar terreno, sigan estudiando sus hijas.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to expand her business

loans.name: Phamthi

texts.en:
Toàn PhamThi (632981244) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Toàn works in a family member's business venture operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing cargo transportation services to local community members. Toàn has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, Toàn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Toàn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. Toàn is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Toàn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on rice

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy I. sells bags of Gari and also measures them in smaller quantities for sale to those who can not afford to buy the Gari in sacks. Gari is a grain-like food which is made using cassava. The pills of the cassava are removed and then the cassava is milled and the starch is extracted from the cassava. The cassava dough is then fried into the Gari which is ready for consumption. It is popularly eaten across the country.

Elmina is where her business is located. Dorothy has received primary education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a poultry farmer. Dorothy has been selling bags of Gari since 1999. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of Gari for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a building.

loans.use: To buy bags of Gari for resale.

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.en:
H. Truong (632981252) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities.

In 1998, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 10th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For baby livestock

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Madame  Koura Dembélé   est âgée de 44 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit dans une  famille  polygame avec son mari, ses enfants et sa coépouse à Ségou Médine (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle commença les activités commerciales auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière elle maîtrisa les rouages du commerce. C’est ainsi que sur l’initiative et l’appui d’une cousine elle embrassa le commerce de bois de construction, activité qu’elle mène depuis 4 ans au marché de Médine. Elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une notoriété. Ses clients sont les entreprises de construction, les maçons et les propriétaires de maisons, il est à noter que la ville de Ségou est en pleine construction. 
Dans le souci  de faire face à cette demande croissante des clients, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 1er prêt individuel tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel pour un montant de  400 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 6 000 unités de bois de construction. Elle s’approvisionne dans la forêt de la fayiha sur la route de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Madame  Koura Dembélé  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales et  payer ses dettes.
texts.en:
Ms. Koura Dembélé, age 44, is married and the mother of five. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, children, and co-wives in Ségou Médine (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not have gone to school, she started working in commerce with her mother, who used to sell condiments. After several years at her mother's side, Koura learned all the ins and outs of the business.

And through the initiative and support of a cousin, she embraced commerce in timber, which has been her work for four years at the Médine marketplace. She enjoys a large customer base and some distinction. Her customers are construction enterprises, masons, and homeowners. It should be noted that the city of Ségou is in the middle of being built up.

Concerned about coping with the growing demands of her customers, Koura turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 30 months ago. After three solidarity loans and one individual loan, all repaid, she is now on her second individual loan in the amount of 400,000 francs CFA, which she plans to use to buy 6,000 units of timber. Supplies are gotten from the Fayiha forest on the road to Bamako (the capital of Mali). Sales are made to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering certain family expenses and for paying her debts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for construction

loans.name: Thai Thi

Ngọc has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Ngọc is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.  This loan will be the 10th she has taken out from TYM Fund.  Ngọc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials used in repair business

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.en:
T. Phan (630981061) is a 30 year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 1998, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 10th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Expand store inventory

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through junior high. Mariama sells ladies' underwear, fabric, and powder in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Mariama contributes towards the living expenses of her younger siblings; she uses her income to buy textbooks and other basic needs for her them .

Mariama will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of ladies underwear, fabric, and powder to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Mariama plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business, further expanding her trade.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Molobaly

texts.fr:
Madame  Molobaly  D.   est âgée de 53 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une grande famille polygame avec son mari, ses trois coépouses, leurs enfants et plusieurs autres ménages dans la même concession (prototype des grandes familles traditionnelles de chez nous) à Ségou Sokalakono,  2ème quartier de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire de formation elle  débuta le commerce après son licenciement. Elle mena plusieurs activités telles la vente de tasses,  de céréales et de tissus. Molobaly  finit par opter pour le commerce de savon. Elle mène cette  vente de savon liquide il y a 5  ans chez elle et en ambulant  dans les différents services de Ségou. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation car elle est formatrice en transformation de produits locaux au sein de la Chambre des Artisans, elle encadre également les jeunes en déperdition scolaire. Pour faire du savon liquide elle a besoin d’1kg de pâte de savon + 1 kg de sel iodé + 12 litres d’eau et on mélange le tout pendant deux jours ; au 2ème jour on ajoute du sel + de la couleur et des eaux de Cologne.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1er prêt individuel tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel pour un montant de  400 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 barrique de pâte de savon  et 1000 bouteilles vides pour emballage. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières au grand marché de  Bamako (capitale du Mali).
Madame   Molobaly  D.  vend au comptant, en détail  et à crédit. 
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, la participation aux évènements sociaux (fêtes et funérailles) et payer sa servante. 
Son ambition est d’aménager un terrain pour son activité et servir de lieu de formation
texts.en:
Mrs. Molobaly D. is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in a large, polygamous family with her husband, her husband’s three other wives, their children and many other families in a shared home. This is a typical arrangement for traditional families in Ségou Sokalakono, the 2nd district in the city of Ségou, which is located in the 4th administrative region in the Republic of Mali. Although Mrs. D. trained as a secretary, she began working in commercial business after her training. She has had many occupations including the sale of teacups, grains and fabric. Mrs. D. opted for the sale of soap. For five years she has been selling liquid soap from her home and by travelling to different locations within Ségou. Mrs. D. enjoys a good reputation due to her work for the Artisan Bureau, training others in the processing of local products. She also teaches children who are not able to attend school. To make liquid soap she requires 1kg of soap paste, 1 kg of iodized salt and 12 litres of water. These ingredients get mixed together for two days. On the second day, salt, colouring and perfume are added. In order to increase her business capital and meet the demand of her clientele, Mrs. D. has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 36 months. After 4 group loans and 1 individual loan, all which were repaid in full, she is requesting her second individual loan in the amount of 400,000 FCFA which she plans to use for the purchase of 1 barrel of soap paste and 1000 empty bottles to use as packaging. She gets her supplies from the large market in Bamako, the capital of Mali. Mrs. D. makes sales by cash or credit. She hopes to earn a profit of 60,000 FCFA which she will use to pay the interest on her loan, to participate in social events such as celebrations and funerals and to pay her maid. Her goal is to develop a permanent site for her business which can also serve as a training classroom.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of soap paste and empty bottles for packaging

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Trí Phạm (630071669) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen.  She is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, Trí works in a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members.  Trí has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately (~US$280) 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Trí joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Trí has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Trí is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products  This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Trí plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for manufacturing business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Hạnh Phan (624981438) is a 42 year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Hạnh owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Hạnh has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, Hạnh joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities.  Hạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  Hạnh is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hạnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Sitan  C. est âgée de 53 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit  dans une  famille monogamique avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonne l’école pour se marier. Depuis étant élève elle menait des activités commerciales auprès de sa mère qui vendait du miel. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière, elle acquière une solide expérience  lui permettant de voler de ses propres ailes. Évoluant  seule et menant beaucoup d’activités telle la vente de poissons, de brochettes de viande, de galettes, elle décide finalement de se spécialiser dans  le commerce d’habits. Elle mène ce commerce depuis 22 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété au marché de Sébougou et dans son quartier de résidence où les clients viennent acheter à la maison. Ses habits de bonnes  qualités sont très  prisés  par les clients.
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est en relation depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
 Elle compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter, 12 complets de bazins riches de différentes colories auprès des teinturières de la capitale Malienne  Bamako.
Madame  Sitan  C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 35 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de payer ses tontines, de participer aux événements sociaux et de supporter certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est de faire l’import export  entre le Mali et le Burkina Faso.
texts.en:
Ms. Sitan C., age 53, is married and the mother of five. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For societal reasons, she dropped out of school to get married. Since being a student, she worked in commerce with her mother, who used to sell honey. After several years at her mother’s side, she acquired solid experience, which enabled her to fly on wings of her own.

Improving by herself and working at many kinds of jobs, such as selling fish, meat kebabs, and galettes, she decided in the end to become specialized in the clothing business. She has been in this business for 22 years and enjoys a large customer base and fame at the Sébougou marketplace and in the district where she lives, there where customers come to buy at her house. Her clothing is of good quality and popular.

To increase her working capital, Sitan has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 48 months. After four solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan.

She plans to use this loan to buy twelve outfits of rich damask fabric of different colors from dye experts in Bamako, the capital of Mali. She makes her sales to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay the tontines (community revolving savings and loan groups), to participate in societal events, and to cover certain family expenses. Her ambition is to import and export goods between Mali and Burkina Faso.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Phan Thi

In 2002, Huê joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Huê has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Huê is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Huê plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for restaurant business.

Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to expand rice processing business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Q. is single parent and has 8 dependants. She has received schooling through primary education. Mary sells fresh fish. She buys fish from the fishermen at the seashore and then sells them fresh at the market. She preserves the rest of the fish by smoking process. She later sends them to the market for sale at Elmina, which she has done since 1980. Mary uses her income to pay school fees and other housekeeping expenses. Mary will use this loan as additional capital to increase the amount of fish she buys meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards buying a fishing boat so the she can have fishermen working for her.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell at market.

loans.name: Chu Thi

texts.en:
L. Chu (640991086) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, L. owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $226) a month from these activities.

In 1999, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. L. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Lu Thi

texts.en:
Hoà Lưu (640991087) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hoà owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hoà has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 1999, Hoà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the 9th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John E. is a single parent and has 2 children. He has received schooling through senior high school. John is a carpenter who specializes in making furniture, which he has been selling in Elmina since 2002. John uses his income to pay for bills, school fees and other basic needs of the family.

John will use the loan to buy more wood for the production of furniture to meet the demand of his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land he wants to buy to put up a house for the family.

loans.use: For wood to make furniture

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.en:
Tự Đinh (1318030464) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Tự owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Tự has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Tự joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tự has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Tự is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Tự plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Feed and supplies for livestock

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Đào Hoàng (1328030876) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Đào owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling poultry products in the local community. Đào has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $226) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Đào joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đào has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Đào is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Đào plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: Food products for resale

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Hợp Lê (1328050250) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has two infant children. To making a living, Hợp owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. Her business’s main source of revenue is raising and selling pigs, however raising pigs is not the business's only means of generating revenue. Hợp has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND per month from these activities.

In 2005, Hợp joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hợp has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hợp is now requesting a new loan of 16,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to be raised and sold in future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hợp plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим занимается оптовой торговлей мандаринов и яблок. Товар покупает в г. Худжанде (100 км.) и привозит в г. Исфару. Здесь у него есть постоянные клиенты, которые берут у него товар под реализацию. Получив от них ниличные деньги от товара сданного 2-3 назад он едет обратно за товаром. Абдулкосиму 36 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей.  Кроме этой деятельности Абдулкосим также таксует на своей собственной машине. Эти 2 вида деятельности приносят ему его основной доход. Заявку которую он подает, собирается использовать под расширение своего бизнеса и погасит в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdulkosim is a wholesale seller of tangerines and apples. He purchases his products in Khujand (100km) and brings it to Isfara. Here he has regular customers who take products from him to sell. After getting cash from them for products that he gave them 2-3 ago he travels again to purchase products. Abdulkosim is 36 years old; he is married and has 2 children. In addition to this business, Abdulkosim is also a taxi driver in his personal vehicle. These two businesses bring him his main earnings. He plans to use his loan in order to grow his business and will pay it back over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Primer préstamo KIVA:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82548
Esther  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Esther es casada tiene 52 años, dos hijos D. 32 y 26 años todavía están estudiando en la universidad.
Esther aprendió en un escuela  nocturno manualidades D.  arpillaría estuvo trabajando con un grupo D. señoras, por un buen tiempo, hace doce años decidió independizarse ahora  trabajar por su cuenta en la venta D. arpillaría, ha ganado mucha clientela,  también venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo.  
Esther necesita un préstamo D.  1000 soles, para la compra D. materiales D. arpillaría.
