DesD. que está en Finca, aprendió a sacar sus cuentas, separa su capital D. sus ganancias, los préstamos le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio.  
El sueño D. Esther es ayudar económicamente a sus hijos, hasta que puedan mantenerse por si mismo.
texts.en:
Esther's first Kiva loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82548

Esther is a member of the Communal Bank El Triunfo ("Triumph"). Esther is married and 52 years old. She has two children, 32 and 26, who are still studying in university. In night school, Esther learned how to make arpilleras (colorful stitched fabrics such as vests, little handbags, mittens, and decorative patches). She was working with a group of women for a while. Twelve years ago she decided to work independently, and work on her own selling arpilleras. She has many clients and she also sells beauty products through catalogs.

Esther needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian nuevo soles to buy materials to make arpilleras. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to keep her accounts and separate her capital from her earnings. The loans have helped her grow her store. Esther's dream is to help her children financially until they can support themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make arpilleras

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574
Marivel  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Marivel es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Marivel hace dos años juntos sus ahorros  alquilo un local, compro una  maquina fotocopiadora  y se puso a trabajar, ella atiende  sola todos los días en su negocio de fotocopiadoras.
Marivel necesita 1000 soles, para invertirlo en su negocio y comprar más hojas, tintas para fotocopiadoras.
Desde que está en Finca ha aprendido a invertir su dinero, le gustan las reuniones del Bancomunal y tiene amigas.  
El sueño de Marivel es tener un local propio para su negocio de fotocopias.
texts.en:
Marivel's first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82574

Marivel is a member of the Communal Bank El Triunfo ("Triumph"). Marivel is married and 44 years old. Her three children are 13, 9, and 6, and they are in public school. Two years ago, Marivel put together her savings and rented a space, bought a photocopy machine and started to work. She alone tends to her copy store every day.

Marival needs 1000 Peruvian nuevo soles to invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for the machines. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to invest her money. She likes her Communal Bank and has friends in it. Marivel's dream is to own a space for her copy store.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy more paper and ink for photocopy machines.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82581
Georgina es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Georgina es casada  tiene 42 años, dos hijos uno  de 14 años que está en la escuela estatal  y otro hijo de  1 año, de su nuevo matrimonio. 
Georgina trabajaba como secretaria por años, lo dejo por que se caso con el tiempo se separo y después  se volvió a casar, se puso a trabaja vendiendo de todo por pedidos en el mercado de surquillo.    
Georgina  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles,  para la compra de pedido de locería. 
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió el sentido de responsabilidad, los prestamos la han ayudado  a surgí en el negocio. 
El sueño de Georgina es poner una tienda y  contratar gente que trabaje con ella.
texts.en:
Georgina's first loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82581

Georgina is a member of the Communal Bank El Triunfo ("Triumph"). Georgina is married and 42 years old. She has two children. One is 14 years old and in public school, and the other is a 1 year-old from her new marriage.

Georgina worked as a secretary for many years. She stopped working because she got married. After some time, she got separated and later remarried. She started to work selling many things by order in the Surquillo market.

Georgina needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian nuevo soles to fill an order for pottery. Since she joined Finca, Georgina has learned what it feels like to take on responsibility. The loans have helped her grow her business. Georgina's dream is to have a store and to hire people to work with her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan of 1000 soles to fill an order for pottery

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy N. is single with no children, and has a junior high school education. She works as a trader and baker selling goods such as bread, eggs, and rice at Eguase near Cape Coast. She has worked in this trade since 2000. Lucy uses her income to pay for rent and utility bills. She will use the loan to help further expand her business in the bakery. With the new profits from her business, Lucy plans to buy land which she will eventually build a home on.

loans.use: To further expand her business in the bakery.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Sonia es casada tiene 33 años dos hijos 12 y 5 años ellos están estudiando en el escuela estatal.
Sonia estudio un curso técnico de cosmetología y trabajo en un salón de belleza por años, después ella fue ambulante por doce años consecutivos, hasta que alquilo un puesto en el mercado, ahora ella tiene un bazar  en el mercado.  
Sonia necesita  un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra descartadles  y juguetes.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a trabajar con empeño, ahorrar también ha invertir en su negocio y ser responsables con los pagos de Finca.   
El sueño de Sonia es  tener un puesto propio de bazar.

Primer perstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82708&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Niño Divino (Divine Child) Communal Bank. She is 33 years old, married and has two children, ages twelve and five, who are students in public schools. Sonia took a technical course in cosmetology and then worked in a beauty salon for a few years. After that, she was itinerant for twelve straight years until she rented a stand in the market. Now she has a shop in the market. Sonia needs a loan of 800 Soles in order to buy disposables and toys. Since she has been with FINCA Peru, she has learned to work hard, to save and invest in her business, and to be responsible with her loan payments. Sonia's goal is to have her own store. Here is a link to Sonia's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82708&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
Perfecta es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Perfecta es conviviente tiene 55 años,  dos hijos de 17 y 15 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Hace nueve años empezó a vender golosinas en una canastita, alentada por sus vecinas, junto sus ahorros y se pudo comprar un kiosco, ella vende golosinas en al puerta de sus casa. 
Perfecta necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, frugos, galletas.  
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir mejor gracias a los préstamos que recibe, su economía ha mejorado. 
El sueño de perfecta es tener más capital para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Perfecta is a member of the Niño Divino community bank. Perfecta is 55, and has a common law husband. She has two children, 17 and 15, who attend the state school. Nine years ago she started to sell sweets from a little basket. Encouraged by her neighbors, she gathered her savings and bought a kiosk. She sells sweets from the door of her house. Perfecta needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy sweets, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and cookies. Since she has been with Finca she has been able to invest more. Thanks to the loans she has received, her economic situation has improved. Her dream is to have more capital to be able to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and cookies.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82719
Liliana  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Liliana es conviviente tiene 26 años, dos hijos de 7 y 4 años  ellos estudian en la escuela particular.
Liliana termino la escuela y no pudo seguir estudiando por que salio embarazada, se dedico a su casa y apoyar el negocio de su esposo se dedica a la venta de tamales, la familia de su esposo siempre se ha dedicado a eso, ellos venden semanal 2000 tamales cuentan con cuatro vendedores, también dejan en el panadería de su barrio.    
Liliana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de maíz por sacos y hoja de plátano.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene más ingresos, ha podido comprar mas cosas para su negocio, un motor para moler el maíz, antes tenia que ir hasta  Surco para moler el maíz.  
El sueño de Liliana es llegar a contratar personal para que trabajen para su negocio, y ellos se e dediquen a administrar.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of the Niño Divion community bank. Liliana is 26, and she has a common law husband. She has two children, 7 and 4, who attend private school. Liliana finished school, but she was not able to continue her studies because she was pregnant. She takes care of the house, and she helps her husband with his business of selling tamales. Her husband’s family has always sold tamales. They sell 2000 tamales per week. They have four salespeople. Their tamales are also for sale in the neighborhood bakery. Liliana needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy sacks of corn and banana leaves. Since she has been with Finca she has had mO. income. She has been able to buy mO. things for her business, like a machine to grind the corn. BefO. that she had to go to Surco to grind the corn. Liliana’s dream is to be able to hire workers for her business so that she and her husband can concentrate on the administration of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and banana leaves.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Primer pestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82705
Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Rosario es madre soltera tiene 49 años seis hijos, el menor tiene 16 años y esta en la escuela estatal.
Rosario desde joven se dedico al negocio,  empezó con una ferretería con su esposo, pero  se separo, y se dedico a la venta de libros, veta de ropa y  zapatos entre otros, ahora solo se dedica ala venta de calzado al crédito. 
Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de loceria por el día de la madre.
Desde que esta en Finca le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal, aprendió  a ser responsable con los prestamos y los pagos, es como una familia tiene amigas  las cuales  se reúnen para salir, conversar.
El sueño de Rosario es comprarse una moto para que su hijo lo trabaje, y pode tener mas entradas.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82705 Rosario is a member of the Communal Bank, Divine Child. She is a 49-year-old single mother of six children. Her youngest child is 16 years old and goes to the state school. Rosario has been in business since she was young. She began with a hardware store with her husband, but they separated and she began selling books, clothing, and shoes among other things. Now she only sells footwear on credit. Rosario needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy pottery for Mother's Day. Since she's been in Finca she likes the Communal Bank's meetings. She has learned to be responsible with the loans and payments. It's like a family of three friends who get together to go out and talk. Rosario's dream is to buy herself a motorcycle so her son can work it and have more income.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosario necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de loceria por el día de la madre.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice B. is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven kids. She says two kids are out of school and working and the rest are currently in junior and senior high schools. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. Eunice works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. She is a petty trader. She sells fresh eggs and salt on a tabletop in the community market. She buys her fresh eggs from the poultry farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes the fresh eggs to breakfast operators in her town. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fresh eggs in bulk so that she can cut down on costs, such as frequent trips to procure the goods, and maximize profit. 

She is a member of the community group called “Akwai Allah.” Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral so they can access the loan and then they support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Cristina es conviviente tiene 36 años, dos hijos de 11 y 4 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Cristina ha trabajado limpiando casas, después  por ocho años trabajo con una señora en la venta de comida, en  Pista Nueva, en la zona  también  vendía ropa usada, averiguo como era el negocio y con sus ahorros  decidió independizarse y  se puso a vender ropa usada.   
Cristina necesita una presta, de 1200 soles, para la compra de mercadería,  adornos para el día de la madre, flores  artesanales entre otros.
Desde que esta en Finca, ha sido de mucho apoyo, puede ahorrar  y realizar ahorros voluntarios, las charlas que reciben han sido de ayuda para su negocio.
El sueño de cristina es tener un negocio  propio para la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Cristina is a memeber of the Niño Divino community bank. Cristina is 36, and she has a common law husband. She has two children, 11 and 4, who attend the state school. Cristina has worked cleaning houses. Later, for eight years she worked with another lady selling food on the Pista Nueva (a street). They also sold used clothes in the area. She learned about the business, and she decided to use her savings to become independent. She started selling used clothes. Cristina needs a loan of 1200 PEN to buy merchandise like decorations for Mother’s Day, artificial flowers, and other items. Since she has been with Finca, which has been very supportive, she has savings. The talks she has attended have been helpful for her business. Cristina’s dream is to have her own business of selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like decorations for Mother's Day, artificial flowers, and other items.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухабат 48 лет. Она замужем, муж на заработках в России, воспитывает 4 детей. Постоянной работы не имеет и уже несколько лет занимается шитьем национальных халатов дома. Ей помогает ее дочь. Мухабат приоретает ткани и вату для набивки и потом дома шьет. На шитье одного халата уходит от одного до трех дней в зависимости от полученного заказа. Прибыль от вложенного составляет 25-30% и полученная прибыль идет на расходы семьи. Мухаббат собирается приобрести ткани и поэтому подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 48 years old. She is married, her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and she is raising 4 children. Muhabbat does not have a regular job and has been sewing traditional robes at home for several years. Her daughter helps her. Muhabbat purchases fabric and cotton for padding and then sews at home. It takes her one to three days to sew one robe depending on the order. The profits from her investment constitute 25-30% and the earnings are spent on family expenses. Muhabbat plans to purchase fabric and this is why she has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania  socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Tania es conviviente tiene  41 años, dos hijos de 12 y 7 años que están en la escuela estatal. 
Desde niña Tania ha vendido con su mamá en el mercado anticuchos, allí ella aprendió del negocio, estudio enfermería técnica, no llegó a terminar por que se dio cuenta que le gustaba estar en el negoció  de ventas.  Ahora ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y usada en Pista Nueva.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para compra de ropa de invierno y vender en Huaraz. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía ha mejorado, sus hijos están en al escuela particular, pudo comprar un auto  de segunda y ahora lo alquila, ella se siente agradecida por todo lo que ha aprendido, y ha podido lograr.    
El sueño de Tania es remodelar su casa para alquilarla por cuartos.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of Bancomunal Niño Divino.

Tania lives with her partner. She is 41 years old and has two children, aged 12 and 7, who are in a state school.

Since childhood, Tania has sold kebabs in the market with her mother. There she learned business. She studied technical nursing, but did not finish because she realized that she liked being in business and sales. Now, she sells new and used clothes in the Pista Nueva.

Tania needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($325 USD) to purchase winter clothes and sell them in Huarez.

Since she has been with the Finca, her finances have improved. Her children are going to private school. She was able to buy a second-hand car that she now rents. She feels thankful for all that she has learned and has been able to achieve.

Tania’s dream is to remodel her house to rent rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase winter clothes and sell them in Huarez

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82717
Felicita  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Felicita es conviviente  tiene 47 años, cinco hijos  de 28, 26, 22, trabajan y están casados los menores de  14 y 11 años  están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Felicita aprendió de su mamá el negocio de venta de calzado, su mama ya no trabaja y le dejo el negocio desde hace quince años, ella es ambulante.
Felicita necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de saldos de zapatos  en gamarra.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir, las capacitaciones de negocio que recibe son de ayuda para crecer en su negocio.   
El sueño de Felicita es viajar a otro país para trabajar.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82717 Felicita is a member of the Niño Divino microfinance institute. She lives with a partner, is 47 years old, and has five children, three of whom aged 28, 26, and 22 work and are married. The younger children aged 14 and 11 study in public school. Felicita learned the business of shoes sales from her mother, who no longer works and left the business fifteen years ago and now travels. Felicita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase shoes on clearance at Gamarra. Since she has been in Finca, she has been able to invest and the business training she receives has been helpful in growing her business. Felicita's dream is to travel to another country to work.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felicita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase shoes on clearance at Gamarra.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John E. is married with 3 children and has received an education through commercial school. John is a trader who sells eggs in Eguase near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2007. His wife also works as a trader in the Cape Coast area. John uses his income to pay for school fees, rent and utilities. John will use the loan to purchase more eggs which he will use for selling. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: John will use the loan to purchase more eggs which he will use for selling.

loans.name: Anane

texts.en: Anane Q. sells ladies undergarments in Eguase near Cape Coast.  She is married with 6 dependents and her husband works as a policeman.  Anane has been working as a trader since 2002. She is responsible for helping to pay school fees and utilities. Her loan will be used to further expand her undergarment business. She hopes to use her increased profits to build a home for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to further expand her undergarment business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua W. is married with 2 children and works as a trader in Yamoransa near Cape Coast.  Since 2003 she has sold kenkey, gari and abode, a type of food made out of corn and sugar.  While Efua works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more maize which she will use to prepare kenkey and abodoe for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save more money and further increase her capital.

loans.use: Efua will use the loan to purchase more maize which she will use to prepare kenkey and abodoe for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah O. is a trader who sells corn and cassava dough in Kotokraba near Cape Coast. She is married with 4 children and her husband works as a steel bender. Hannah is an experienced business woman and has been in her trade for four years. She is responsible for helping to pay household expenses, such as utilities. Her loan will be used to increase the capital for her corn and cassava dough trading business. She hopes to use the new profits to buy land for a building.

loans.use: Loan will be used to increase capital for corn and cassava dough business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi T. is 42 years old. She is married and has three children who are pursuing education in junior and senior high schools. Esi’s husband is a welder by profession. He farms as well. Esi and the family live at a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either farm or trade in farm products. Very few people in this area run different types of businesses. 

Esi trades in second-hand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bed spreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc from Accra, the capital city. She then sells these items in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Esi has been in this business for barely year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to purchase better quality stock to serve a larger market and eventually, help to improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “hwe Nyame” (translated, Look unto the Lord) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is fifty-four years old. She is a widow and has three children. Currently, two are pursuing education in senior high school. Elizabeth lives with some of her children in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Elizabeth lost her husband after a short illness two year ago. She works with zeal as a single parent to support her family and provide for her children's schooling. She is a fishmonger and also sells used clothes. She sells her wares in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from wholesale fishmongers in the towns of Yeji and Mankessim. She has been in business for twenty-five years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. 

Elizabeth believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and other assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances. She also wants to continue to provide for her children's education, which is very dear to her heart. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group provide guarantees for one another as social collateral to access the loan.  They also support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure tilapia and other fish in bulk.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy N. is married with six dependents and has received an education through senior high school. She has sold kenkey (a kind of dough made from maize and cassava), bread, and doughnuts at Moree Junction near Cape Coast since 1999. Her husband is employed as a mason. Dorothy uses her income to help pay for her family’s expenses, which include school fees and utilities.  She will use the loan to purchase more flour and maize in order to make more kenkey, doughnuts and bread.  Dorothy plans to save the extra profit from her expanded business in the bank so she will be able to use it as she deems necessary.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and maize.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and father of two kids aged four and one. He lives with his family in their house in Oda, a community in the Eastern Region of Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. He operates a pharmaceutical shop and sells various medicines like blood tonic, pain killers, and malaria drugs in his neighborhood. Many locals purchase his drugs for use as first aid and cures when they are sick. Isaac has time for every customer that visits his shop. He usually inquires about the symptoms of his patrons' sicknesess to offer the appropriate medicine and also provides advice on its usage. He has been in operation for the past three years and has assisted in the cure of a number of common diseases such malaria, cholera, and typhoid, among others.

Isaac wants to take advantage of the loan to purchase additional medicines to serve his community. Apart from doing business, Isaac also wants to serve his community with his health-related knowledge to help cure common diseases in the early stages and offer preventive advices

loans.use: To procure pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Two of them are currently independent but the others are pursuing education in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Being a resourceful mother, Mary works assiduously to support her husband in providing for the family, especially the kids' schooling. Mary is a petty trader. She deals in all kinds of bottled and canned soft drinks: malt, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Pepsi, etc. She procures the drinks from wholesale dealers in the national capital of Accra and sells in the community market.

She has been in this very business for the past seven years and wants a loan to procure assorted drinks in bulk. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to make timely delivery of stock to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To procure soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena T. is 34 years old. She is the mother of five kids and divorced. Her kids are schooling in the primary and junior high schools. Philomena lives with her children in a family apartment in a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities there. However, quite an appreciable number are also involved in trading and other business activities.

Philomena is a seamstress by profession. She sews all kinds of fashionable clothes. She says she started her shop 15 years ago and has since trained eight young ladies in sewing who have started their own businesses in other communities. Currently, three apprentices are undergoing training.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to procure assorted quality clothing materials and sewing accessories so customers could buy materials and prescribe a style to be sewn simultaneously. She hopes to increase her income to enable her to save more to support her kids’ education.

loans.use: To buy materials and sewing accessories

loans.name: Señor De Quinuapata Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Señor D. Quinuapata son D. la Provincia D. Cangallo, que se ubica a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población D. la zona se dedica en mayor proporción al comercio, también a la agricultura. Este bancomunal pertenece a la Region Wari D. FINCA Peru.

Gloria es soltera, venD. todo tipo D. postres como humita, mazamorra, queques, que ella misma prepara, además es enfermera D. profesión y trabaja en el centro D. salud. el préstamo que obtendrá será invertido en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. tortas como harina. Los sueños D. Gloria son tener una tienda D. postres.

Zoraida es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, Zoraida se dedica a la venta D. helados que venD. en las diferentes ferias y comunidades, Zoraida tiene proyectado tener una bodega, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes. Los sueños D. Zoraida son mejorar sus negocios, realizarse como mujer y viajar en la vejez.

Betzy es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos D. 6, 8 años, Betzy inicio vendiendo cosméticos por catálogos actualmente tiene una tienda en donD. venD. ropa, zapatos, joyas, cosméticos. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará lencería y otros productos para surtir su negocio. Los sueños D. Betzy son tener una tienda en la ciudad D. Huamanga y que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
The members of Banco Comunal Señor D. Quinuapata are from the Cangallo province, which is located 3 hours outsiD. of the city of Ayacucho. The population mainly works in the commercial industry, and also in agriculture. This communal bank belongs to Region Wari of FINCA Peru. Gloria is a single woman who sells all types of desserts that she prepares herself, including humita, porridge, and muffins. She is also a nurse and works at the health center. The loan she will get is to be invested in the purchase of ingredients, such as flour, to cook cakes. Gloria's dreams are to have a desserts store. Zoraida is a single mother with 2 children. Zoraida works selling ice cream that she sells in the different markets and communities. Zoraida plans to have a store, and her loan will be invested to purchase groceries for the store. Zoraida's dreams are to improve her businesses, fulfill herself, and travel when she becomes older. Betzy is a single mother of 2 children aged 6 and 8 years old. She began selling cosmetics by catalogue, but now actually has a store where she sells clothing, shoes, jewelry, and cosmetics. With the loan, she will be able to purchase linens and other products to stock her business. Betzy's dreams are to have a store in the city of Huamanga and that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El Bancomunal is requesting 5,700 for their 11 members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria G. is 45 years old. She is married and has five kids. All the kids are currently in school. She lives with her family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the eastern Ghana. Victoria works hard to support her kids’ welfare and schooling. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables. She sells maize, beans, yams, tomatoes, onions, eggplant, etc., at a stand in the community market. She buys her goods from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for five years. She also distributes the maize and beans to local food vendors. She wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk so that she can make fewer trips to procure the goods and in this way maximize profit.

She is a member of the community group called “Yehowa Mma” (Jehovah's children). Members of this group guarantee each other's loans and support one another in handling repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw M. is fifty-six years old. He is married and has ten children who are currently pursuing education in senior, junior, and primary schools. He lives with his family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in Eastern  Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. Yaw sells gari, groundnuts, and maize in his neighborhood. Gari is produced from milled cassava, which is dried and fried. Many Ghanaians enjoy this local food with cooked beans and palm oil. He purchases these foodstuffs from farmers in the villages in bulk and supplies them to food vendors in his town. This business supports all his children and keeps them in school. He wants to use the loan to purchase gari, beans, groundnuts, and maize in bulk for warehousing so that he can avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent buying trips.  He hopes to earn a good income to pay his children’s school fees. He is a member of the trust group called “Adekyensroma” (morning stars). In this group, members guarantee each other's loans and act as social collateral in the request for loans and support one another in their repayment.

loans.use: To purchase gari, beans, and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Qantu Huayta Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Qantu Wayta son  D. la comunidad D. Vischongo, Provincia D. VilcasH., esta ubicado a 3 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, a una altitud D. 2900 m.s.n.m., esta comunidad es zona turística por las ruinas del Intihuatana y la laguna D. Intihuatana. La actividad primordial es la agricultura D. papa, maíz, cebada y también a la ganadería.
Gardenia es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo D. 7 años, Gardenia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes y así surtir mas su negocio, Gardenia sueña con ahorrar para salir adelante, mejorar su negocio y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
Isabel es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos D. 8, 10 años, Isabel se dedica a la venta D. cereales que compra en su comunidad actividad que aprendió D. pequeña con su mama, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cereales, los sueño D. Isabel son educar a sus hijos y comprar un molino D. granos.
Saturnina es casada, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad, Saturnina junto a su esposo compran animales en las diferentes comunidades, luego los benefician, la carne lo comercializa en su comunidad. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar mas animales, los sueños D. Saturnina son seguir velando por el bienestar D. sus hijos y ahorrar para la vejez.
texts.en:
The members of the Qantu Wayta community bank are from the Vischonogo community in the Province of VilcasH.. This community is located 3 hours from the Ayacucho city, and is at an altituD. of 2,900 feet above sea level. It is a tourist zone because of the ruins of the Intihuatana and the Intihuatana Lake. Agriculture is the primary activity. This includes growing potatoes, corn, and barley; and raising cattle. Gardenia is a single mother with a 7 year old son. Gardenia has a grocery store in her house. Her loan will be used to buy groceries to better stock her business. Gardenia dreams of saving to get ahead, improving her business, and her son completing his studies. Isabel is a single mother with 2 children, 8 and 10. Isabel sells grains that she buys in the community. When she was little she learned this activity from her mother. Her loan will be used to buy grains. Isabel’s dream is to educate her children and to buy a grain mill. Saturnina is married, and her children are grown. Saturnina and her husband buy animals in different communities. Later, they benefit by selling the meat in their community. They have plans to buy more animals with the loan. Saturnina’s dreams are to continue seeing to the well being of her children and to save for old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the members to invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena O. is forty years old. He is married and has five kids. He lives with his family in their own house at Oda, a farming community in eastern Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. Kwabena has been a photographer for the past nine years. Photography has been his major occupation and the main source of income for his family. He owns a photography shop where his clients pose for their photographs. He also works at parties and concerts, where he takes photographs and videos of his clients. He would use the loan to buy tools and materials--a camera, flash bulbs, film, a video camera, etc--to expand the services he offers. Expanded services would generate more income and improve his family's standard of living. He is a member of the “Mawuli” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans and provide support and assistance in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy a camera, film, flash bulbs, and a video camera

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice Y. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has five kids who attend primary school. Alice lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda, in eastern Ghana. Many people here are engaged in farming. However, some of the women, including Alice, are involved in the production of palm oil. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from local farmers in her community; processes it in her house to produce the oil, and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit that is cooked, pounded, sieved, and boiled for hours. The reddish oil is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. Alice would use the loan to buy the palm fruits in bulk so as to supply more customers. 

She believes the loan would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually improve her family finances. She is a member of the “Mawuli” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each other's loans and support each other in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is sixty-five years old. She is married and has six children. Currently, all her children are out of  school and independent. Rebecca’s husband is a farmer. Rebecca, her husband, and two grandchildren live in the  family home, in the town of Oda, in eastern Ghana. Most of the people of Oda are either farmers or sell agricultural products. Very few people have non-farming businesses. 

Rebecca is a baker and also sells in second-hand clothing. She buys fabric and second-hand clothes, including bed linens and men's and women's clothing, from Kumasi, a nearby city. She sells these items from a stand in the Oda market square. She also travels to nearby markets to sell her wares. Rebecca has been in this business for thirty-five years now and is asking for a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy fabric and clothing in bulk. 

She believes the loan would help her to expand to other market centers and eventually help improve her family's standard of living. She is a member of the “Ntoboase” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each other's loans and support each other in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Salon Marlboro Group

texts.fr: Le salon de coiffure Marlboro est managé par Madame Bodien W. au quartier Boucotte de Ziguinchor. C'est un centre de formation aussi pour jeune fille à côté des prestations de services (mariages et autres coiffures de cérémonie). Madame W. et ses associées veulent renforcer par ce crédit leur salon et être plus attractive au regard de la concurrence.
texts.en:
Marlboro is a hair salon managed by Ms. Bodien W. in the Boucotte district of Ziguinchor. Aside from the range of services provided (hairstyles for marriages and for other special occasions), the salon is also a training center for girls. Ms. W. and her associates want to use this loan to bolster their salon and to be more attractive with regard to the competition.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hair salon

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four kids. She says three are currently in school and one is learning a trade. She lives with her family in their own house in Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Florence works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Florence is a petty trader. She sells beef, ground nuts, vegetable oil, etc., on a tabletop in the community market.

She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of beef, ground nuts, vegetable oil and assorted food spices to expand her business. She hopes to make good income from the expanded business to enable her to provide support to her husband in taking care of the children in school.

She is a member of the community group called “Abotare” (translates to patience). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. is fifty-six years old. She is a married woman and has three children. Currently, two of them have graduated from school and the last is pursuing education in junior-high school. Ama’s husband is a welder by profession. He farms as well. Ama and the family live at a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business.

Ama trades in secondhand textiles. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of secondhand clothes including bedspreads, ladies’ wear and men’s wear, etc. from Accra, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. She has been in this business for three years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales.

loans.use: To buy bales of second hand textiles

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is forty-three years old. She is married and the mother of four kids who are in the junior-high and basic schools. Grace’s husband works as a laborer with a timber company. Grace and her family live at a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business.

Grace trades in cosmetics. She buys cosmetics such as powder, assorted pomades, make-ups, etc. from Accra, a nearby city and sells in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for three years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

Grace believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and, eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Hwe Nyame” (translated: Look unto the Lord) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk for her business

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha B. is 33 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, currently pursuing education in the primary school. She lives with the children in a family house in Oda, which is a farming as well as a commercial community in the eastern region of Ghana.

Agartha loves trading, which is the business by which she makes a living. She trades in tomatoes and other vegetables on a tabletop in the local market. She buys boxes of tomatoes, peppers, etc., from farmers who come from surrounding villages to sell at affordable prices. She sells mostly to the food vendors in her community. She has been in business for six years.

Agartha would like a loan in order to to buy vegetables in larger quantities so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure tomatoes in bulk.

loans.name: Hanson

texts.en:
Hanson B., 55, is the married father of seven children: five are out of school and independent and two are still pursuing education at the senior high school. He is a dealer of car spare parts and scraps. He buys his supplies from spare parts dealers and sells these in retail to his customers.

He enjoys his trade very much. However, he is handicapped by low working capital and is finding it difficult to succeed in the climate of general economic hardship. He therefore needs a loan to remain in business. He wants to use the loan to buy a new stock of spare parts and scraps to serve his customers. He believes this will enable him to make good income in order to expand his business.

Hanson is a member of the community group called the “Mawuli” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and as peer pressure to repay the loan.

Hanson is in the photo taken during his group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts and scraps.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El señor Vicente y su esposa la señora Norma Alicia son comerciantes desde hace 3 años y sus ingresos se adquieren através de la venta de muebles usados para el hogar pero en excelentes condiciones; ellos cuentan ya con una cartera de clientes pero también van a distintas partes de las cercanías de nuestra ciudad. 
Son una familia estable y trabajadora que día a día luchan ya que buscan la manera de salir adelante. 
En estos momentos el señor Vicente está tramitando el crédito para invertir en la compra de más mercancía y asi incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vicente and his wife, Norma Alicia, have been merchants for three years and make their income by selling used home furniture in excellent condition. They already have a customer base but also go to outlying suburbs of their city.

They are a stable, working family, fighting day after day to find a way to get ahead.

Today, Vicente is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise in order to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment (Used furniture sales)

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
El Hadji F. est un boucher, son exploitation "La Belle Viande" est situéee à 200 m du marché centrale de Ziguinchor. Ce pére de famille vit de son activité qu'il souhaite renforcer par ce prêt.
Avec ce crédit il compte augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et surtout répondre à la demande des clients de plus en plus nombreux.
texts.en:
El Hadji F. is a butcher. His business is located 200 meters from the central market of Ziguinchor. This father with a family makes his living by his business, which he would like to bolster through this loan. He plans to increase his turnover and especially to respond to the continually growing number of customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Butcher shop

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one child. She sells women's shoes at the central market in Kherson. Her kiosk is located in a very good place where many people come by. Olga always offers good inventories at affordable prices and excellent client service. She builds relationships with her clients and they come back.

Olga desires to be independent in her life and her business. Olga would like to borrow 12,680 UAH to increase her assortment. She would spend additional income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of women's shoes

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El señor José Alberto vive con su esposa la señora Martha que se dedica de lleno al hogar. 
El trabaja en una empresa como operador con un ingreso estable, teniendo una antigüedad de 4 años, cuentan con dos hijos a los cuales les brindan una buena educación. 
Ella tiene un proyecto que es el iniciar un negocio de abarrotes ya que dentro del área de donde viven seria un buen  sector comercial. 	
Este es el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
José Alberto lives with his wife, Martha, who is a housewife.

He works as an operator in a business with a stable income. He has been there for four years, which offers his two children a good education.

She would like to start a grocery business, since they live in an area with a good commercial sector.

This is their motive for requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin a grocery business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent Brako is the 33-year-old married mother of a child who is currently in school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a farming community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Millicent trades in assorted plastic materials such as bowls, basins, spoons, buckets etc., procuring her products from wholesalers in nearby big towns such as Accra, the national capital. Selling in the market square and hawking as well, Millicent aspires to increase her stock so she can trek to other towns to sell. She has been in this business for seven years and is requesting a loan to purchase more plastics to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase assorted plastics.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro tiene una familia integrada por su esposa la señora Ma. D. los Ángeles, su hijo Yoc quienes ayudan para los gastos familiares. 
El señor Ramiro es albañil independiente desD. hace 6 años. La señora venD. productos por catalogo y Yoc (hijo) trabaja para un negocio que se dedican a la colocación D. vidrios, puertas y ventanas. 
Ellos le han ido haciendo mejoras a su casita ya que cuentan con la mano D. obra (Sr. Ramiro), pero le quieren construir un techito en el frente D. su casa para darle otra vista (remodelación) , motivo por el cual solicitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Ramiro’s family is maD. up of his wife, Maria D. los Angeles, and his son, Yoc. They help with the family expenses. Ramiro has been an independent bricklayer for 6 years. His wife is in catalog sales. Yoc works for a glass, window and door installation company. They have been making improvements to their small house. They count on Ramiro for the labor, but they want to build a small roof in the front of the house to give it a new look (remodel). That is why he is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a roof

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur, Matilda A., 50, takes care of her five children. Three are in basic school and one has not started school yet. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with the children and her husband, a farmer, in their own house at Oda, a farming community in the Eastern region of Ghana. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for eight years now.

Matilda is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall in the community market. Her grocery products sell almost as fast as she can purchase them. Also, she will be adding slippers and plastics to her store to diversify her trading.

Matilda is a member of the community group called “Suban pa” (translated as "Good Character"). Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mamadou Saliou

texts.fr:
Mamadou Saliou D. tient un commerce de détail au quartier Château d'Eau de Ziguinchor; Ce pére de famille de tois enfants sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son commerce et augmenter ses bénéfices.
Il a jusqu'ici travailler sur fonds propres et souhaite prendre un envol.
texts.en:
Mamadou Saliou D. runs a retail shop in the Château d'Eau neighborhood in Ziguinchor. This father of three is seeking a loan to bolster his business and increase his profits. He's been relying on his own funding until now, and wishes to take off.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Castellón se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos el cual posee en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido su negocio en buen estado por lo que ha adquirido materiales de trabajo como vitrinas y mejora del local.

Actualmente la señora Blanca requiere de un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y de esta manera continuar adelante en su negocio llevando el sustento a su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Castellón dedicates herself diligently to the business of food preparation and sales, which she conducts in her own shop in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo. She has forged ahead with a lot of effort, and has managed to maintain her business in good condition, purchasing display cases and improving her shop. Currently, Mrs. Blanca needs a loan to purchase raw materials to for food preparation, thus forging ahead in her business and providing her household with the livelihood and support it needs from her.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Janeth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Janeth Pérez desde hace 14 años inició su negocio de ferretería ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua donde a diario atiende muy amablemente ofreciendo todo tipo de productos ferreteros en su localidad.

Actualmente a ella se le han agotado algunos productos y requiere comprarlos. Entre estos productos se encuentran candados, tubos pvc y accesorios para el hogar. Es por esto que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y así continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Mrs. Janeth Pérez started her hardware business 14 years ago in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo, which she tends daily, kindly offering all types of hardware products in her shop. Currently, she’s run out of certain products and needs to purchase more. Some of the items needed are locks, PVC pipes and accessories for the home. This is why she is asking for Ceprodel’s help to get a loan, so she can purchase more hardware products and continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware products and home accessories

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Vidal A. se ha destacado como vendedor de productos lácteos como lo son el queso, quesillo y crema siendo comercializados en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo donde atiende diariamente.

Sus sueños son desarrollarse cabalmente en su negocio y es por eso que hoy en día al ver la necesidad de adquirir la materia prima ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para que se le brinde un crédito y de esta forma comercializar el queso, quesillo y la crema y así seguir manteniendo su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Vidal A. has proven successful in selling dairy products such as cheese, quesillo and cream in the shop he tends daily in the Mercado de Mayoreo. His dream is to fully develop his business, which is why today he is looking for purchase raw materials with the help of a loan from Ceprodel. This way he can continue to sell cheese, quesillo and cream and maintain his humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Vilma C. se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio de venta de productos diversos como lo son productos de plástico y también de madera para realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

Ella se dedica arduamente a su  negocio y a diario es visitada por clientes que adquieren sus productos. Hoy en día la razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los productos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio y satisfacer plenamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo, Mrs. Vilma C. tends her small business selling various products such as plastic goods, as well as wooden items used for household chores. She dedicates herself fully to her business and is visited daily by customers who are looking to purchase her goods. Today, she has come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan so she can purchase more merchandise, this way she can move forward with her business and continue to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Yuri Yamileth

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Yuri O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de cosméticos el cual posee desde hace tres años habiéndolo desarrollado satisfactoriamente en su localidad.

Actualmente, como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de la inversión para su crecimiento y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de dichos cosméticos y también para la compra de mochilas con el propósito de comercializarlas en su localidad y así mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
For three years now, Ms. Yuri O. has dedicated herself to the business of selling cosmetics in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo, which has developed successfully in this location. Now, as with all developing businesses, investment is required for its growth. This is why she has requested a loan from Ceprodel, which she will use to purchase more cosmetics, as well as backpacks, which she intends to sell in her shop in order to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto Juárez es un señor comerciante que desde que a el lo liquidaron de su anterior trabajo con el dinero que le otorgaron, lo utilizó para invertir en una tienda de abarrotes. Esta tienda “MISCELANEA GAEL” ya tiene mas de tres años el cual esta bien surtida, pero el quiere implementar mas artículos para que el cliente tenga todo lo que necesite. El vende mercancía de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, refrescos, etc. Para poder realizar su proyecto de inversión necesita capital para lograr sus nuevos objetivos y así tener más ventas y ganancias para el sostén de la familia.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto Juárez is a merchant. With the money he received from the liquidation of his previous work he invested in a grocery store. The store, “Miscelanea Gael”, has been open for more than three years. It is well stocked, but he wants to carry more items so that his customers have all that they need. He sells groceries, fruit, vegetables, beverages, etc. To be able to complete his project he needs more capital. Then he will have more sales and increased income for family sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: La Fortaleza, Group 4

texts.en:
Armanda O. is the representative of this group of five micro entrepreneurs. She started her business a year ago. She took a first loan of 8000 pesos (about 220 dollars) and is applying now for a second loan of 10000 pesos (about 277 dollars).

She is a seamstress and makes bedding items such as bedspreads, sheets, pillowcases and curtains. She makes different models to offer her customers when she visits them, but also accepts special requests. Her clients can pay her cash or take credit. In this case she arranges payment plans with her customers.

Armanda says that "preoccupations never cease to exist." She finds it challenging to sell enough merchandise to complete her loan payments and generate profits. She envisions her business as a house store with more variety. She wants to have a shop with employees that sew for her, and a secretary to take the orders. She would want to do this venture with her other group friends as business partners.

Please help us support Armanda and her friends. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase sheet and bedspread fabric, foamed fabric, zippers for cushions, lace for bedspreads and pillowcases, ground foam to fill pillows.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82760
Epifanía  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta.
Epifanía es casada tiene 61 años cinco hijos que ya están  casados.
Epifanía es D. Huanuco, estudio costura, actualmente cose peluches, ella empezó vendiendo kerosén, cerveza y gaseosa y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio, actualmente tiene su BODEGA PATRICIA, su esposo le ayudará por un tiempo, por que le han detectado cáncer Terminal, esto ocasiona muchos gastos, pero Epifanía confía en Dios.   
Epifanía necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. bolsas D.  fideos  y sacos D. arroz, azúcar.
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió como manejar el negocio, tratar bien a la clientela, los créditos han sido D. mucha ayuda para surtir su tienda. 
El sueño D. Epifanía es dejar un negocio estable para su hija  menor.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a member of the Teresa D. Calcuta (Mother Teresa) Communal Bank. She is 61 years of age and married with five children, all of whom are married. Epifanía is from Huanuco and has studied sewing. Currently she makes stuffed animals. She began selling kerosene, beer and carbonated drinks and little by little her business grew. It's now called Bodega Patricia. Her husband was helping her for a while, until he was diagnosed with terminal cancer. This has resulted in many expenses, but Epifanía puts her trust in God. Epifanía needs a loan of 1,200 Sols to buy packets of noodles, sacks of rice, and sugar. Since she has been with FINCA Peru she has learned how to manage the business and to treat her customers well. The loans have helped greatly to sustain the store. Epifanía dreams of being able to leave a stable business to her young daughter. First Loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82760

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 42 años de edad, es casada hace 9 años, tiene 5 hijos ya mayores que no viven en su casa. Junto a su esposo han educado a cada uno de sus hijos mediante la agricultura, gracias a sus cultivos, sus hijos tuvieron la oportunidad de lograr una carrera técnica, la cual ahora les sirve como soporte para el bienestar de sus propias familias. Durante años han sembrado papa y alverjas, estos dos cultivos han sido muy rentables, por ello está muy contenta y agradecida con la tierra, porque dice que gracias a la tierra y a Dios sus cultivos le han dado muy buenos frutos. Ahora que partieron sus hijos en busca de otras miras, ella y su esposo se sienten muy felices por los logros obtenidos, además ya no tienen la carga de seguir trabajando arduamente para sostener a una familia numerosa. Pero esta pareja tiene hecha su vida en la agricultura, a la cual le tienen mucho cariño, sus hijos les han propuesto dejar la chacra, pero ellos prefieren quedarse ahí por ser parte de su vida y aman sus tierras. En los ciclos anteriores, Catalina se desempeñó como vocal de su banco comunal, cursa su 7mo ciclo de préstamo con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha venido trabajando con mucha responsabilidad en las cuotas fijadas. El dinero que viene solicitando en esta oportunidad, lo derivará en la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado correspondiente de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 42 years old, has been married for 9 years, and has 5 adult children who no longer live at home. She and her husband provided for their children by farming—thanks to their crops, Catalina’s children had the opportunity to obtain technical degrees, which now serve them well in supporting their own families. Throughout the years Catalina and her husband have grown potatoes and peas; both of these crops are very profitable, and Catalina gives thanks to the land and to God for providing them with such good crops. Now that their children have gone off on their own, Catalina and her husband are very happy about their achievements. Although the couple is no longer responsible for supporting a large family through their hard work, they made their living through farming and have much affection for that way of life. Their children have suggested that they leave the farm, but Catalina and her husband prefer to stay because the farm has been an important part of their life and they love the land. In previous loan cycles Catalina worked as a member of a communal bank, and she is now in her 7th loan cycle with Kiva partner MFP; she has worked very responsibly the whole time to make her loan payments. Catalina plans to use the money she is requesting at this time to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - 9 Group

texts.en:
This group of five entrepreneurs is taking its first loan with Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. Ylaria M. is the group representative. She originally sold bedding items. However, during January and February, her bedding business decreased in sales. So she decided to take a loan to start selling undergarments. She thought this would be an interesting sales experience.

She plans on selling the undergarments she purchases with her loan to all her current clients ''and anyone else who wants.'' Her future plan is to set up a decoration shop, as big and equipped as she wants it. She plans to continue selling her decoration items and bedding in the future.

So far, she hasn't had problems with customers that have unpaid past due amounts after purchasing on credit. ''I know who I make business with,'' she says. All her customers are reliable people who make their payments on time. She hopes this good relationship with her clients will continue as she diversifies into another sales branch.

Please help us support these new entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: purchasing underwear to add to bedding sales

loans.name: Flor De Alheli Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Flor de Alelí son de la comunidad de Ccachubamba, Distrito de Vischongo, Provincia de Vilcashuaman, departamento de Ayacucho.
La comunidad esta a una distancia de 3 horas del distrito de Ayacucho, a 3220 m.s.n.m, las actividades principales de la comunidad son la agricultura, produciendo tubérculos, cereales, también se dedican a la agricultura.

Guillermina es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 8 años, Guillermina tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza hace 6 años con l ayuda de su esposo. Con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar mas mercadería y surtir con útiles de escritorio, por campaña escolar. Guillermina sueña con mejorar su negocio, comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Huamanga y educar a sus hijos.

Dina es casada, tiene 04 hijos, Dina se dedica a la venta de cereales que compra en su comunidad, actividad que aprendió de su mama. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara cereales porque es época de cosecha, los sueños de Dina son compra un carro para transportar sus productos.

Felicitas es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, Felicitas tiene una bodega en su casa que se ubica al borde de la carretera, vende abarrotes en general y ademas vende ollas, platos, etc. Felicitas se separo de su esposo porque la maltrataba mucho, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara abarrotes, los sueños de Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the Flor de Alelí Communal Bank are from the community of Ccachubamba, Vischongo District, Vilcashuaman Province, Department of Ayacucho. The community is some three hours away from Ayacucho at an altitude of 3,220 meters (10,560 feet) above sea level. The principal activities in the area are agricultural, growing potatoes and grains, which is also what these members are doing. Guillermina is living with her domestic partner and has two children ages six and eight. She has a small store in her house where she sells groceries. She has been doing this for six years with the assistance of her husband. She plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise and to stock up on school supplies for the educational campaign. Guillermina hopes to build up her business, to buy some land in the city of Huamanga and to educate her children. Dina is married and has four children. She sells cereals which she buys in her community, a trade that she learned from her mother. She will use this loan to buy grains because this is the harvest season. Dina dreams of being able to buy a car to transport her products. Felicitas is a single mother with six children. She separated from her husband because he greatly mistreated her. She has a small store in her house which is located next to the highway. She sells groceries and also pots and pans, dishes, etc. She will buy groceries with the loan which she receives. Felicitas' dream is for her children to become professional people and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be invested by the members in their businesses.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es: Hermenegildo tiene 55 años, es casado, tuvo 12 hijos, fallecieron 5, ahora vive con uno de ellos. Desde su infancia se dedicó a la agricultura de forma artesanal, a través de esta actividad pudo educar a todos sus hijos y brindar el bienestar a su familia. Pero lo que nunca pudo controlar son las plagas ocasionadas por mucha lluvia; en consecuencia, nos comenta su melancolía al ver afectada su chacra de su papa, ahora su producción no será como él se había propuesto; por ello, hoy los sentimientos de tristeza nublan el brillo de sus ojos. Hermenegildo cortará las hojas de la papa con la ayuda de su esposa para evitar perder en su totalidad el cultivo, y una vez que logre cosechar la ofrecerá como semilla, y espera cotizarla a un precio considerable para cubrir la educación de su último hijo, quien lo apoya en sus labores agrícolas. Hermenegildo tiene la cualidad de ser muy responsable, no sólo en los pagos a MFP, sino también en cada uno de los acuerdos en su banco comunal, este es su 7mo crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papa y alverjas.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 55, is married, and had 12 children, although 5 of them have passed away. He now lives with one of them. Since his childhood he has worked in agriculture. Through this work, he was able to educate all of his children and offer well-being to his family. But what he never could control were the occasional plagues caused by a lot of rain. As a consequence, he told us he is sad because his potato crop has been affected. Now his production won't be as good as he thought, so his sadness has made his normally bright eyes cloudy. Hermenegildo will cut the leaves of his potatoes with the help of his wife to avoid losing his entire crop. Once he harvests them, he will sell them as seeds. He hopes to be quoted a good price so he can cover the educational expenses of his youngest son, who helps him with his agricultural work. Hermenegildo is very responsible, not only with his payments to Microfinanzas Prisma, but also with each one of his agreements with his communal bank. This is his seventh loan. The money that he is requesting will go towards chemical fertilizers for his next planting of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Corina Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Corina Leonor O. Orbegoso tiene 59 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor, vive en el caserío Lluin del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo grado de primaria, le hubiese gustado seguir estudiando pero lamentablemente no tuvo apoyo departe de su familia.
Se casó a los 26  años y tuvo dos hijos, de los cuales uno falleció.
Corina tiene una panadería y una bodega donde vende golosinas, pasteles y pan, su trabajo empieza a las tres de la mañana para poder aprovechar el tiempo.
Su primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró insumos para su panadería.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que cancelará en 6 cuotas comprará insumos para la panadería y  para su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Señora Corina Leonor O. Orbegoso is 59 and belongs to the communal bank, "Buen Pastor" (Good Pastor). She lives in the town of Lluin, in the district of Mache, in the province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied through second grade. She would have liked to keep studying, but unfortunately she didn't have her family's support. She got married when she was 26 and had two children, one of whom passed away. Corina has a bakery and a grocery store where she sells candy, cakes, and bread. She starts working at 3 a.m. to make the most of her time. Her first credit was for 300 PEN, which was paid off in 4 months. She used it to purchase supplies for her bakery. With this credit of 800 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase supplies for her bakery and her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy supplies for her bakery and small grocery store

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: Julián de 28 años de edad, vive hace 5 años con su pareja con la que tiene 2 hijos, hace unos meses vivían en la casa de sus suegros, pero ahora está muy feliz de mudarse a su casa propia. Desde muy niño le han gustado las labores agrícolas, cuando su padre alistaba las yuntas para arar sus chacras él se emocionaba mucho, porque su reto era domar a los toros para arar cada una de las chacras. Ahora convertido en un hombre muy responsable, cada uno de sus cultivos los realiza con mucho cariño y esmero. En años anteriores se dedicaba mayormente a la siembra de papa, pero por falta de presupuesto aminoró la cantidad y ahora siembra más alverjas porque este cultivo le resulta más rentable. Además, cuando tiene tiempo aprovecha en trabajar en los cultivos de sus vecinos, quienes le pagan de 18 a 20 soles diarios, con este dinero cubre los gastos de la canasta familiar, mientras que el dinero de las cosechas lo guarda para que vuelva a sembrar. Los sueños de Julián son de mejorar su situación económica e implementar su hogar con los artículos básicos necesarios. Julián es una persona callada en las reuniones de su banco comunal, quien siempre opina es su  esposa. Este es el 7mo préstamo consecutivo que viene trabajando con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no caído en morosidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de alverjas.
texts.en:
Julián is 28 and has lived with his wife for 5 years. They have 2 children together. A few months ago, they lived in his inlaws' house, but now he is very happy to have moved to their own house. Since he was very young, he has liked working in agriculture. When his father prepared the oxen to plow his land, he got very excited because his job was to break in the bulls to plow each one of the plots of land. Now he is a very responsible man, and he grows his crops with a lot of care. In previous years, he mainly grew potatoes, but because they weren't very profitable, he lessened the quantity that he grew of them and now grows more peas because they are more profitable. Also, when he has time, he helps his neighbors with their crops, and they pay him 18 to 20 PEN every day. With this money, he can cover the cost of his family's food and he can put the money from his harvests towards the next season's planting. Julián's dream is to improve his economic situation and to furnish his home with the basic necessary items. Julián is quiet in his communal bank's meetings; his wife is the one who always voices her opinion. This is his seventh consecutive loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. In all this time he has not defaulted. The money that he is requesting will go towards buying fertilizer for his pea crop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - Group 3

texts.en:
Juana R. is the group representative of these five entrepreneurs. Their group is part of a larger Bank of Hope that has 45 members in total (including them). Juana has requested a second loan, after successfully paying her first loan with Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. She has two small businesses: she sells clothing (which she started with her first loan) and has a candy stand (which she will expand with this loan; she started it with profits from her clothing sales).

Juana explains that the reason for having two businesses is to balance her sales. Although clothing sales are less frequent, the profits are larger. However, in the candy stand, she sells every day, which gives her good pocket money. She finds that after her first loan, her business is doing better. This was the main reason she took the second loan: to expand her sales capacity. She would like to take her two businesses to a larger scale: set up a clothing store and be a candy distributor in her area.

Juana obviously dreams big—she says dreams keep the businesswoman alive. Please help us to continue supporting her endeavors, along with her group mates. Thank you.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses and sandals for clothing business; buy lollipops, gum and caramels for small candy stand (side business)

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Maria Marlene P. V. tiene 53 años vive en el distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no continuo estudiando debido a que se caso y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar. Tiene 04 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
María tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo gaseosa y cerveza, con el tiempo fue ampliando su negocio con la venta de abarrotes y ahora tiene una bodega muy surtida, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 6 años con las ganancias que a obtenido a podido comprar una vitrina y andamios para su bodega, negocio que desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de cerveza y abarrotes para su bodega.
