María sueña con construir su casa y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora María Marlene P. V. is 53 and lives in the district of Paijan, in the province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad in Perú. She studied through high school and didn't continue studying because she got married and had to take care of her home. She has 4 children, none of whom still depend on her financially. María has a grocery store and started her business selling soft drinks and beer. With time, she expanded her business by selling groceries and now has a store with a lot of variety. She also has sold beauty products for 6 years. With her profits she has been able to buy a display case and shelves for her store, a business that she has in her own home. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her communal bank, "Manos Unidas" (United Hands), she invested in the purchase of soft drinks and candy. With this credit of 1,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and groceries for her store. María dreams about building her own home and having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and groceries for her store

loans.name: Yvon Mireyna

texts.es:
La señora Yvon Mireyna U. M. tiene 25 años, vive en Saucipe, distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Computación e Informática, carrera que abandono al salir embarazada y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Yvon se dedica a la venta de ropa, al inicio se dedicó a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa interior durante casi 4 años hasta que decidió empezar la venta de polos, jeans, camisa, así como zapatos, este negocio le da muchas ganancias y le ha permitido comprar sus electrodomésticos para su hogar, también se dedica a la siembra de panca en sociedad con su esposo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para aumentar  su capital.  
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de ropa  e insumos para la siembra de panca.
Yvon tiene el sueño de construir su casa y tener una tienda de ropa.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs Yvon Mireyna U. M. is 25 and lives in Saucipe in the District Paijan, Ascope Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied Computer Science , a career she abandoned when she got pregnant and had to devote herself to her home. She has two small children who depend entirely on her. Yvon sells clothes. Initially she focused on selling beauty products and under garments for almost 4 years until she decided to start selling polos, jeans, shirts and shoes. This business gives her good profits and has allowed her to buy appliances for her home. She also works with her husband to grow maize. Her business developed at home. With the first loan of 300 soles she received from her community bank "Manos Unidas", she purchased beauty products to increase her stock. With the loan of 1700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase clothing and supplies for planting maize. Yvon dreams of building her house and having a clothing store. She belongs to "a glass of milk" in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and supplies for planting maize

loans.name: Jose Paz

texts.es:
La esposa del señor José Paz aparece en la fotografía ya que el trabaja doble turno en la escuela mañana y tarde. El trabaja como maestro por más de ocho años y su esposa siempre se ha dedicado al cuidado de sus hijos como al hogar.
El profesor piensa en el patrimonio y comodidad de la familia por lo que con el tiempo primero construyó una barda y piso firme en la parte de atrás de su casa, ahora ve la oportunidad de poner losa y así hacer un cuarto más para ampliarse por que su familia es grande es padre de 3 hijos que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
The wife of Mr. José Paz appears in the picture because he works double shifts at the school morning and afternoon. He has worked as a teacher for over eight years and his wife has always been dedicated to caring for their children and home. The teacher thinks of the well-being and comfort of his family and started out building a strong wall and floor in the back of his house. He now sees an opportunity to add a stone floor and another room to expand his house for his large family, since he is the father of 3 children who need their own space.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install stone floor and expand house

loans.name: Amada Flor

texts.es:
La señora Amada Flor Luján D. Z. tiene 54 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor, vive en el caserío D. Lluin distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta segundo año D. educación secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque no tuvo apoyo familiar. Se casó D. 22 años y tiene 4 hijos.
Se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan.  Empieza su trabajo desD. la 1 D. la madrugada, para poder abastecer con el pan para el desayuno.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles cancelados en 4 cuotas compró insumos para la panadería.
Con este crédito D. 2,000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará harina, manteca y levadura.
Amada sueña con tener una gran panadería que no solo abastezca para su zona sino hasta Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs Amada Flor Luján D. Z. is 54 and belongs to the Good Shepherd community bank. She lives in the village of Lluin in the District of Mache, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed the second year of secondary education, but did not continue in school because she had no support from her family. She married at 22 and has 4 children. She makes and sells bread. She begins her work at 1 am to be able to supply bread for breakfast. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, she bought supplies for the bakery. With this loan of 2000 soles which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will purchase flour, butter and yeast. Amada dreams of having a large bakery that not only supplies her area but all the way to Trujillo,

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter and yeast

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 39 años, es casada hace 15 años y tiene 3 hijos. De una personalidad activa y muy trabajadora, sus padres la criaron bajo las labores agrícolas; pero desde que se casó, su esposo labora en la chacra  y ella está dedicada a atender su bodega que ya tiene cerca de 15 años. Asimismo, brinda almuerzos para algunos profesores de la escuela primaria y del colegio de su localidad. Lucinda se levanta a las 4.00am para que a las 7.00am los desayunos ya estén listos, después alimenta a los cerdos que cría; pero sin dejar de atender su bodega, y a las 11.00am tiene todo listo para sus recibir a sus comensales. Su negocio de venta de cerdos le es muy rentable, ya que los alimenta con el resto de la cosecha de papa y cuando obtienen el peso necesario, los sacrifica y vende su carne a los mercados. Por otro lado, la atención de su bodega, también le da satisfacciones porque obtienen ganancias diarias y puede conversar amenamente con cada uno de sus clientes. El esposo de Lucinda es uno de los fundadores de su banco comunal, y ella ingresó como socia titular debido a la ausencia de su esposo. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo, ambos demostraron puntualidad en los pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mercadería para su bodega, asimismo, ingredientes para el preparado de los menús para sus pensionistas.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 39 years old, has been married for 15 years, and has 3 children. Linda is a very active and hard-working woman; her parents brought her up doing farm work, but since she’s been married her husband has worked on the farm while she makes a living attending to her grocery store, which she has had for about 15 years. She also provides lunches for some of the teachers at the local primary school and high school. Lucinda rises at 4:00 AM so that her breakfasts will be ready at 7:00 AM, after which she feeds the pigs she is raising—all the while attending to her grocery store—and at 11:00 AM she has everything ready for her customers. Her business of selling pigs is very profitable, since she feeds the pigs with what’s left of the potato crop, and when they reach the necessary weight she slaughters them and sells the meat at markets. However, the store is her main focus, and it gives her much satisfaction because she gets daily profits and is able to chat pleasantly with each of her customers. Lucinda’s husband is one of the founders of their communal bank, and she joined as a member due to her husband’s absence. This is Lucinda’s 7th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and all this time both she and her husband have been punctual in making their payments. Lucinda plans to use the money she is requesting to purchase merchandise for her grocery store and, at the same time, ingredients for preparing meals for her lodgers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Las Rosas De Manallasac Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Rosas D. Manallasacc son D. L. comunidad D. Manallasacc, Distrito D. Chiara, Provincia D. Huamanga, L. comunidad se ubica a 2 horas D. L. ciudad D. Huamanga, a 3400 m.s.n.m., las actividades principales D. L. comunidad son L. agricultura y ganadería.

Celestina es casada, sus hijos son ya mayores D. edad, Celestina tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, actividad que realiza hace muchos años, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprará abarrotes y artículos D. ferretería, los sueños D. Celestina son viajar y ahorrar los suficiente.

Nicolaza es casada, Nicolaza se dedica a L. compra y venta D. quesos, además D. venta D. cereales, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. útiles escolares que venderá en L. feria D. su comunidad. El sueño D. Nicolaza es construir su casa en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Vanesa es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos D. 4, 6  años, Vanesa iniciará con L. venta D. gelatinas y chupetes, su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. gelatinas, elL. espera que su negocio mejore.
texts.en:
The members of the Rosas D. Manallasacc Communal Bank are from the community of Manallasacc, Chiara District, Province of Huamanga. The community is located two hours from the city of Huamanga at 3,400 meters (11,150 feet) above sea level. The principal activities of the community are agriculture and raising livestock. Celestina is married and her children are now adults. She has a grocery store which she has run for many years. She will use her loan to buy groceries and hardware. Celestina's dreams are to travel and to save up enough money. Nicolaza is married and devotes herself to buying and selling cheeses. She also sells grain which she learned from her parents. Her loan will be invested in buying school supplies which she will sell at her community's fair. Her dream is to build herself a house in the city of Ayacucho. Vanesa is a single mother with two children, ages four and six. Vanesa will begin by selling gelatinas (gelatin snacks) and lollipops. Her loan will be used to buy more gelatinas. She hopes that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the members' businesses.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa Rodríguez R. de Ruiz tiene 69 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en Agallpampa distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Solamente estudió el primer grado de primaria y ya no continuó por falta de apoyo familiar.
Carmen Rosa es casada desde muy joven y tiene 7 hijos, los cuales ya han formado su propia familia.
Se dedica a la compra - venta de animales pequeños, como cuyes y aves de corral.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas emprendió el negocio que actualmente tiene.
Con este crédito de 100 soles que cancelará en 4 cuota seguirá trabajando en lo mismo, comprando otros animales para vender (diversas aves de corral).
Carmen Rosa sueña con tener un trabajo mucho más grande del que actualmente tiene y abastecer con cuyes a mayor cantidad de gente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa R. R. de Ruiz is 69 years old. She is a member of Mujeres del Manana Communal Bank and lives in Agallpampa District, Otuzco in the State of La Libertad, Peru.

Her schooling stopped after the first grade of elementary school for lack of support from her family. She got married very young and has seven children. They all have their own families.

She buys and sells guinea pigs and poultry. She opened her present business with the first loan of 300 soles that repaid in four installments. She will continue her buying and selling with the requested loan of 100 soles and will repay it in four installments.

Carmen Rosa’s dream is to have a larger business and to provide more people with guinea pigs and poultry.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various poultry

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos R. D. G. tiene 62 años, vive en Saucipe, distrito D. Paijan,  provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do D. secundaria, no continuo estudiando debido a que sus padres no la quisieron apoyar. Tiene 09 hijos y ninguno depenD. D. ella económicamente.
Santos se dedica a la venta D. tejidos y la crianza D. animales, inició su negocio hace 18 años criando patos y pavos al mismo tiempo que tejía colchas y conjuntos para bebes, con el tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y sus animales los venD. en Trujillo, así como teje a pedido, con las ganancias que a obtenido empezo el negocio D. siembra D. maíz y espárrago en sociedad con su esposo, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. patos.   
Con el crédito D. 1100 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. patos, pollos, pavos y alimento balanceado.
Santos sueña con terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos R. D. G. is 62 years old. She lives in Saucipe, Paijan district, Ascope province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school but didn't continue because her parents did not want to support her. She has nine children and none of them depend on her financially.

Santos sells woven fabrics and raises animals. She started her business 18 years ago raising ducks and turkeys and at the same time she wove colchas (woven fabrics used as bedspreads, rugs, etc.) and outfits for babies. Her business has grown with time. She sells her animals in Trujillo and takes orders for her weavings. With her earnings she started a business planting corn and asparagus with her husband. Their business is located in their home.

With the first loan of 300 Peruvian nuevo soles that she received from her Communal "Manos Unidas" ("United Hands), she invested in buying ducks. With the loan of 1100 soles, which will be paid back in 6 months, she will invest in buying ducks, chickens, turkeys and animal feed. Santos dreams of finishing the construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ducks, chickens, turkeys, and animal feed

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: Macario tiene 44 años de edad, es casado hace de 12 años, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos vive fuera de casa. Desde su infancia estuvo dedicado a los cultivos agrícolas, ya que sus padres sembraban numerosas hectáreas de tubérculos como la papa y el olluco en terrenos de la comunidad. En esos terrenos que la comunidad les brindaba, a cambio, ellos retribuían en los trabajos para la  comunidad. Por ello que cuando formó familia lo primero que hizo fue inscribirse como comunero, para que de ese modo pueda seguir haciendo uso de los terrenos de cultivo, ya sean de regadío o temporales. Macario en todo este tiempo viene sembrando papas y alverjas, asimismo cría animales, y hace 2 años puso una bodega en su casa para que su esposa se dedicara a ella. Todos estos negocios, le causan gran satisfacción y complacencia, por ello pese a las dificultades de las plagas que acechan a sus cultivos sigue muy motivado de invertir y trabajar con mucho cariño en sus siembras, las cuales por muchos años le han brindado comodidad y bienestar a su hogar. Macario es el presidente de su banco comunal, donde conduce con mucha serenidad los diversos dilemas entre los integrantes. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y da ejemplo de puntualidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de insecticidas para controlar la plaga en sus cultivos de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Macario is 44 years old, has been married for 12 years and has 5 children, one of whom lives away from home. Since childhood he has worked in agriculture as his parents sowed tubers such as potatoes and ulluco on many hectares of community land. In areas where the community offered them land, they reciprocated by working for the community. As such, the first thing the family did was to register as commoners with joint tenure of the land so that they could continue cultivating it, whether irrigated or temporary. The whole time, Macario has been planting potatoes and peas, and at the same time rearing animals. Two years ago he put a grocery shop into his house so that his wife could run it. All of these businesses give him great joy and satisfaction so, despite the difficulties of pests threatening his crops, he remains highly motivated and dedicated, sowing his seeds with much care. For many years his crops have provided comfort and wellbeing for his family. Macario is the president of his community bank, where he promotes diplomacy during the various dilemmas amongst the members. This is his 7th loan with MFP and he is an example of punctual repayments. The money that he is asking for now is to buy insecticides to control the pests on his potato and broad bean crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos que viven en su casa. Para él, labrar la tierra es un arte, y lo cultiva con mucho cariño, antes de iniciar sus labores agrícolas primero observa el desarrollo de sus plantas, es ahí donde capta algunos males que puedan acechar, entonces trata de prevenir antes de que se expandan las plagas. En su proceso de cultivo primero siembra papa y abona con los fertilizantes, una vez cosechada, en seguida siembra alverjas, para que de ese modo se evite seguir abonando, por ello que la siembra de alverjas le resulta de poca inversión. Y los precios en el mercado generalmente se mantienen, sin afectar el capital de la inversión. De ese modo trata de sacarle todo el beneficio a cada una de las chacras con estos dos productos. Su mayor dificultad es no contar con terrenos propios. Sabino participa de todas las reuniones de pago, es el encargado de poner la picardía, pues sus compañeros celebran sus bromas. Este es su 7mo préstamo y en todo este tiempo ha venido trabajando con responsabilidad en cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra de papas, y con el resto comprará funguicidas para su chacra de alverjas, de ese modo ayudar en el follaje de esta.
texts.en:
Sabino is 38 years old, married and has two children who live at home. For him, working the land is an art and he cultivates it with great care. Before starting his agricultural labours he first observes the development of his plants, where he removes any bad ones that could threaten the rest, thereby trying to prevent the spread of pests in advance. His cultivation process is first to plant potatoes with an application of fertilizer, then he harvests them, and follows this by sowing peas. In this way he is able to avoid having to use fertilizer so the planting of peas results in a small investment. And market prices are generally stable, without affecting his capital investment. In this way, he tries to reap all of the benefits from each one of his farms with these two products. His greatest difficulty is that he does not own the land himself. Sabino participates in all the payment meetings. He is the funny man and his peers enjoy his jokes. This is his 7th loan and throughout all this time he has worked responsibly on every one of his quotas. The money he is requesting is to buy fertilizer for his next crop of potatoes and with the rest he will buy fungicides for his pea farm that will help leaf growth.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Deysi Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Deysi Guadalupe F. R. D. Rodríguez tiene 36 años es secretaria D. su banco comunal, vive en Saucipe, distrito D. Paijan,  provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 1ro D. secundaria, no continuo sus estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para poder educarla y se dedico a trabajar, tiene 03 hijos que dependen enteramente D. ella
Deysi se dedica a la venta D. embutidos y productos lácteos, al inicio se dedicaba a la venta D. alfajores, luego empezó con la venta D. embutidos y productos lácteos hace 5 años al principio vendía en pocas cantidades, pero ahora tiene muchos clientes que le compran su producto, el negocio le es muy rentable y lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos lácteos y embutidos.  
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos lácteos y embutidos para aumentar su capital.
Deysi tiene  el gran sueño D. comprar una en Trujillo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella pertenece al club D. Madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Deysi Guadalupe F. R. D. Rodríguez is 36 years old and is the secretary of her community bank. She lives in Saucipe, in the Paijan district of the Ascope province, La Libertad department, Peru. She studied up until the first year of secondary school but was unable to continue her studies as her parents did not have the means to be able to educate her so she went to work. She has 3 children who are entirely dependent upon her. Deysi sells sausages and dairy products. She began by selling traditional shortbread (alfajores) then started selling small quantities of sausages and dairy products 5 years ago. Now she has lots of customers who buy her products; the business is very profitable and she is developing it in her own home. She invested the first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that she received from her community bank “Manos Unidas” in the purchase of dairy products and sausages. With the loan of 1200 soles, which she will repay within 6 months, she will buy dairy products and sausages to increase her capital. Deysi has a grand dream of buying in Trujillo and that her children will be professionals. She belongs to the Mothers club in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products and sausages

loans.name: David

texts.es: David acaba de cumplir 40 años de edad, es casado hace 12 años y tiene 5 hijos. Desde niño aprendió los cuidados de cada uno de sus cultivos; como la papa, habas, cebada y alverjas. Desde que hizo familia, empezó también a criar ganado, que su esposa es la encargada de pastar. En estos últimos años está sembrando mayormente alverjas, por ser muy rentables y de poca inversión. A cada una de sus chacras las cuida delicadamente, con su mirada serena puesta en cada una de sus siembras observando su proceso. En todo este tiempo sus cultivos le brindaron el bienestar económico para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos, por eso David ama su trabajo y se siente muy orgulloso de labrar la tierra con sus propias manos. Y ahora que sus hijos han crecido, lo apoyan con sus cultivos, en consecuencia, tienen planes de  incrementar su producción y no sólo tener tierras de regadío, sino también tierras temporales. David es un cliente muy sereno y centrado en cada uno de las reuniones de pago con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, donde todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad y responsabilidad. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para el crecimiento de las alverjas, con la finalidad de apurar el proceso desarrollo de la planta.
texts.en:
David has just turned 40 years old, he has been married for 12 years and has 5 children. Since he was a boy he learned how to care for each of his crops such as potatoes, beans, barley and peas. When he began his family, he also began to raise livestock, which his wife is responsible for. In recent years he has been planting more peas because they are very profitable with little investment. At each of his small farms he delicately cares for them, his serene watch fixed on each of his plants watching their process.

Through all of this time his cultivations have given him financial well being for the support of his family and the education of his children. For this reason David loves his job and feels very proud to work the land with his own hands. And now that his children have grown, they help him with his cultivations and in consequence they have plans to increase their production and to not only have irrigated land but also temporary land.

David is a very serene client and is stable in his attendance at each repayment meeting of his communal bank along with the rest of the members. This is his seventh loan with MFP, where all of this time he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility. The money that he solicits is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for the cultivation of peas, with the purpose of speeding along the growth of the plants.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Marcos Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Marcos R. se dedica a laborar vendiendo ambulantemente en el Mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua ofertando gafas, lentes y relojes dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 15 años.

Actualmente requiere invertir en la compra de los productos para ofertarlos debido a que al estar en verano, las ventas de las gafas se aumenta porque muchas personas las adquieren para realizar sus visitas al mar. Es por esta razón que él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así proceder a su venta en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos R. works as a street vendor in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. He has sold sunglasses, glasses and watches for 15 years. Now he needs to invest in buying more products to resell because in the summertime, many people need sunglasses when they go to the beach. For this reason he has turned to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy these products and continue to sell in the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sunglasses

loans.name: Creciendo En Fe Bank Of Hope Group

texts.en:
Maria owns a small pharmacy. She will use her entire loan to buy medicines to restock her inventory. The medicines in greatest demand at her pharmacy are parasite medicines, multivitamins, medications for high blood pressure, cold medicines, acetaminophen and ampicillin. This is her second loan and she has seen a difference from the time she didn't have loans until now. She finds her business better equipped now. She wants to move her pharmacy to a more spacious location with a better view and with better exposure. She would like to have glass panes in the front of her store so people can see her pharmacy (and herself!) from the outside.

Ines sells ice cream. Her best-selling flavors are cream, apple, grape and raspberry. She also sells juice and snacks in a small cafeteria. Her next project is to hire two or three street vendors to sell her ice cream around the nearby areas.

Felicia is taking her very first loan. She does her business on foot as she doesn't have a space to sell her clothes. She would like to rent a space to set up a store. With this loan she will buy one big bundle with varied clothing types. ''Let's see how it goes,'' she says with a hopeful laugh.

In all, this Bank of Hope has fifteen members--three groups of five. They live in Guaricanos, a large slum located on the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic's capital city. There are three group coordinators in this Bank; one per five members. They are Maria P., Ines M. and Felicia A..

We would like to thank you for supporting this Bank of Hope.

loans.use: To buy medicines for a pharmacy

loans.name: Elsa Haydee

texts.es:
La  señora Elsa Haydee V. B. tiene 37 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana y vive en Agallpampa distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo de secundaria y no continuó por falta de apoyo familiar.
Actualmente vive con su pareja y tiene 2 hijos.  La socia se dedica al trabajo agrícola y también a la venta de leña y ganado para carne.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en compra de leña.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles que cancelará  en 6 cuotas, piensa invertir en la compra de leña o ganado para engorde.
Elsa sueña con ver profesionales a su hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Haydee V. Baza is 37 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank Mujeres del Mañana. She lives in Agallpampa, Mache district, Otuzco province, La Libertad department, Perú. She studied until the second year of secondary school but did not continue because her family did not support her. Now she lives with her partner and she has two children. She does agricultural work and also sells wood and beef catle.

She invested her first loan of 300 soles, which she paid back in 4 payments, in buying wood. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 payments, she intends to invest in buying wood or cattle to be fattened. Elsa dreams of seeing her children have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood or cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Maria Avelina

texts.es:
La señora María Avelina G. D. ValverD. tiene 50 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana, vive en el distrito D. Agallpampa en la provincia D. Otuzco en el departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa, la concluyo D. 16 años, debido a bajos recursos económicos no continuo estudiando. A los 17 años se casó y tiene 4 hijos.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compro animales para engorD., luego los volvió a vender por mayor precio.
Con este crédito D. 800 soles que devolverá en 6 cuotas comprará animales D. corral para engordarlos y volverlos a vender a mayor precio.
Avelina sueña con tener un buen capital para poder trabajar cada día mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Avenlina G. D. ValverD., 50, belongs to the Mujeres D. Mañana community bank. She lives in the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province in the La Libertad department of Perú. She completed primary school, but she stopped going to school when she was 16 due to low economic resources. She married at 17, and she has 4 children. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she repaid in 4 payments, she bought animals to fatten and resell at a better price. She will use this loan of 800 PEN, which she will repay in 6 payments, to buy small farm animals to fatten and resell at a better price. Avelina dreams of having good capital to be able to work better every day

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small farm animals

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Z. actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de bebidas en su propia casa de habitación donde a diario ofrece las bebidas gaseosas y jugos de todo sabor.

Hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y así ofertarlas en su establecimiento que ha logrado desarrollar grandemente por lo que ha adquirido mesas y sillas para los clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Z. sells drinks from her home. Every day she offers soft drinks and juices of all flavors. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan to buy drinks in order to offer them for sale. She has been able to greatly expand her establishment by getting tables and chairs for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and juice

loans.name: Enma Erminda

texts.es:
La señora Enma Erminda Rodríguez A. tiene 48 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor del caserío de Lluin del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria y no continuó estudiando por falta de apoyo familiar. Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 3 hijos.
Actualmente es Juez de Paz de su comunidad,  tiene una bodega y también vende comida.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas compró animales menores para su negocio de comida.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará insumos para la elaboración de alimentos.
Enma sueña con comprarse un ómnibus para transporte de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Enma Erminda Rodríguez A. is 48 years old and belongs to the Buen Pastor (Good Shepherd) Community Bank in the village of Lluin in the Mache district of the Otuzco province in La Libertad, Peru. She studied up until the fifth grade of elementary school and then didn't continue her studies due to lack of family support. She married when she was twenty years old and has three children. Currently, she is the Justice of the Peace in her community. She has a shop and also sells food. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in four installments, she bought young animals for her food business. With this loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will purchase ingredients for cooking meals. Enma dreams of buying an omnibus to serve as transportation for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - Group 1

texts.en:
Maritza R. represents this group of five micro entrepreneurs. They live in an area called Brisas del Ozama, by the Ozama River shore. The river divides Santo Domingo in two halves. Maritza and her friends live on the eastern side. Maritza has 5 children, ages 24, 22, 19, 18 and 16. Only the two youngest ones still live with her.

Maritza mostly sells children's clothing, which she buys in bundles (she told us there are tons of children in her area). However, with this loan she will buy a bundle that includes sheets and curtains (at her clientele's request) and a bundle of jeans. There are many men who do handwork that wear jeans everyday. They have asked her to buy men's jeans, so they can buy them from her. Her male clients say she sells good clothing at a fair price. One of the challenges Maritza faces as a businesswoman is to recognize trustworthy customers. ''You might encounter unreliable people that won't pay you."

Maritza would like to set up all her merchandise at a store and add more variety to her sales. For example, she might like to add shoes to her merchandise in the near future. On behalf of this group of entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
La actividad a la que a diario se dedica la señora María G. es a la venta de frutas y verduras en su establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece todo tipo de frutas y verduras siendo muy visitada todos los días por sus clientes.

Es importante destacar que el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de las frutas y las verduras y de esta forma continuar supliendo sus necesidades y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
The activity that María G. is dedicated to on a daily basis is selling fruit and vegetables from her stall in the Mayoreo market where she offers all types of fruit and produce and is visited every day by her customers. It is important to point out that the reason why she has turned to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan for the purchase of fruits and vegetables and, in this way, continue to meet her needs and improve her economic standing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz vive con su esposo el señor Evaristo que es pensionado, pero aparte tienen otro ingreso extra del negocio propio que tienen llamado “Abarrotes Betty “que cuenta con 7 años establecidos. El proyecto que ahora tienen es invertir en la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio; motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
Ellos son una familia carismática, responsable y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives with her husband, Evaristo, who is a pensioner. Apart from that, they have other extra income from their own business named "Abarrotes Betty" (Betty's Groceries) which has been in business for seven years. The project that they currently are pursuing is to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for their business, which is why they are requesting this loan. They are a charismatic, responsible and hard-working family.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in their business.

loans.name: María Justina

texts.es:
La dama María Justina F. es se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas para venderlas a sus clientes en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Mangua.

Ella es una persona muy esforzada que a raíz de sus ventas ha logrado mejorar su nivel de vida. Hoy en día espera que Ceprodel le brinde su crédito para  la compra del maíz y así continuar en su negocio y así superarse y beneficiar a su familia que depende de ella.
texts.en:
Ms. María Justina F. works in the preparation of tortillas to sell to her customers in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. She is a very dedicated person who, based on her sales, has been able to improve her standard of living. Now she hopes that Ceprodel will approve her loan to buy corn to continue in her business and thus improve herself and benefit her family who depend on her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Carla Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Carla V. es una dama que se dedica cien por ciento a su negocio de venta de ropa en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua siendo este el único ingreso que percibe para brindarle las condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por sus 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos están en secundaria.

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado para así adquirir la mercadería de sus proveedores y continuar ofertando la ropa a sus clientes en su establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
Carla V. is a woman who is dedicated 100% to her business selling clothing in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. This is the only income that she receives to provide living conditions to her family made up of her six children, five of whom are in secondary school. She hopes that her loan will be granted so that she may acquire merchandise from her suppliers and continue to offer clothing to her customers from her stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - Group 8

texts.en:
These five young women are getting their first loan. All but one are starting their businesses with these funds. We had the chance of talking to them all about the activities they plan to do with this loan. Only Anecia had her business set up before and will restock with this loan.

Belkis A. is the group representative. She will sell hair products. She will use her loan to buy shampoo, conditioner, a special strengthening treatment called Penetrait, anti-frizz serum (which sells specially well because the Dominican Republic weather is very humid and hair frizzes fast), and hair wax for durable hair styles. Belkis knows that Dominican women are very conscious about their hair and take very special care of it. This is why she is committed to offering good quality hair products at a good price.

Nikaury E. and Alexandre M. will both sell clothes. Mostly pants, blouses, underwear and sandals. They will go to the flea market or to the Villa Consuelo commercial district to get their merchandise. At these two market places, they can purchase at better prices than most retail stores, which will allow them to realize larger profit margins for each sale.

Yoselin will sell bedding, bedspreads, curtains and sheets. She buys them by the dozen and sells them by the piece.

Last but not least, Anecia has a fried food stand that opens at 3pm. While she was at our office in central Santo Domingo, her husband was attending the stand. ''But my customers say I do it better'' she says with a laugh. Her group mates agreed. She mostly sells fried chicken, crackling pork, fried sweet potatoes and tostones (crunchy fried plantains).

Please help us support this group of entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: Buy hair products for sale

loans.name: Magna Miguelina

texts.es: La señora Magna Miguelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Agricultura cdra. 03, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Es socia de Manuela Ramos hace 2 años y la primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 por iniciativa propia  y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su  negocio de Venta de Bebidas gasificadas y golosinas,   en la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son moradores sus vecinos y amigos. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, comprará más productos como gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, agua mineral con gas y sin gas en botellas, así como golosinas como galletas, caramelos, chicles  para mantener contenta a su clientela. Magna Miguelina, agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que realiza a las mujeres y también por las sesiones que dan sobre temas interesantes, por lo que no falta a ninguna reunión, y no quiere perderse ningún consejo, espera que sigamos adelante y apoyando a mujeres que de verdad quieren trabajar.
texts.en:
Señora Magna Miguelina belongs to the La Libertad (Liberty) Communal Bank. She lives in the Bellavista District, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years of age and married, the mother of five children, two of whom still depend on her. She has been associated with Manuela Ramos/ CrediMUJER for two years. The first time she obtained a loan of 300 Sols on her own initiative and with her husband's support she launched her business selling soft drinks and sweets. At present she is continuing with the same business which is located in her house. Her main customers are residents of the neighborhood, her friends and neighbors. With this loan of 2,000 Sols, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy more merchandise such as cases of soft drinks of different brands, flavors and sizes; bottled mineral water, both carbonated and uncarbonated; and various sweets such as cookies, caramels and gum, all in order to keep her customers satisfied. Magna Miguelina is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans they make available to women and also for their interesting presentations on various subjects. That's why she never misses a meeting and never wants to miss a consultation. She hopes they keep moving forward and helping women who truly want to work.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Alexa Doris

texts.es:
Alexa Doris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Apolonia S/Nº - Caserío de El Porvenir, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos depende de ella.Con el apoyo de sus padres inicio su negocio de Venta de Jugos y refrigerios en el Mercado Central con un capital de  S/. 800.00 con los que mando a confeccionar un andamio para acondicionar sus servicios, mesas y banquitas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará en 06 meses,  comprará  frutas como papayas, naranjas en cientos, manzanas en cajas, plátanos en racimos; útiles de repostería como vasos, jarritas, platos pequeños, cucharitas, envases de diferente tamaños, e insumos para la preparación de sus jugos como algarrobina y miel de abeja, así como para la preparación de sus refrigerios como kekes, empanadas, papas rellenas. Nos cuenta que hoy en día y gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos se siente muy tranquila con lo que hace, responsable en sus cuotas y con las acciones de su vida diaria, en un futuro desea implementar su juguería en un local más amplio y céntrico.
texts.en:
Alexa Doris belongs to the Virgen del Rosario Community Bank. She lives in Jr. Apolonia S/Nº, El Porvenir village, Bellavista district, San Martín department. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old and is mother to three children, all of whom depend on her. With the support of her parents, she started her business selling juices and snacks in the central market with an investment of 800 soles with which she ordered scaffolding for the the construction of tables and stools. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will purchase fruit such as papayas, hundreds of oranges, boxes of apples, and bunches of bananas, as well as necessities such as glasses, jars, small plates, spoons, containers of different sizes and ingredients for the preparation of her juices such as algarrobina syrup, bee honey, as well as for the preparation of her snacks like cakes, empanadas, and stuffed potatoes. She tells us that today, thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos, she feels very content with what she does. She is responsible with her payments and with her daily tasks. In the future, she wishes to establish her juice store in a bigger, more centrally located space.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and accessories for selling her juices.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa E. R. tiene 39 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Buen Pastor, vive en el caserío de Lluín distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad.
Estudio primaria completa, no continuó estudios debido a la falta de apoyo por parte de su familia.
Se casó a los 20 años y tiene 6 hijos, 2 hombres y 4 mujeres.
Se dedica a la compra venta de cereales  y últimamente también al negocio de la madera.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró cereales, como trigo, cebada, arveja y lenteja.
Con este crédito de 1,000 que cancelará en 6 cuotas comprará cereales al por mayor y invertirá en la compra de madera.
Rosa se siente muy agradecida a los préstmos recibidos de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa E. R. is 39 years old and belongs to the Good Shepherd Community Bank. She lives in the village of Lluín in the district of Mache, Otuzco province, Department of La Libertad. She completed primary school, but did not continue her studies due to lack of support from her family. She married at age twenty and has six children, two boys and four girls. She works in the purchase and sale of grains and also, recently, in the lumber business. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she purchased cereals such as wheat, barley, peas, and lentils. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in six installments, she will buy cereals at wholesale, and invest in the purchase of lumber. Rosa is very grateful for the loans received from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cereals and lumber

loans.name: Zenaida Marcionila

texts.es:
La señora Zenaida Marcionila A. D. G. tiene 70 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Mañana, vive en el distrito D. Agallpampa D. la provincia D. Otuzco del departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado D. educación primaria, pero no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la falta D. apoyo económico D. sus familiares.
Como era costumbre los matrimonios se arreglaban por convenio entre los padres D. los novios,  a ella le arreglaron el matrimonio a los 16 años y tiene 12 hijos.
Actualmente venD. cerveza y fruta, recuerda que anteriormente tenía negocios múltiples.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que canceló en cuatro cuotas, compró gaseosa y cerveza.
Con este crédito D. 1,000 soles que cancelará en 4 cuotas comprará cerveza para venderla en la fiesta patronal D. su región.
Zenaida sueña con arreglar su casa para tener a todos sus hijos con ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenaida Marcionila A. D. G. is seventy years old and belongs to the Communal Bank of Women of Tomorrow. She lives in the district of Agallpampa in the province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until the fourth graD. of primary school, but was unable to continue her studies due to lack of financial support from her family. As was customary, marriages were arranged by agreement between the parents of the briD. and groom, and for her they arranged a marriage when she was sixteen. She has twelve children. Currently she sells beer and fruit, and remembers that previously she had multiple businesses. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she repaid in four installments, she bought soda and beer. With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will buy beer to sell at the patron saint festival of her region. Zenaida dreams about fixing her house in order to have all her children with her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy beer to sell at the festival

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Juana Guadalupe Y. E. tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que ejerció durante 14 años y que abandono cuando la empresa donde trabajaba cerró definitivamente. Tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Juana tiene una pequeña librería y una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo útiles escolares, luego empezó la venta de vino hace 2 años, el mismo que abandono por que ya no le era muy rentable, con las ganancias obtenidas amplio su negocio con la venta de abarrotes y pudo comprar una vitrina y un andamio para sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes.  
Con el crédito de 900 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos, útiles escolares y uniformes.
Juana tiene el gran sueño de construir su casa y tener una bodega más grande.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Guadalupe Y. E. is 48 years of age and lives in the Salaverry District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to become an executive secretary, a career which she practiced for 14 years but which she abandoned when the business where she was working went belly up. She has a son who depends on her financial support. Juana has a small shop where she sells books and groceries. She started her business selling school supplies. Two years ago she began selling wine but gave it up because it was not very profitable. With her earnings she expanded her business to include selling groceries and was able to buy a display case and shelving for her merchandise. She is developing her business in her home. The first loan of 300 Sols which she received from her communal bank (Jerid Camino al Éxito II Communal Bank) was used to buy groceries. With this loan of 900 Sols, which will be repaid in six months, she intends to buy ingredients for preparing meals, school supplies and uniforms. Juana has a great desire to build herself a house and to have a larger store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms, and ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Marilu R. D. O. tiene 34 años, vive en Chongoyape, distrito D. Paijan,  provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, dejo D. estudiar debido a que su padre falleció y su madre no tenia los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 04 hijos D. los cuales 03 aun dependen D. ella.
Rosa se dedica a la crianza D. animales y a la siembra D. maíz y espárrago, al inicio se dedico a la venta D. productos D. belleza, el cual abandono debido a que no le era muy rentable, luego empezó la crianza D. animales hace 2 años y la siembra D. maíz y espárrago en sociedad con su esposo hace 1 año, ambos negocios le dan muchas ganancias y lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra productos D. belleza.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. animales, así como  abonos, medicinas y semillas para sembrar.
Rosa sueña con terminar D. construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Marilu R. D. O. is 34 years old and lives in Chongoyape, Paijan district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed her primary education and then had to leave school because her father died and her mother could not afford to continue supporting her. She has 4 children, 3 of whom are still dependent upon her. Rosa rears animals and grows corn and asparagus. She started out selling beauty products but gave that up because it was not very profitable. She then began rearing animals 2 years ago and growing corn and asparagus in partnership with her husband 1 year ago. Both businesses bring in considerable incomes and have helped with home improvements. With the first loan of 300 Peruvian soles that she received from the community bank “Manos Unidas”, she bought beauty products. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy animals, as well as fertilizers, medicines and seeds for planting. Rosa dreams of finishing building her house. She is a member of the mothers club in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals, fertilizer, medicines and seeds for planting

loans.name: María Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora María Emperatriz G. O. tiene 46 años es tesorera de su banco comunal, vive en Chongoyape, distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no continúo estudiando debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
María tiene un mototaxi, cuando inicio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza negocio que realizó durante 15 años, con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar un mototaxi hace 2 años, al principio lo alquilaba, pero ahora lo maneja su hijo; este negocio le es muy rentable y lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para su stock.  
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de repuestos para la reparación de su mototaxi.
María tiene el sueño de tener una Librería en su domicilio.
Ella pertenece al club de Madres (asociación de mujeres) de su sector.
texts.en:
María Emperatriz G. O. is 46 years old and is the treasurer of her communal bank. She lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paijan, Ascope province, in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary education but did not continue studying as she got married and took care of her home. She has 2 children, although neither one still depends financially on her. Maria has a motocycle taxi. She started off selling beauty products, which she did for 15 years. With the earnings from that, 2 years ago she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi. In the beginning she rented it out but now her son drives it. The business is very profitable and she runs it from her home. With her first loan for 300 soles which she received from the "Manos Unidos" communal bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products for her inventory. With a loan for 600 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. Maria has a dream of setting up a bookstore in her house. She belongs to the Club de Madres (a women´s association) in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aída, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Apolonia con Jorge Chávez S/Nº - Caserío de El Porvenir del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.Es socia en Manuela Ramos, pues tiene  casi 07 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal, se dedica al rubro de corte y confección de vestidos, se inicio con un préstamo de S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles con el que compró un poco de material para sus confecciones, que por su buen acabado se hizo de una clientela segura.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, que los ofrece a sus clientes, vecinos y amigos conocidos, asimismo trabaja con pedidos a medidas, otra de las actividades a la que se dedica es  la preparación y venta de quesos.Con este préstamo de S/. 900.00 que cancelara en 04 meses, lo invertirá comprando telas de algodón en metros; hilos en diferentes colores, elásticos, blondas,  insumos necesarios  para confeccionar ropas interiores en diferentes tallas y modelos para damas,  caballeros y niños.Es ella quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Nos cuenta que hoy se siente una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene metas en su vida como son  implementar su propio taller con un local amplio y acondicionado.Aída, nos comenta que Manuela Ramos le permitió crecer como empresaria y Mujer, y esta muy agradecida con su apoyo.
texts.en:
Aida belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives on the corner of Jr. Apolonia and Jorge Chávez, in the village of El Porvenir in the Bellavista district, department of San Martín. She is married, 53 years old and the mother of 3 children, 1 of who still depends financially on her. She is a member of Manuela Ramos and has been working with her communal bank for almost 7 years. She is a dressmaker and started off with a loan of S/. 200 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought some material to make clothing, which due to its quality resulted in steady customers. She is currently working in the same business, offering her servicies to clients, neighbors, friends and acquaintenances. She also works on commission. Another of her activities is making and selling cheeses. With a loan for S/. 900 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy several meters of cotton material, thread in different colors, elastic, lace, and supplies she needs to make undergarments in different sizes and styles for women, men and children. She makes her own decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Today she considers herself a fighter and an entrepreneur and she has goals for herself, such as setting up her own workshop in a spacious storefront. Aida says that Manuela Ramos has allowed her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman, and she is very grateful for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy abandoned cars in order to recycle metal.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
La señora Lucero C. H. tiene 39 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella. 
Lucero tiene una bodega, inicio su negocio vendiendo combinado y comida que luego abandono debido a que no le daba el tiempo necesario para cuidar a sus hijas. Al tiempo decidió viajar a argentina y al regresar puso una bodega donde vendía abarrotes y que ha ido surtiendo con el tiempo, con las ganancias que obtuvo a logrado comprar sus andamios para sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la  compra de abarrotes.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de alimentos para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
Lucero tiene el sueño de lograr que sus hijas sean profesionales.
Ella pertenece al club de madres de su sector.
texts.en:
Lucero C. H. is 39 years old, She lives in the Aurora Díaz area of the district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school studies, but did not continue her education because she got married and took care of her house. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially. Lucero has a convenience store. She started her business selling meals but later stopped because it did not allow her enough time to take care of her children. After awhile she decided to travel to Argentina, and on returning set up a convenience store where she sold groceries and over time has begun to have more items. With her earnings she was able to buy display shelves for her goods. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan for 300 soles which she received from her communal bank, "Las Auroras en Acción II", she purchased groceries. With a loan for 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy supplies for making food so that she can increase her working capital. Lucero dreams of seeing her daughters become professionals. She belongs to the "mothers club" (a womens association) in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor Juan José P. tiene ya mas de ocho años dedicándose a la reparación de vehículos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
A su negocio le está haciendo falta herramienta de mejor calidad y más moderna, para darle un mejor servicio a su clientes. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la comprar de las herramienta que le están ofreciendo a muy buen precio, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan José P. has been repairing vehicles for more than 8 years. This business is the family´s source of income. His business is in need of better quality and more modern tools so he can provide better service to his customers. However, he does not have the money he needs to buy the tools which are being offered to him at a very good price, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Olga Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Olga Elvira U. D. Z. tiene 51 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secretariado Ejecutivo, abandono la carrera debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 01 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. ella. 
Olga se dedica a la venta D. menú y tiene una bodega en sociedad con su cuñada, inicio su bodega hace 4 años con algunos abarrotes que ha ido ampliando poco a poco, hace 2 años se dedica a la venta D. menú y desayuno, negocio que le da muchas ganancias y que le han permitido comprar utensilios y ollas para su negocio el mismo que desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos para su bodega y para la venta D. menú.
Olga tiene el gran sueño D. construir su casa y que su hijo sea profesional.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Elvira U. D. Z., 51, lives in AA.HH Aurora Díaz district of Salaverry, in the Trujillos province, in the La Libertad department of Perú. She studied to be an Executive Secretary, but she left that career because she got married and became a housewife. She has a son who is economically dependent upon her. Olga sells menu style foods, and she has a store with her sister-in-law. She started her store 4 years ago with some groceries, and little by little she has been expanding the business. Two years ago she started selling menu items and breakfast. This business has produced good earnings. It has allowed her to buy utensils and pots for the business, which she runs in her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN from her community bank, “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, she bought groceries to stock her store. With a loan of 1200 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy supplies for food and menu item preparation. She will then sell the food she prepares. Olga has the big dream of building a house and that her son becomes a professional. She belongs to the mothers' club in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto de 42 años de edad, está casado hace 8 años, tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos ya viven fuera de casa. Las labores agrícolas son parte de su vida, es un hombre noble y carismático, sobre todo muy entregado a cada uno de sus cultivos. Cuando lo visitamos, lo hallamos a las 7.00am realizando la cosecha de papa, sonriendo por la alegría que le trae esta faena, después alista y transporta su producto para comercializarlo en los mercados de la ciudad. La siembra de papa es muy rentable para Alberto, aunque tenga que trabajar mucho en el desarrollo de este tubérculo, se siente muy complacido por los precios del mercado, esto lo motiva a seguir sembrando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos menores. Los planes de Alberto son de incrementar sus cultivos, pero carece de tierras propias, esto no lo desanima, pues seguirá sembrando en chacras alquiladas hasta que pueda comprarse las suyas. Generalmente para las reuniones de su banco comunal, asiste su esposa, porque él está trabajado en sus chacras. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo a demostrado ser un cliente muy puntual. El dinero que solicita es para invertir en la compra de semillas de alverjas, para sembrarlas en la chacra cosechada de papa.
texts.en:
Alberto is 42 years of age, has been married for eight years, and has seven children of whom two are now living away from home. Agricultural work is part of his life. He is a noble and charismatic man, but above all he is very devoted to his farming. When we visited him, we found him harvesting potatoes at seven in the morning and smiling with the joy that this chore brings him. Afterward, he gets his produce ready and transports it to be sold in the city markets. Growing potatoes is very profitable for Alberto. Although it's a lot of work to produce them, he feels very satisfied with the prices at market. This motivates him to continue planting them, in order to improve the quality of life for his young children. Alberto plans to increase his plantings but he doesn't have his own fields. This doesn't discourage him. He will continue farming on rented farmland until he is able to buy his own. His wife usually attends the meetings of his communal bank because he is working in his fields. This is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in all of that time he has shown himself to be a very punctual client. The funds he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for peas in order to grow them in the field once the potatoes are harvested.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for peas.

loans.name: Delia Esther

texts.es:
La señora Delia Esther Z. C. tiene 52 años, es secretaria de su banco comunal, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, dejo de estudiar debido a que sus padres n tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 04 aun dependen económicamente de ella.
Delia tiene una pequeña librería y bodega, inicia su negocio vendiendo manualidades (juguetería en tela), luego útiles escolares hace 3 años, con el tiempo ha ido surtiendo su negocio y ahora tiene una  pequeña librería, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y con las ganancias obtenidas a ampliado su negocio con la venta de abarrotes el mismo que desarrolla actualmente en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra de útiles escolares. 
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de belleza, útiles escolares ye insumos para la preparación de alimentos.
Delia  tiene el sueño de tener una librería  y una bodega en su domicilio.
Ella pertenece al club de madres de su sector.
texts.en:
Delia Esther Z. C. is 52 years old and is the secretary of her communal bank. She lives in Aurora Díaz in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, La Libertad department, Peru. She completed her secondary education, but did not continue her studies because her parents did not have the means to support her further. She has 8 children, 4 of whom are still dependent on her. Delia has a little bookstore and grocery store, which she runs out of her home. She began by selling handicrafts (cloth toys), and for the last 3 years has sold school supplies. Over time Delia has added new products to her business so that she now sells books, and, in addition, earns a living selling beauty products. She used her profits to expand her business to include selling groceries. She used the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the “Jerid Camino al Éxito II” (“Jerid Road to Success II”) communal bank to invest in purchasing school supplies. Delia will use the current loan of 1700 soles to invest in purchasing beauty products, school supplies, and food preparation supplies. The loan is to be repaid in 6 months. Delia’s dream (which she has achieved) is to have a bookstore and grocery store that she runs out of her home. She belongs to the ‘mothers of their community’ club.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beauty products, school supplies, and food preparation supplies

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
La vivienda del señor Julián R. necesita nuevos acabados exteriores principalmente la pintura, sin embargo no tiene disponible capital para llevar a cabo su objetivo, él se encargará de realizar la mejora; ya que se dedica a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas. 
La familia de Don Julián se compone de cuatro hijos, siendo ellos la primera causa de su existencia y del esfuerzo constante para lograr darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
The exterior of Julián R.’s house is not finished. He does not have the money to buy the material. He will take charge of making the improvement. He does the construction and repairs on his house. Julián is a family man. He has four minor children, and he would like to give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishings for the exterior of the house

loans.name: Dominica

texts.es: Dominica cuenta con 46 años, está casada hace 8 años, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos migraron a Lima en busca de un porvenir diferente. Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la agricultura de forma artesanal, cultivan papa, alverjas, olluco y demás hortalizas. Durante la temporada de cosecha, Dominica cocina para su familia y todos los peones; los hombres van sacando las papas de la tierra, mientras que las mujeres las seleccionan según el tamaño. Buscando la practicidad, Dominica encarga que de inmediato se hagan las cargas para enviar a los mercados para no perder tiempo. Por lo cual se siente muy contenta por la buena organización y trabajo compartido que realiza con su esposo, nos dice que trabajando en comunicación constante se siente menos cansancio y se aprovechan todos los beneficios del campo. Dominica no solo cocina para sus peones, sino que muchas veces es contratada para preparar la comida en las fiestas patronales de su pueblo (Como la vemos en la foto). Con estas actividades, ha podido brindarles la educación y alimentación a sus hijos, sus anhelos a futuro son de incrementar sus siembras para comprar terrenos agrícolas que se le sean muy rentables. Este es su 7mo crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo pagó puntualmente en las fechas señaladas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos como la urea y el nitrato, los cuales servirá para abonar sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Dominica, 46, has been married for 8 years. She has 8 children, 3 of them have migrated to Lima looking for a different future. For 10 years she and her husband have worked in agriculture. They grow potatoes, peas, “olluco” (a different type of potato used in stews), and other produce. During the harvest season Dominica cooks for her family and all the other workers. The men take the potatoes from the earth while the women sort them according to size. Being practical and not wanting to waste any time, Dominica makes sure that they immediately load the produce to send to market. She feels content about the good organization and the work she shares with her husband. She feels less tired because they are in constant communication while working and they can take advantage of the benefits of the country. Dominica not only cooks for the workers, but many times she is contracted to prepare the food for the community festivals in her town (as seen in the photo). Through these activities she has been able to feed and educate her children. Her goals for the future are to increase her plantings in order to buy agricultural land that will be profitable. This is her 7th loan with MFP, and in all that time she has always repaid her loans on time. The loan she is now asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers like urea and nitrate to fertilize her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Ana Milagritos H. F., tiene 31 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse al cuidado de su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ana se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y pintura especial para embarcaciones, se inicio con la venta de pinturas para embarcaciones, luego a la venta de menú y marcianos, con el tiempo se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que le es muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para la venta de menú. 
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pintura y materiales para la construcción de embarcaciones.
Ana sueña con terminar de construir su casa y viajar a conocer Lima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Milagritos H. F., 31, lives in AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished her second year of high school, but she left school because she married very young and had to take care of her home. She has 2 children who depend entirely upon her. Ana sells cosmetics and paint made especially for boats. She started selling paint for boats, and then she started selling menu item food and popsicles. Later she started selling beauty products, which is a profitable business for her. She runs her business from her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, she bought basic needs type food for her sale of menu item foods. With a loan of 1000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy paint and material for boat construction. Ana dreams of finishing building her house and traveling to see Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint and material for boat construction

loans.name: Irene Maria

texts.es:
La señora Irene Maria G. E. D. U. tiene 49 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Enfermería Técnica, carrera que abandono debido a que salio embarazada y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar. Tiene 04 hijos D. los cuales solo 01 depenD. D. ella económicamente. 
Irene tiene una bodega, al inicio se dedicaba a la venta D. abarrotes en el mercado, luego decidió abrir una pequeña bodega en sociedad con su cuñada, con el tiempo a ampliado su negocio con la venta D. productos D. belleza, ropa y juguetería, con las ganancias que ha obtenido a comprado una exhibidor y una vitrina para sus productos. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos D. belleza y peluches. 
Con el crédito D. 2000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos D. belleza y ropa.
Irene sueña con tener una librería y una tienda D. ropa.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Irene Maria G. E. D. U. is 49 and lives in the Aurora Díaz Settlement in the Slaverry District of the Trujillo Province in the Department of La Libertad, Perú. She had studied Vocational Nursing, a career she gave up when she became pregnant and needed to devote herself to her home. She has 4 children, only one of whom is dependent on her. Irene has a grocery store. At first she maD. her living selling groceries at the market, but then she decided to open a small grocery store with her sister-in-law. Over time she has expanded her business by selling beauty products, clothing, and toys, and she has used her profits to buy a display and a showcase for her products. She's building her business in her own home. Irene invested her first loan of 300 soles, which she received from her village bank, "Jerid Camino al Éxito (Road to Success) II," in beauty products and stuffed animals.
