CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. They give credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Abduvoid

texts.ru: Абдувоид - 47 лет. У него есть жена и 5-ро детей. Три сына и две дочки. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Дочки помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Абдувоид пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Недавно он узнал у соседей, что можно взять кредит в нашей организации, для увеличения количества скота. Теперь он тоже наш клиент.
texts.en:
Abduvoid is 47 years old. He has a wife and 5 children, three sons and two daughters. His older sons have gone to Russia to work. Working there they send money to their parents. The parents save the sent money so that they can later spend it on the marriages of their sons. The daughters help around the house. His wife processes yarn. She travels by herself to the market in order to sell it. Abduvoid tends livestock in the mountains and returns home very late. Not long ago he found out from his neighbors that he could take out a loan from our organization to increase his livestock count. Now he is also our client.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is managing a small piggery. She started her business three years ago using her small savings to buy two piglets. Now she has her piggery, which helps her pay all the bills at home. Her business is truly a help in buying the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will truly help Myrna expand her business. Aside from feed, she will also buy additional piglets.


CEVI is reaching out to hog growers like Myrna to sustain and grow their business. They provide easy access to CEVI credit, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed and more piglets

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. owns a small parcel of land in Sto. Nino South Cotabato in Mindanao. She is 36 years old and has three children. Her life is in the farm. She loves to grow rice, which she uses to feed and provide for her family's needs. Her husband, Nelson, is also a farmer and helps her in their farm business. They started farming together in 2002 using the land that Nemia inherited from her parents. 

Now she wants a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI (First Filipino MFI to go active in KIVA micro funding). She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will help Nemia improve the soil condition of her farm. In this way, she will have a bigger harvest for the whole family.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to sustain and grow their business. It provides credit, training and insurance coverage to all CEVI clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Nedie

texts.en: Nedie T., 35 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a Barangay Councilor. Mrs. Nedie T. is also a Barangay Health Worker. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last September, 2008. She was eager to be a member to take part in its various programs and services, especially for additional capital for her Hog raising business. She is a member in good standing and pays her obligation to the center on time. Her hopes and aspirations are for their children to finish their studies and have a stable job someday.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda A. is a rice grower. She tills two hectares of land which she inherited from her parents. She is 46 years old and has five children. "Farming is interesting work", she said. " It is where we get the food that we give to our children", she added. Aside from growing rice, Minda is hoping to buy piglets to start her piggery. She thinks that their income in the farm is not enough to support them, especially in paying school fees and tuition.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other chemicals for the farm. The loan will definitely give her whole family a good harvest. 

CEVI is a Christian, non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It is organized to help respond to the needs of our small entrepreneurs to grow their business. CEVI provides their clients with credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Mrs. Margie B. is 47 years old, married and lives at Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with only one child. Her husband is a furniture maker and furniture making is their source of income. It started with only PHP 3,000 in capital from Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative. She became a member last September 2008 and has had loans up to fourth cycle already. Because of the quality of the furniture they produce, their customers have increased from time to time. Other sources of income are hog raising and farming. Mrs. B. is applying for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy lumber for furniture making and additional goods for a sari-sari store. Someday, she looks forward to a successful business and a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy lumber for furniture making and additional goods for a sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca P. is an active member of Paglaum MPC. She is married and blessed with eight children.  Four of them are still studying.  Her major activity is backyard gardening together with her husband, and she also engages in selling snacks. Now she asks for her seventh loan intended for cultivating her garden, purchasing of seedlings and fertilizer to support the education of her children and to feed her family.

loans.use: Labor for cultivation, fertilizers, and seedlings

loans.name: Casimira

texts.en:
Casimira P., 52 years old, is a single mom and has four children. She lives in Purok de Oro, Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte in Southern Philippines. Being a single parent, she strives hard to provide for the needs of her children.

Casimira engages in barbecue selling. Most of her customers are in the neighborhood and nearby villages.  Due to financial incapacity and low income, she wants to increase her supplies to serve the needs of her customers and earn a higher income. She wants to apply for a loan from HSPFI (KIVA partner) amounting to Php 7000 to purchase additional ingredients like chicken feet, head and intestines, hotdogs, beef and others. This will be a great help for them.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for barbecue

location.town: Zone 3, Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is managing a small sari-sari store. She started her business in the year 2008 using her small savings of only Php 3,000. Now that she is 44 years old, she wants to grow her business more to support her two children. Aside from selling goods in their village, she also grows rice. She and her husband, Arnold B., till the land to support the needs of their family. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her business. She believes that her loan will help her attract more customers. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to help her family expenses.

CEVI is helping her grow her business. Now she enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: N. Joyce is the leader of Zibula atudde group in Lugazi. She is married with five children and she cares for 10 dependents including providing shelter, food, clothing and general upkeep. Joyce is a coffee dealer and a tailor and she is grateful that the loans have helped her learn how to save for business expansion. She has future plans where by she plans to educate all her children to the top; she wants to renovate her residential house as well as construct another house to rent. She needs another loan (30th loan) to be able to reinvest in her businesses by buying more coffee and more clothing material for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and clothing material.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is a rice grower. She is married and has four children. She is managing a 2-hectare rice field. Her husband, Rudy B., is also a farmer. They are together for 25 years already. Aside from rice, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. They water them everyday and sell their harvest to their neighbors. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will help her increase her yield. In that way, she can support better the needs of her family.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It reaches out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. CEVI gives all their clients not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nelieza

texts.en: At 33, Nelieza R. finds her own way to share the burden of her family's daily expenses. They were blessed with five children; as parents, they find it hard to raise and give a better future for them. With her variety store, she is able to give financial support to her husband. She plans to expand her store in the future. For her second loan, she is applying for the amount of PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her existing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her variety store

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is the group leader of Tusuubira group in Lugazi. She is 44 years old and a single mother of three school-age children; she also cares for two other relatives. For 17 years, she has had a tailoring business making women and children’s wear as well as buying already made clothes to sell. For 12 years, Harriet has been getting loans from Pearl Microfinance and out of these loans, she has been able to maintain her business, make it grow and her daily income and savings have increased over the years. She again needs a loan to help with stocking more clothes for sale since most of them were sold off for the Easter season; she will also stock more materials for making her other clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale and materials for making other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pross' Group

texts.en: Z. Pross is a member of Tusuubira group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady who has had a salon that she mans in Lugazi town for 8 years so far. She makes lady’s hair, plaits it using braids as well as applying chemicals to make it soft and manageable. She has been able to buy driers that she uses in her salon, combs plus other accessories and this enables her to attend to four customers at a time. Pross needs a loan to help with buying more chemicals and braids for her salon plus paying school fees for her five children and one dependent. Pross has future plans of buying another plot of land and building rental homes for increasing her revenue.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is 30 years old and has two children. She is requesting a loan of N100000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods. She is 36 years old and married with four children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N70000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria B., 44, is married with three children and lives at Purok 9, Kiwalan Iligan City, Southern Philippines. She balances her time efficiently for both family and business. She strives to perform her daily chores to the best of her ability. She manages a variety store that sells basic household products. She also has firewood available for sale at her store. Her customers include her neighbors and people from nearby villages. She requests a loan of PHP 7,000 from HSPFI, a KIVA partner, to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for sale and items for her variety store

location.town: Purok 9, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Milly's Group

texts.en: N. Milly, 33, is married with four children, of which three attend school. She is the group leader and has been running a retail shop in Lugazi for the past 10 years. At her shop, she sells sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, as well as hair chemicals, braids and children’s clothes. Having a variety of products in her shop has enabled Milly to increase her income, hence being able to save funds for her future. Milly needs a loan to restock her shop with more products for sale.

loans.use: Buying more sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil and other shop products for her shop

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma C. is 27 years old and single. She sells palm oil. Demand for her palm oil is high and she hopes to meet her customers’ increasing demand. She requests a loan of N 70,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac E. is 39 years old and married with three children. He sells drinks and provisions.

Isaac hopes for a loan in the amount of N40000 in order to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget O. is 25 years old and married with two children. She sells cooked foods, like rice and beans. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Bridget hopes for a loan in the amount of N40000 in order to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ahmirza

texts.ru: Ахмирза - мужчина 45 лет. Женат и отец 6 детей. Образование у него среднее. У сельских жителей почти нет возможности учится в Университетах. Только состоятельные единицы, у которых есть возможность арендовать квартиру в городе, могут учится. Но для этого требуется много денег. У Ахмирзы пока нет возможности обучать своих детей. Но он старается работать и зарабатывать побольше денег, чтобы появить такую возможность. За этим он обратился в нашу организацию, чтобы мы помогли ему. За этот кредит он хочет купить овец, и до августа месяца, откормив их продать подороже.
texts.en:
Ahmirza is a 45 year old man. He is married and is the father of 6 children. He has a high school education. Rural residents have almost no ability to study at the university. Only wealthy individuals who have the ability to rent an apartment in the city can study. But this requires a lot of money. Ahmirza does not have the ability to educate his children right now. But he tries to work and earn more money so that this ability will appear. He has turned to our organization so that we can help him. He would like to use this loan to purchase sheep and fatten them until the month of August when he will sell them for a higher price.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P. is proud to be a rice grower. She has been a farmer since she got married to her childhood friend, Cesar Pamplano. She is 47 years old and has five children. At first, she wanted only a simple life for her family but now she thinks for her children's future. She wants to work hard to send all her children to school. Someday, her children will become professionals in their own fields and will have better careers to support their future families well.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve her farm. The loan will help her achieve better yield. Aside from that, she will also use the loan to buy pesticides to protect her rice.

CEVI is reaching out farmers to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI gives their clients credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Austin

texts.en:
Austin O. is 58 years old and married with five children. He sells building materials and his wife works as a petty trader.

Austin hopes for a loan in the amount of N70,000 in order to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda H. is 46 years old and married with five children. As a mother, all she wants is to see all her five children finish their studies. She supports her husband through her small business selling used clothing (ukay-ukay). There is a great demand for this item but Rosalinda needs more capital to purchase large supplies of used clothing.

Therefore, Rosalinda wants to avail a loan from HSPFI in the amount of PHP 7,000 to cater the needs of her established customers and to her local market.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing (ukay-ukay) for sale.

location.town: Purok 9, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru: Миршарифу 37 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Образование у него среднее. Он кредитуется у нас 1 год. С прошлого года у него увеличилось количество скота. Жена - домохозяйка. В феврале Миршариф купил своей жене дойную корову. Жена была очень рада этому, потому, что молоко, которое она доила, хватало для семьи и еще она могла продавать. Но молока, которое дает одна корова, не так уж и много чтобы получать от нее хорошей прибыли. Она попросила мужа купить ей еще одну дойную корову. Теперь за этот займ Миршариф собирается купить жене еще одну корову.
texts.en:
Mirsharif is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Mirsharif has a high school education. He has been our borrower for 1 year. Since last year his livestock headcount has increased. His wife is a homemaker. In February Mirsharif bought a dairy cow for his wife. His wife was very happy about this, because the milk that she got from the cow was enough for the family and she was also able to sell some of it. But one cow does not produce that much milk to earn good profits. She asked her husband to buy her another dairy cow. Now, using this loan Mirsharif plans to buy his wife one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow

loans.name: Kalamu's Group

texts.en: S. Kalamu is a very outgoing person. He is 44 years old and married with 8 children. He also cares for 1 dependant. Kalamu is a farmer of rice, tomatoes, coffee, vanilla, cassava, and potatoes. He grows all these in large quantities and sells to his customers, mostly those that sell in retail. He has all the necessary experience as regards to growing these crops because he has been doing it all his life since childhood. In seasons when he does not have enough produce, Kalamu buys from his fellow farmers and supplies his customers in an effort to keep them. He needs a loan to help with employing labor on his land to clear bushes, as well as to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his crops.

loans.use: Contract labor to clear bushes on his farm and buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks and snacks to her customers, and she has been in this business since a long time. She is also an active LAPO client. Florence requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Auxilladora

texts.en:
Auxilladora I., 58, is a widowed mother of five children. She manages a small sari-sari store in her village. She started the business a year ago using her small savings of PHP 3,000 only. Auxilladora is also a seamstress. When she is not busy in her store, she makes dresses. The income she gets from sewing dresses is used for meeting the needs of her family.

She is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI to buy stocks in her store to augment her income, thus growing her business. CEVI is helping her sustain her business. Now, she has access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase of sari-sari stocks

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 37 years old and married with a child. She sells cooked food and drinks. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 56 years old and is married with six children. She sells cooked foods like rice, stew, beans, etc. She started this business in 2007. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо - женщина 40 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока и молочных изделий. Муж - пастух. Каждое утро гонит скот на горы и поздно вечером возвращается. Раз в месяц возит свой скот на рынок. Старшему сыну 21 год. Он помогает отцу. Дочери помогают по хозяйству дома. Зебинисо каждое утро и каждый вечер доит молоко. Часть они употребляют для семьи, а часть продают. За последний кредит Зебинисо приобрела еще одну корову.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a 40 year old woman. She is married and is the mother of 5 children. She fattens livestock and processes milk and dairy products. Her husband is a shepherd. Every morning he takes the livestock to the mountains and returns late at night. Once a month he takes his livestock to the market. Their eldest son is 21 years old. He helps his father. The daughters help around the house. Zebiniso milks the cows every morning and every evening. Part of the milk is used by the family and part of the milk is sold. Zebiniso used her last loan to buy one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is a pig grower. She is 34 years old and has no children. Her husband, Gilbert B., is a farmer. They work together to save little amount for their future children. She started growing pigs since 2004 and has continued with this business as she enjoys doing the work. Aside from pigs, she also raises cows. She and her husband also manage a rice farm to earn extra living. She is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI to buy feed for her pigs. The loan will help Rosie to increase the size of her piggery. She will also buy five more piglets from the loan. 

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start their own business. CEVI gives all its clients not only credit but also trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale is 38 years old and is married with three children. She manages a general store where she sells provisions and plastic rubbers to make a living. She is a hard-working woman. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions and plastic rubbers to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and plastic rubbers to sell

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Remie

texts.en:
Remie is engaged in the hog raising business in her village in Andarayan South of Solana, Cagayan. She is already 40 years old and is married to Emerlito, a public elementary school teacher. They have two children: Ariah Joy, who is in grade one, and James Aldrich, who is 4 years old and an incoming nursery student for the next school year. Remie is helping her husband earn a living for their family through her small business.

Remie is a college graduate with a degree in education. However, she prefers to be a full-time wife and teach her children good values, as well as establish her own business. Her pig pen is located at the back of their house. She has been managing her enterprise for almost four years. Her business has provided her family with their basic needs and at the same time assisted her husband in sending their children to school.

Remie maintains her hog raising business for the future of her children. In order to further develop her hog raising, Remie is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 15,000.00 that she will use to buy some piglets. She dreams that she can buy a jeep for a transport business someday and that somehow her children will finish their college educations.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Edrelina

texts.en:
Edrelina S. is engaged in the direct selling of AVON and SUNDANCE products. Aside from this, she is also a hog raiser for additional income. Her small business requires her to have enough capital. For this, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use for business improvement. She plans to budget the loan to purchase sacks of feed for her hogs and some products that she can offer to her customers. She hopes that by having financial support, her business will become progressive and she will be able to send her youngest child to school.

Edrelina is now 51 years old. She was married to Juan Angel Sr. and they had four children: Felix Dennis, who is 33 years old and a college undergraduate; Juan Angel Jr., who is 29 years old; Angelyn, who is 21 years old; and the youngest, Mark Joseph, who is 9 years old.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs and Avon and Sundance products to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra owns and manages a small sari-sari store (community based store) in their village. She has operated the business for almost seven years. However, due to lack of capital, her store did not improve.

She is now hoping to borrow from the lenders an amount of PHP 10,000 for the growth of her business and hopefully be able to save some of her income for the education of her children. She aims to become successful in her business someday and prays that God will continue to bless them despite their difficulties in life.

Myra is 28 years old and married to Alfredo, a farmer. They have three children: Aliyah - 6 years old; Kristine Joy - 4 years old and the youngest, Katherine - 2 years old.

loans.use: To expand her sari-sari store

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora, 48, is a sari-sari store (community-based store) owner in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela, where she is married to Loreto, a farmer and a driver of a passenger tricycle in their village. The couple has three children: Brena, 31 years old, a college undergraduate and already married; Eveth, 30 years old, a Computer Science graduate working as an Overseas Filipino Worker in Taiwan, and the youngest, Loreto Jr., 25 years old, a high school graduate, now helping his father on their farm and with the tricycle operation. 

Aurora is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000.00 for the expansion of her business.  She plans to sell meat and other products that will cater to the needs of her customers and also buy more groceries for her store.  She is hoping for a continuous development in her business for the benefit of her family.  

Aurora is saving money for times of emergency and believes that with her dedication, she will somehow become successful, always keeping in mind the axiom, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is busy with her business even at the age of 51. She sells generic medicines in the nearby villages. She was married to Jesus, a simple rice farmer. She has only two children: Joland, 35, a high school graduate, who works as a construction worker abroad and, Jijilyn, 32, a college graduate with a degree in Education, who works as a domestic helper in Hong Kong. 

Yolanda sells different generic medicines to the village stores in her hometown. She generates daily net income of PHP 300 through her business. For improving her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. She will utilize the loan to buy sufficient stock of medicines to meet her customers’ demands. She also plans to start a business of buying and selling bagoong (shrimp paste) that can generate additional income. 

As a mother, she also dreams of a more comfortable life for her family and strives hard to attain her dream. She hopes that her business will grow by the help of God and with her patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase stock of medicines

loans.name: Ebun

texts.en: Ebun is 46 years old and is married with three children. She sells shoes, gift and kitchen items such as pots, iron, microwave, etc. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more shoes, gift and kitchen items to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, gift and kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years old and lives in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela with his wife Vilma and their only child April Grace. Their daughter is now in the primary level of education. Robert supports his family through his furniture-making business. He has been in this enterprise for more than two years. He earns a monthly income of PHP 10,000, and the income is being used as rolling capital and in providing for the immediate needs of his family and educational needs of his child.
 
Roberto requests an initial loan of PHP 4,000 that will serve as additional capital for his business. He will use the loan to purchase new materials needed in making furniture. He wants his business to progress so that he can meet the growing needs of his family. He is thankful that his family is always in good health. He is also starting to save some of his income for future needs. He hopes that someday his daughter will finish her college education.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Ma. Susan manages a little sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. Managing her store is her way of helping her husband generate income for their family needs. She sells a variety of goods in her store, where she earns at least 500.00 PHP a day. To further develop her store, Susan is requesting a loan of $375 (17,000 PHP). She plans to use the loan to purchase groceries in bulk that she will sell in her store. She wants to sustain her business because it assists not only their family, but also their farming needs.

Susan is already 46 years old and married to Efren, a farmer in their community. They live in the rural area of Barangay San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. The couple was blessed with three children: Pol Nino,15 years old, a high school senior; Paul John,13 years old, a high school sophomore; and Zaira, the youngest, 10 years old, and in grade school. Susan hopes that with their sacrifices in the businesses, they may able to continue support their children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: Purchase groceries in bulk to sell in sari-sari store

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and living a simple life with her family in the peaceful village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. Her husband Nayo is a tricycle driver. The couple keeps on praying to have a child, and they are very optimistic that God has a purpose and exact plans for them.

Gemma maintains a typical store in their village. At present, she is requesting a loan for $150 (7,000 PHP) that she will use to buy more groceries for her sari-sari store (community-based store) business. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and hopefully God will keep on pouring more blessings on them. She promised to take care of her business that she started, for she believes that it was a blessing from God that she must treasure.

loans.use: Buy additonal groceries to sell in sari-sari store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emilia is a hard-working wife and mother hoping for a better way of living. She is 46 years old and married to Reynaldo. They live in the mountainous place of Jones, Isabela. Their children are: Hamly, 25 years old; Reylie, 20 years old; and Reyginald, 10 years old, who is in grade school.

To help her husband provide for the needs of their family, Emilia uses her skills doing manicures and pedicures for her own business. She provides home service to her neighbors and friends, and she earns a daily income of 150 PHP. This amount is the budget for their immediate needs at home.

Emilia requests a loan for $125 (5,000 PHP). She plans to use the loan to purchase supplies for her business, such as nail polish, nippers, and so on. If God permits, she also plans to allot half of the amount to start a hog-raising business for extra income. She hopes that lenders will support her financially in the business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for manicure business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and a resident of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Romeo D. V., and they are blessed with four children: Joseph, 28; Romnick, 25; Junmark, 23; and Jordan, 21. They were not able to pursue their college education but still she is thankful that they grew up as responsible individuals.

She runs a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village. She is glad that she can earn a daily income of 300 PHP. To meet the needs of her customers and increase her income, she is requesting a loan for $225 (10,000 PHP) that she can use as additional capital for her store. They sometimes experience financial difficulties in the family, but through their joint efforts, her husband and children were able to surpass the crisis. She wants to be more productive and to become successful in her field of endeavor. She wants to have her business grow so she can help her family.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell in sari-sari store

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita owns and manages a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. She is requesting a loan of $125 (5000 PHP) that she will use to maintain her business. She plans to purchase more goods for her store. Then she can decrease her transportation expenses going to and from the city market in Santiago where she buys her merchandise. Norma hopes to have a stable business in order to support the needs of her family.

Normita is 50 years old and her husband Hector works as a farmer. They have three children and they are all married. Vicente, 30 years old, used to sell fish and squid ball and squid balls in their village. Norvic, 27 years old, and Dona, 26 years old, are both college graduates, but they are still unemployed due to limited job opportunities in their area. They live in the mountainous area of Mapalad, San Agustin, Isabela.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to increase inventory and decrease transporation expenses

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a young entrepreneur. She is only 19 years old and already married to Lerson, a farmer. They do not have a child yet and they keep on praying to have one. She has managed a sari-sari store (community based store) in their village for three years.

Fe wants to buy more stock for the improvement of her business which would save time and transportation fares going to the market since it is far from their place and needs a ride in a ferry boat. She hopes to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000.00. Fe is looking forward to the financial support of the lenders and she hopes that, someday, she can develop her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marienel

texts.en:
Marienel is married to her very supportive husband, Felvin Daguia. She is 33 years old, an entrepreneur, and a mother of two children: John Rondel - 8 years old, a grade-school student and Christian - 2 years old. Marienel is hoping that they can provide a good and quality education for their children someday. She and her family live in the mountainous village of Mapalad of San Agustin, Isabela.

Marienel manages a general store in their village. Aside from her store, she is also engaged in the direct selling of beauty products. She is thankful that her family helps her in the business, especially in dealing with her customers. With her need of additional business capital, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for further development of her store. Her business is of great help to her family and to the education of her children and also helps their farming needs. She hopes that she can become a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: Further development of her general store

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer R. and her family live in the mountainous place of Barangay Mapalad, San Agustin, Isabela. She is 34 years old and the mother of three children: Zeresh Zcaria - 12 years old, first year high school; Jake Joel - 10 years old, grade 5 and Ma. Angelica - 2 years old. With the support of her husband, Jennifer is doing her best to provide a progressive standard of living.

Jennifer is engaged in a direct selling business. She purchases beauty products from Avon and then she sells them to her customers. Her need for additional capital in the business motivated her to request a loan of PHP 4,000. She plans to use the loan as additional capital in her direct selling business in order to increase her monthly income for the benefit of her children and improvement of her business. She hopes that lenders will approve her request.

loans.use: To increase her stock of Avon products

loans.name: Regielyn

texts.en:
Regielyn has managed her general store for almost nine years and has been able to earn an average weekly income of PHP 1,500. She has a lot of customers in their village and sometimes she could not meet their needs due to limited resources.

Because of this, she would like to request a loan amount of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional capital. She will use the loan to purchase different merchandise like soft drinks and biscuits (cookies) that are very much in demand during harvest season. She hopes that her request will be granted so that she can fulfill her dreams not only for her business but also for her family, especially in sending their children to school.

Regielyn is 34 years old and married to Jouly. The couple is blessed with three children: Keith Dimple - 9 years old, now in grade school; Kaye Sarah - 3 years old and the youngest, Kins Leah - 1 year old. She believes that “through hard work and patience every dream will turn to reality as long as she has faith in God”.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita S. is 62 years old and still active in her business. She and her husband have three children: Bob is now 44 years old, Benivida is 42 years old and the youngest Bienvinido is 41 years old. All of their children are married. The eldest supports his family through farming, while Benivida and Bienvinido both work abroad. Estelita and Artemio (her husband) are already weak but still strive to support their daily life. 

Estelita runs a general store where she generates an average net income of PHP300 a day. She wants to purchase additional merchandise for her store, such as cans of cooking oil, sacks of sugar and salt, soap and other goods, in order to meet the demand of her customers. She is requesting a PHP15,000 loan for financial assistance, which will contribute a lot to her business and to the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items.

loans.name: Khujan

texts.ru:
Хужан Мамидов 1946 года рождения, женат имеет 7 детей.Высшего образования не имеет. Сам он пенсионер, нигде не работает. Хужан  разводит скот более 30 лет. Сыновья находятся в России. Дочери вышли замуж но навещают его часто. У него 3 коровы. Невестки ухаживают за коровой. 
Ему потребовался кредит  для расширения  поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Khujan M. was born in 1946, he is married with 7 children. He does not have a college education. Khujan is a retiree and does not have a job. He has been raising livestock for more than 30 years. His sons are in Russia. His daughters are married but visit him often. Khujan has 3 cows and his daughters-in-law take care of them. He needs a loan to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima operates a sari-sari store (a community-based store) in their village in Marasat Paqueńo, San Mateo, Isabela. She and her husband are blessed to have four children: Carmela, 25, Carlo, 23, Jimmy Mar, 18, and the youngest, Margie, who is 16 years old. Jimmy Mar and Margie are both fourth-year high school students. With the support of Fatima's husband, they are able to provide for the needs of their family and to send their children to school. But they worry that they may not be able to pay for their college education next school-year.

Fatima would like to have additional capital that she can use to buy additional commodities to sell in her store. She is now looking for financial assistance amounting to PHP10, 000.00. She will be very much thankful if her loan will be granted by the lenders, for it will really help her towards the development of her business and to secure the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities to sell in her store.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo is 45 years old and she is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs like palm oil, melon seeds, rice, etc. She hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Luena

texts.en:
Luena has managed her sari-sari store (community-based store) for three years, earning a monthly income of PHP 2,000.00 which is not enough to sustain the needs of her family and the education of their children. She is having a difficult time because the income of her husband as a farmer is being used as rolling capital for their farming needs since the farm inputs today are very expensive. Luena wants to improve her business and income and so is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 in order to increase the amount of merchandise she carries. She hopes that her loan request will be granted soon.

Luena, 35, enjoys her business with the support of her husband and three children: Aldrin - 16 years old, fourth year high; Abegail - 13 years old, first year high school, and Gemar - 6 years old. She hopes that she can continue to send all of her children to school and give them a good education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo T. is a resident of Brgy. Santiago Iligan City. He is 51 years of age, a widower with 4 children. He engages in the bicycle "pedicab" transport business. Every day he strives hard to provide support and care for his children. He has a high school and college student, and one child who is working who help him with their daily finances. He is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner, for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: Maintenance for bicycle "pedicab"

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Olatunbosan

texts.en: Olatunbosan is 30 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells kitchen utensils like plates, spoons, forks, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Abdusadik

texts.ru: Абдусадык Жуманов 1975 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей. Дома содержит скот, несколько голов скота. Молоко и другие молочные продукты подает на рынке или приходят и забирают с его двора. Жена  работает в колхозе, каждый месяц получает продукты(масло , муку, рис) вместо денег. Абдусадык зарабатывает , еще тем что собирает стадо, скот соседей и идут на пастбище в горы.  И так каждый месяц, по очереди соседи и односельчане собирают скот и идут в горы на пастбище, кормить скот. Это тоже один из видов дохода в их селе.
texts.en:
Abdusadik J. was born in 1975. He is married and has 2 children. He keeps several heads of livestock at home. He sells milk and dairy products at the market or customers come and pick them up from his yard. His wife works on the collective farm and receives food products every month (butter, flour, rice) instead of money. Abdusadik also earns money by collecting a flock, the livestock of neighbors and taking it out to pasture in the mountains. This happens every month, one at a time the neighbors and villagers collect livestock and take it out to pasture in the mountains to feed it. This is also one of the sources of income in the village.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Salamont

texts.en: Salamont is 36 years old and she is married without no children. She is a tailor and she also sells drinks and sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to make a living. She is an active LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell.

She is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Bozorjon

texts.ru: Бозорчон - женщина 50 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом скота и переработкой шерсти. Её муж занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Сыновья помогают отцу, а дочки и невестка помогают Бозорчон. Когда ее муж сострижёт овец и коз, а это бывает в летнее время, Бозорчон берет всю шерсть, и перерабатывает ее, потом везет на рынок и продает их вязальщицам. Она заинтересована в покупке скота.
texts.en:
Bozorjon is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has 5 children. She raises livestock and processes wool. Her husband resells livestock at the livestock market. Her sons help their father and the daughters and daughter-in-law help Bozorjon. When her husband shaves the sheep and goats, which occurs in the summer, Bozorjon takes all the wool and processes it, then she takes it to the market and sells it to knitters. She is interested in purchasing livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Sifat

texts.ru: Сифат  Эргашева 1949 года рождения,замужем  имеет 4 детей. Сифат не закончила школу, отец выдал замуж рано, пришлось сидеть дома. Сейчас имеет 8 внуков, очень рада. Дома содержит несколько голов скота. Скот содержит почти 20 лет. Ей  помогают невестки, утром выводят скот на пастбище, ухаживают за скотом и помогают стричь и убирать коровник. Кредит потребовался на покупку скота и корма для скота.
texts.en:
Sifat E. was born in 1949, she is married and has 4 children. Sifat did not finish school, her father married her off early and she had to stay at home. Now she has 8 grandchildren and is very happy. She keeps several heads of livestock at home. She has had livestock for almost 20 years. Her daughters-in-law help her, they take the livestock to pasture in the morning, take care of it, help to cut hair and clean the barn. Sifat needs a loan to purchase livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: At 33, Norma L. finds a way to help her husband sustain their daily living. She is married to Joel L. and blessed with 4 children. They are engaged in a bakery business wherein her husband is the baker and she is the one who vends the baked bread to their neighbors and nearby villages. Norma is happy with what they have started and plans to improve the business. She wants to receive a loan from HSPFI in the amount of PHP 4,000 to have additional capital for their existing business.

loans.use: Additional capital for a bakery

location.town: Zone 12, Bunawan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 40 years old and is married with three children.  She sells foodstuffs.  She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Nasrulo

texts.ru: Джалолов Насруло проживает в городе Вахдат, в возросте 54 лет.Женат имеет 5-рых детей, имеет среднее техническое образования.Сам клиент занимается торговлей, штор и зановесок у клиента имеется собственная торговая точка. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается более шести лет на местном рынке Хайр.На полученные деньги, клиент увеличит свой товар от получаемого дохода клиент содержит свою семью.
texts.en:
Nasrulo J., 54, lives in the city of Vahdat. He is married and has 5 children. He completed vocational education. This entrepreneur has his own store where he sells window blinds and curtains. He has been selling at the local Hayr market for over six years. The funds received will be used to expand inventory, bringing income to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells drinks and pepper soup.  She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and ingredients to cook more pepper soup. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Oyinkansola

texts.en: Oyinkansola is 32 years old and married with two children.  She sells jewelery and cosmetics for a living. She started this business in 2001.  She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more jewelery and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nasrulo

texts.ru: Нарзулоев Насруло проживает в городе Вахдат, в возросте 46 лет.Женат имеет троих детей, имеет среднее  образования.Сам клиент занимается торговлей, у клиента имеется собственная торговая точка. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается более пяти лет Ходжикотагон.На полученные деньги, клиент хочет увеличит свой товар. От полученного дохода, клиент хочет отремантировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Nasrulo N., 46, lives in the city of Vahdat. He has a high school education, is married and has three children. This entrepreneur has his own store, and has been working in sales for over five years. He would like to receive funds to expand his inventory, and then use the income generated to make repairs to his home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо - женщина 59 лет. Вдова. Мать 5-х детей. У нее большой опыт торговли тканями. В основном она продает национальные ткани, потому, что потребность в национальных платьях очень большая, как городских женщин, так и сельских. Все женщины имеют в своём гардеробе национальные платья. Они очень красивые и очень идут таджикским девушкам и женщинам. Точинисо привозит свой товар из города Дубая Арабских Эмиратов. За один год кредитования в нашей организации, Точинисо увеличила ассортимент своего товара. Теперь у нее больше клиентов. Но она старается еще больше привозить товар, и сдавать оптом розничным торговцам. Последний кредит она потратит именно на это.
texts.en:
Tojiniso is a 59 year old woman. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She has a lot of experience selling fabrics. Mostly she sells traditional fabrics, because demand for traditional dresses is very high, both among city women and rural women. All women have traditional dresses in their wardrobe. They are very beautiful and look god on Tajik girls and women. Tojiniso brings her products from Dubai in the Arab Emirates. After one year of borrowing from our organization, Tojiniso increased her product assortment. Now she has more customers. But she tries even more to bring her products and to sell it in wholesale quantities to retail sellers. She plans to use her last loan precisely for this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for sale

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
H. Mavluda is 39 years old. She is married with three children. Mavluda sells fabric for sewing the national dress of Tajikistan. She has been in this business almost for 8 years. Mavluda has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients about which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has steady customers. Moreover, Mavluda’s prices for fabric are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. The income that she derives allows her to educate her children on a high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education. Now Mavluda needs $800 USD to purchase new types of fabric in order to increase the range of goods she sells. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.      
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabric inventory

loans.name: Neme

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de boisson locale appelée « tchoucoutou » qui est une boisson très appréciée dans le milieu Togolais et qui est préparée à base de mil. Le stock de mil dont elle dispose est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 2 sacs de mil. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est retraité et elle a 07 enfants. C’est cette activité qui lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman whose business consists in selling a local beverage called "tchoucoutou", which is made out of millet and very much appreciated in Togo. Her stock of millet has run out, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 2 sacks of millet. She's married to a retired gentlemen and has seven children. Her business enables her to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
H. Rahima is 42 years old. She is married and has a son. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in the town of Penjikent. Rahima works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses of Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works. She is very persistent and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 10 years.

Rahima is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she implemented the basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business in order to attain ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Rahima has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur.

However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue to see her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of $800 for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory. With your help, Rahima will be able to make her business succeed and support her son's education.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Oisara

texts.en:
N. Oisara is 38 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. She is a hard-working woman struggling to feed her children by selling traditional fabrics for national dresses. Oisara has a trading place in the center local markets of the town of Penjikent. She is trying to have a wide range of goods so as to able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with varying levels of income.

Oisara, being a devoted mother, is doing her best to ensure that her children are happy and well-educated. Today Oisara feels that with more working capital her business could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of $800 with the term of 12 months to jumpstart the business and raise the family's standard of living. Let's help this admirable mother give her children a brighter future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Иномов Шухрат проживает в городе Вахдат, в возросте 32-ух лет.Женат имеет двоих детей, имеет высшее педогогическое образования, по специальности не работает.Сам клиент занимается торговлей, у клиента имеется собственный магазин,который находится в городе Вахдат участок Бахор. Этим видом деятельности клиент занимается более шести лет .На полученные деньги, клиент хочет увеличит свой товар. От полученного дохода, клиент хочет хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Shuhrat I. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. He has a higher education in teaching, but he does not work by his profession. He is in the retail and has own store which is located in Vahdat in the Bahor region. He has been in this business for more than six years. Shuhrat wants to use the loan to increase his inventory. He will use the profit to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарчону 35 лет. Он женат и отец 4-х детей. У Зафарчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 30 овец и 10 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Зафарчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Зафарчона пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Зафарчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Зафарчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Zafarjon is 35 years old. He is married and the father of four children. Zafarjon has a herd of small-horned cattle, consisting of approximately 30 sheep and 10 goats. His wife is a housewife, but in her spare time spins the wool into yarn and knits a variety of warm items of clothing. She sells these things to neighbors and relatives. Each morning Zafarjon drives the cattle into the hills, where they graze, and in the evening drives them back home. Although he does not yet have any large-horned cattle, with this loan Zafarjon wants to purchase two medium-sized bulls. After fattening them for three to four months, he can sell them for a very good price. Zafarjon is very pleased to work with us because having credit is very beneficial to him.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Urozdavlat

texts.en:
I. Urozdavlat is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Urozdavlat is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily sheep, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most.

Urozdavlat requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of his sheep. By increasing his product he hopes to increase his household income, as well to stay solvent in terms of his ability to continue buying and selling animals.

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.en:
S. Saidahmad, 31, is married with three children. He has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for six years together with his wife.

Saidahmad would like to expand his business by adding more cattle to the ones he has. This is because he recently acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. He is requesting $600. With the additional income, Saidahmad will be better able to meet his family's financial obligations, and especially to provide for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Kholiboy

texts.en:
T. Kholiboy is a 54-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. Kholiboy has 25 years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products.

The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Kholiboy has many orders from traders for these products, but his cows do not give enough milk to keep up with these orders. Therefore, he decided to apply for $600 in order to purchase an additional cow and fodder.

Kholiboy is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living through this loan.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Ilhomiddin

texts.ru: Илхомиддину 44 лет. Женат. Имеет 4-х детей. У него высшее техническое образование. Его жена работает учительницей в их сельской школе. Её дети тоже идут в эту школу. Она учитель начальных классов. Зарплата учителей совсем маленкая, но жена Илхомиддина все равно ходит на работу, чтобы учить сельских детей. Илхомиддин. Он взял кредит, чтобы купить еще одну партию молодых овец.
texts.en:
Ilhomiddin is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. He completed his college education in a technical field. His wife works as a teacher in the school in their small town. Her children also attend this school. She teaches the youngest children. Although teachers' salaries are very small, Ilhomiddin's wife still goes to work in order to teach the village children. Ilhomiddin has applied for a loan to purchase another batch of young sheep.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling sheep

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Y. Dilorom is 34 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children.

Dilorom is a market vendor. For the last four years she has been selling cottonseed oil at the local market. In the traditional Tajik cuisine the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil - especially our national dish “Pilaw”, which needs much cottonseed oil in order it to be delicious. So the goods that Dilorom is selling are in strong demand among the population.

Today, Dilorom is planning to increase her business. For this reason she requests $800 for the term of 9 months. Dilorom is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат Абдурахманова  1956 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Вышла  на рынок торговать мелочами. Сейчас торгует почти 20 лет фруктами на центральном рынке Панчшанбе. Сын привозит товар, дочь помогает торговать фруктами и овощами. Её точка находится на  хорошем месте в центре рынка. Сотрудничает с  Микроинвест с 2007 года. У нее хороший спрос на фрукты, сейчас у всех авитаминоз и все покупают  у нее. Её сын привозит товар с Узбекистана, в этом он ей помогает.
Она благодарна Микроинвест  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Saodat was born in 1956, and is married with three children. She did not attend college, but instead began selling small items in the market. For almost 20 years she has sold fruit at the Panchshanbe central market. Her son keeps them supplied, while her daughter helps to sell fruit and vegetables. Her stall is located at an optimum place at the center of the market. Saodat has collaborated with MicroInvest since 2007. Her fruit is in great demand as vitamin deficiencies are common and everyone buys from her. Her son assists her by bringing in the produce from Uzbekistan. Saodat is grateful to MicroInvest for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Mamadali

texts.en:
Y. Mamadali, 68 years old, is married with three children. Mamadali sells dried fruits in the central local market. He has been in this business for 11 years.

Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan: any hostess will have dried fruits on hand for serving in case there are guests in the house. Moreover, dried fruits are served as a rule during all family occasions, such as wedding parties, birthday parties, and other events.

Considering the constant demand for his goods, Mamadali's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for the family. Now Mamadali wants to increase the stock of his goods in order to be able to supply all the demands of his buyers. For this purpose, he requests $800 for the term of 9 months. He is going to use the loan to purchase dried fruits, like raisins and apricots, as well as nuts, like almonds and pistachios, with the purpose of increasing his range of goods for sale.

Mamadali has already demonstrated himself to be a dependable client with positive credit history. He would like to thank all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits and nuts in order to increase his range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
A. Khalil is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their two children.

Khalil has been very familiar with agriculture since he was young. Thanks to his parents, he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from vegetable production. He works all day weeding, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked weeding his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. In addition, in his free time Khalil also provides welding services.

Khalil wishes to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. Khalil will invest the loan in the purchase of seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants, with the aim to have, in a few months, the best production in his community.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants for his farm

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Сокиев Фируз проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 23 года . Холост. Живет с родителями.Кроме них в семье живут брат со своей семьей. Семья большая. фируз работает в своей столовой , которая находится на периферии между городом Душанбе и Вахдат.Работает там уже около трех лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить продукты питания. Сделав запас продуктов длительного хранения ,он сможет обеспечить клиентов большим ассортиментом предлагаемых блюд.
texts.en:
Firuz S. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 23 years old and not married. He lives with parents. Besides him his brother with his wife also live in their big family. Firuz works in his eatery which is located in the periphery between Dushanbe and Vahdat. He has been working there for about three years. He plans to get a loan to buy food stuffs. By stocking up with food for long term storage he will be able to provide his customers with a bigger variety of dishes.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Eshkuzi

texts.en:
B. Eshkuzi is 50 years old. He is married and has four children. Eshkuzi was born in a simple rural family and has worked with livestock for 21 years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk.

Eshkuzi is requesting a loan of $800 to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him increase milk production and will provide income security to the family whenever one of the cows is in calf. The income will allow Eshkuzi to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality milk.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola E. sells drinks and provisions. She is 44 years old and married with five children.

Lola hopes to include the sale of turkey in her business. She needs the loan amount of N60000 to purchase more cartons of turkey to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cartons of turkey to sell

loans.name: Donyorbek

texts.en:
B. Donyorbek, 24, is the father of two small children. He is a villager in the Babajan Gafurov district in Northern Tajikistan. He and his wife are farmers who own a 0.8-hectare plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. Donyorbek also works as a constructor.

Donyorbek and his wife now face an obstacle in their plantation efforts because they do not have enough money to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. Thus, Donyorbek decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Donyorbek’s children are all small now, but he is already working hard today to provide them with the best future. Be an important part of the well-being of this young and noble family.
