To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Муяссар  Хасанова 1962 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. На рынке торгует почти 6 лет яйцами. Поставщики  привозят её яйца, она оплачивает  через пару дней после торговли. Она сейчас открыла  дополнительную торговую точку  колбасных изделий.  Дополнительно дома берет работу с наклейкой бисер на  ткани. Кредит получила на расширения бизнеса. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Muyassar K. was born in 1962. She is married and has two children. Although she did not go to college, she has sold eggs at the market for almost six years. Suppliers deliver the eggs to her, and she pays a few days after they are sold. Muyassar is now opening an additional shop to sell sausage. At home, she also beads fabric. Muyassar took out the loan to expand her business, and is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Rec Bassa Town Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the R.E.C Primary School, Bassa Town, which was founded by the government in 1945. The school has a total population of 575 pupils and twelve dedicated staff.

R.E.C Primary School, Bassa Town, makes good grades at the National Primary Schools Examinations (BECE) every academic year. Last academic year, for example, the school sent 206 candidates for the exams and all of them passed with flying colors. However, the school, like many other schools in the country, suffers from the lack of adequate classrooms and seating accommodation. They also suffer from the lack of adequate learning and teaching materials.

This will be the first loan from SMT/Kiva for teachers of the R.E.C Primary School. This loan will certainly be of immense help to these teachers. Since salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, especially so for people in the teaching profession, teachers could not use such salaries to buy or do anything important. But with a loan they can now buy or do something big and then repay the loan over a period of time. Some of them will use the loan to begin or to continue building a house; others to pay either for themselves to pursue further studies or to pay for their children’s education. Some will use it to invest in businesses in order to complement their monthly salaries. And still others will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture.

Mrs. Winston Ashcroff (third from right) is the head teacher of R.E.C Primary School. She was born in Hastings, twenty miles (thirty-two km) from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is age fifty-four, a widow with two children. One of her children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III) and the other in SSS II. She has been a teacher for thirty-three years now. Mrs. Winston will use this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Inobat

texts.ru: Инобат зоидова  1970 года рождения замужем, имеет 3 детей.  Высшего образования не имеет.  Торгует на рынке 9 лет. В ее ассортименте детские вещи, по ее словам о детских вещей остается хорошая прибыль. Наценка на  детские вещи большая и поэтому остается хорошая прибыль.  За кредитом обратилась  4 года назад, когда проводилась реклама со стороны сотрудников Микроинвест. Узнала об условиях получила первый кредит , но было страшно, получает очередной кредит и благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Inobat Z. was born in 1970. She is married and has three children. Although she did not attend college, she has been in business at the market for nine years. She has an inventory of children's clothing, and in her opinion, children's things still make a good profit. There is a high markup on children's things, so the profit remains good. Inobat applied for a loan four years ago in response to a MicroInvest advertisement. She was nervous when she found out about the terms of her first loan, but is now receiving her next loan and is grateful to Kiva.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her range of products

loans.name: Uskanboy

texts.en:
D. Uskanboy is a fifty-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who are working adults today, thanks to his example. In Uskanboy's business he raises and sells cattle. He has twenty years of experience in this field. Since cattle-raising and selling is a profitable business, Uskanboy has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Uskanboy wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of $800. Uskanboy thanks all lenders for their support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buy more cattle, expand the business and improve family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Married and the father of five children, R. Mahmud was born on January 29, 1959. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Mahmud has been selling cattle since 1989. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today Mahmud would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, a Kiva field partner, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
For the past six years, Y. Gulomjon has put a great deal of effort into his agricultural activities in the district of Babajan Gafurov in Northern Tajikistan. Despite his difficult economic situation, he has managed to support his family and provide his two children with everything they need. To develop his business, Gulomjon has made use of loans provided by IMON International, a Kiva field partner, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. Once again, Gulomjon seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, increase his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Gulomjon will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is twenty-six years old and single with no children. He sells bags of flour for baking loaves of bread. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan of $700 to purchase more flour to sell. He says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
This is a picture of Caroline A. Makeku, Fatmata K., Ramatu K. and Seinya K.. They named their group Munafan. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of $160. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses and consequently make better profits and improvements on their standards of living. 

Caroline A. M. (left) is the leader of this group. Caroline is forty-four years of age. She was born in Bonthe, southern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with three children. One of her children is in Senior Secondary School II (SSS II), the other in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III) and the other is in class IV. Caroline sells cakes. With this loan, she will buy sugar and a bag of flour. Caroline has been in this business for over twenty years now. This business remains her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a responsible father of two adult children. From the time he was a boy, he has practiced the honorable work of raising livestock, an activity passed down from his parents and which today brings him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Ikrom hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
This is a picture of Hawa W., Edna K., Petam C., Alice Y. and Oredola C.. They named their group Hold Tight. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of $165. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses. 

Hawa W. (left) is the leader of this group. Hawa is forty-six years old. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown. She is married to a village headman, and they have three children, who are all still in school. Hawa is a pig farmer, and she will use this loan to buy two additional pigs. Hawa has been in this business for five years.

loans.use: Buy two pigs

loans.name: Lawrenta

texts.en: Lawrenta J. sells kerosene by the gallon. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is thirty-two years old and has five children. She wants a loan of $350 to purchase more gallons of kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Munavar

texts.en:
M. Munavar is forty-five years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Munavar is doing the best she can to ensure the best future for her children. That is the reason that she has been running her own small business for twenty-nine years. She has a place in the central local market for selling food, such as macaroni, sugar, spices and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Because the business is stable, she can improve the level of her family's living conditions. Munavar needs a loan to increase the variety of goods she sells. She is asking for a loan of $800 for the term of 12 months. Munavar and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi N. is forty-seven years old and married with seven children. She sells secondhand clothing. She purchases the clothes from Cotonou to sell in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is asking for a loan of $550 to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
This is Massah M. Z., Fereh Musu C., Mabel S., Adama B. and Isatu B. K.. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000. With this loan, each will be able to increase the size and quality of their business and consequently make better profit and improve their standard of living.

Massah (second from left) is the leader of this group. Massah is fifty years of age. She was born in Lumpa, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married to a professional worker and the two of them have one child who is presently in college. Massah sells soap, bottled water and “patched” groundnuts (roasted peanuts). She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
This is Fannyann D., Dowu W., Eugenia B., Aminata M., Augustine N. and Ened Y.. They named their group Hope. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses. 

Fannyann D. (left) is the leader of this group. Fannyann is 49 years of age. She was born in Hastings, 20 miles from Freetown. She is single with four children. One of her children is already a grown-up and the other three are still in school. Fannyann is a poultry owner. She will invest this loan into her poultry business by increasing her stock of chickens. She has been in this business for six years now.

loans.use: Expand her business by adding to her stock of chickens

loans.name: James

texts.en: James I. sells cylinders. He also repairs cylinders. He is 43 years old and married with six children. He hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more cylinders to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cylinders to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi  de l’association Nissondia sont 3 mariées et une veuve. Elles sont âgées de 30 à 55 ans, mères de 4 enfants en moyenne et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Massablacoura à Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers qui tournent autour des céréales et des vêtements.
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les femmes de Benkadi vont acheter avec ce prêt, 5 sacs d’arachide et 4 sacs de riz avec les paysans des villages environnants de Bougouni. Ces céréales sont ensuite décortiquées et revendues en détail au marché de Bougouni. La clientèle est composée surtout de ménagères. Les vendeuses d’habits achètent 20 complets pour hommes au Burkina Faso pour les vendre à Bougouni généralement aux hommes.
Ce commerce est rentable car il permet aux membres du groupe de gagner chacune en moyenne 30.000 FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face à des dépenses de la famille notamment les dépenses liées à la santé, l’éducation et l‘habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi of the association Nissondia is composed of three married women and one widow. They range in age from 30 to 55 years of age and are mothers averaging four children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the Massablacoura district in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are united by community ties, and they do commerce in various goods having to do with grains and clothing.

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for two years and are on their third solidarity loan. The preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The group members are going to use this loan to buy five sacks of peanuts and four sacks of rice from rural producers in villages surrounding Bougouni. The grain is then hulled and sold retail at the Bougouni marketplace. The customers are composed particularly of housewives. The clothing retailers are buying twenty men's suits in Burkina Faso to sell in Bougouni generally to men.

This business is profitable because it enables each group member to earn an average of 30,000 francs CFA a month. This profit margin allows for the making of loan payments and for addressing family expenses, notably those associated with the children's health, education, and clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and grain

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth I. sells bottled water, canned drinks and juice. She is 26 years old and single without a child.

Loveth is hoping for the loan amount of N70000 to purchase more canned drinks and bottled water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottled water and canned drinks to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  quatre femmes  du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sabali sont toutes mariées. Elles sont âgées de 35 à 47 ans, mères de 2 enfants en moyenne et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de  Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage et exercent essentiellement le commerce de céréales (fonio, riz, mil etc.)
Ces femmes sont partenaires de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les femmes de Benkadi vont acheter avec ce prêt 100 kg de mil, 50 kg de fonio, 150 kg de riz avec les paysans des villages environnants de Bougouni. Ces céréales sont revendues au détail au marché de Bougouni. La clientèle est composée surtout de femmes ménagères.
Ce commerce est rentable car il permet aux membres du groupe de gagner chacune en moyenne 40.000FCFA par mois. Cette marge bénéficiaire permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face à des dépenses de la famille notamment les dépenses liées à la santé, l’éducation et l‘habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benkadi of the association Sabali are all married. They range in age from 35 to 47 and are mothers averaging two children each on average. They live in traditional extended families in the Massablacoura district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are united by community ties, and they essentially do commerce in grains (fonio, rice, millet, etc.)

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for two years and are on their fifth solidarity loan. The preceding loans were correctly repaid. The women of Benkadi are going to use this loan to buy 100 kg of millet, 50 kg of fonio, and 150 kg of rice from rural producers of the villages surrounding Bougouni. The grain is sold retail at the Bougouni marketplace. The customers are composed especially of housewives.

This business is profitable because it enables each group member to earn an average of 40,000 francs CFA per month. This profit margin allows for the making of loan payments and for addressing family expenses, notably those associated with the children's health, education, and clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more things for her shop

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice, whose husband is a commercial motor cyclist, has been in the business of selling eggs for a long time. Pictured with two of her four children, this 42-year-old entrepreneur is requesting a loan of N50000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba M., the mother of four children, has sold kenkey (a kind of sourdough dumpling) at Yamoransa near Cape Coast since 1992.  Her husband works as a driver in the Cape Coast area.  Aba is responsible for paying rent, school fees and utilities. Her loan will be used to further expand the business by increasing the quantity of maize she buys for the production of the kenkey, and she hopes to use the new profits from her increased sales to build a home for her family.

loans.use: To expand the business by increasing the quantity of maize she buys for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah T. is a trader who sells tea, bread and eggs in Yamoransa near Cape Coast. She is married with two children and has received an education through junior-high school. While Dorah works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver in the Cape Coast area.

Dorah is an experienced businesswoman and has been involved in her trade since 1989. She is responsible for paying various family expenses such as school fees, utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods for resale and she hopes to use her increased profits to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en: Mrs. Esterlina O., a 63-year-old mother of six, lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. Being a single parent is not easy for her, but she finds ways and means to survive. While she engages in buy and sell activities, she recently ventured into flower-selling, and with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she has thus far been able to sustain the business. Today, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional ornamental plants & fertilizers. Having good health is what she prays for always, and in the future she wants to own a flower shop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for ornamental plants & other flowers for sale.

loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.fr: Chantal est âgée de 34 ans, célibataire et mère d’une fille de 12 ans qui est élève. Elle vend des fruits, arachides ainsi que des boissons sucrées. Initiée par sa mère depuis 1985, elle a acquit une expérience solide en vente et en gestion au fil des années. En 1992, son capital initial pour sa propre affaire était de $20 qui lui avaient permit d’acheter 1 sac d’arachides qu’elle a commencé à revendre.  Au cours des années 1992 à 2001, en dépit des difficultés rencontrées telles que les pillages de 1993, l’instabilité politique et économique dans la ville, Chantal est parvenue à totaliser un capital de $300 grâce au travail assidu et une bonne gestion. Elle suspendu par après son activité pour raison de santé et la relança en 2006. Dans le souci de réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un jour une maison d’habillement dame, Chantal a décidé  d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope RDC dénommé « Adonai » en octobre 2008.  Elle a obtenu des crédits qu’elle a complètement remboursés à temps. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $18 par semaine qu’elle compte accroitre avec le prochain crédit.
texts.en:
Chantal, age 34 and unmarried, is the mother of one 12-year-old girl who attends school. She sells fruits, peanuts, as well as soft drinks. She was introduced to this business by her mother in 1985 and, over the years, she has acquired a strong experience in sales and management. In 1992, her starting capital amounted to $20, which enabled her to buy one sack of peanuts, which she started reselling. From 1992 to 2001, thanks to her diligent work and good management, Chantal managed to increase her capital to $300, in spite of the encountered difficulties, such as the pillages of 1993 and the political and economical instability in her city. Thereafter, she suspended her business due to health issues, and restarted it in 2006. Eager to one day realize her ambition to open a women's clothes store, Chantal decided to join the Adonai group in October 2008. Adonai is one of the groups of Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Hope DRC. She got several loans, which she repaid in full and on time. Her business currently turns a weekly profit of $18, which she hopes to increase with the next loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of peanuts and bananas

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two children. She sells women's clothing and has been in this business for seven years. She enjoys selling women's clothing and chooses good clothing that her clients like to wear. Olena has affordable prices and good variety, which allows her to attract and retain many clients.

Olena would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to add to the assortment of her goods. She would like to spend additional income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of women's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Mr. D. has 4 hectares of arable land which he uses to grow corn and peas. He also has 3 hectares of Savinion and Pino vines. Ion also breeds animals, he owns 12 sheep and two pigs, and expects to increase the number of animals this year. He plans to use the loan to buy technologies to increase his breeding efficiency.

loans.use: Increase breeding productivity

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Ms. Adelaida E., 45 years old, is a single mom to her only child. She presently resides at Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her business is a small grocery store that started with a capital of PHP 2,000. She is a good member of Paglaum and has established a good reputation in her neighborhood. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, and other items for her store's inventory. She hopes to improve the condition of her life, with her child beside her.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lita C. is 62 years old, married and lives in Labo, Aloran, Mis. Occ. Her husband is a fisherman. She has three children. With a desire to help her husband, she ventured into bread-making and snack vending, starting up with a capital of only PHP 500. Her primary customers are her neighbors and friends and co-members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

She joined the co-op in order to avail herself of their credit facilities. She was thankful to Paglaum MPC that her purpose of obtaining additional capital was realized. Now, she applies for PHP 14,900 to buy flour and ingredients for bread-making. She dreams to own a parcel of land someday.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for bread making

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail has three hectares of arable land and two hectares of vines of the Sauvignon and Pinot sort. He now needs financial resources so that he can perform necessary agricultural work in the spring.

On the arable land, he wants to plant sunflowers, maize, and spring barley. Agricultural work is performed mostly by his family, but in some cases he asks his friends to help him.

Mihail can increase his business by 50 percent from the investments made through this loan.

loans.use: To increase his farming business by 50 percent.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow and has three grown-up children. She owns a little store, located close to the market area, and sells women's clothing and shoes. Valentina has been in this business for eight years. Her vast experience helps her to choose the right goods that sell well. Valentina lives by herself in a small apartment.

Valentina would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. The larger the assortment, the more clients she can attract. Valentina would spend additional income to help her children with their living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sanyu Immaculate ‘S Group

texts.en:
Immaculate is 27 and married with one child who is 6. Her child goes to school. She rents a one-room house where she lives with two people, but doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Immaculate sells second-hand shoes and operates a ladies salon in Nakulabye, one of the Kampala city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to and from shopping. She goes shopping once a week and buys second-hand shoes from Owino Market and cosmetics from Kikuubo, one of the busiest shopping centers in Uganda.

Immaculate receives about 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and rent for her business premises is 50000 per month. She has done this business for four years now and is faced with the challenges of high rent and the rainy season. She works in a place prone to floods and when it rains, she doesn’t receive any customers.

This is her fifth loan since she joined MCDT two years ago with the same group mates. Immaculate wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand shoes and more cosmetics for her salon. She aspires to see her business grow bigger, and to own two salons.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and cosmetics for her shop

loans.name: Meselinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Mesilinda B., 53 years old, married and lives at Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. After she heard some news about Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative, she got interested in it and that’s why she joined the coop. She has availed herself of loans several times and started her project which is pig raising. 

Today, she applies for 20,000 Phillipine Pesos to buy construction materials for house renovation. The means to pay her loan shall be taken from her business. Erecting a decent home is what she dreams of for her family.  She also hopes that someday, her business will become successful and more profitable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat is 45 years old and she is a widow with 2 children. She sells drinks, bottled water, and juice. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks, bottled water, and juice to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy beverages for resale

loans.name: Hadja Nayiga‘S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 38 years of age and married with 6 children between 1 1/2 and 21 years. Three of the children go to school. She owns a four-roomed house where she lives with seven people and takes care of additional family members (mother and two younger sisters and brothers). She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah sells second hand clothes at Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to and from work. Hadjah receives about 30 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on retail basis. She works seven days a week and rent for her business premises is 50,000 Ugandan Shillings (about US $23) per month. She has been in this business for ten years now and is faced with the two challenges of high rent and the rainy season. She works from a place which is prone to floods; when it rains she doesn’t receive any customers.

This is her tenth loan since she joined MCDT five years ago, working this long with the same group mates Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and to opening another stall in Bwaise.

loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en: Ramota is a 42-year-old  widow with five children. She makes a living selling fresh tomatoes and peppers to her customers. She has applied for a loan to buy more fresh tomatoes and peppers to sell. Ramota thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more fresh tomatoes and peppers.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 37 years old, married and has three children. She makes a living selling drinks, various types of food and kitchen utensils. She has been in this business for a long time, and hopes to own a big supermarket in future. Funmi is applying for this loan to buy more food, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell. She extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more food, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Mrs. Elita J. is 38 years old, married and blessed with two children, both of whom are in school. She and her husband run a small business selling gasoline and lumber. They started this business with money they saved up over many years.

Elita became an official member of Paglaum in July, 2006 and has made good use of our credit services. She is applying for a new loan to buy more gasoline to sell to her customers.

She is very grateful for the support she has received from Paglaum. Her good repayment record has qualified her for a higher loan amount. If this loan is funded and business conditions continue strong, Elita is confident that all her children will be able to get a good education.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Titi Aurélie

texts.fr: K. titi est une femme mariée qui a 03 enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè adougba. Son mari est retraité et son revenu ne pouvant plus couvrir toutes les charges de la maison, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de bois de chauffage. Ainsi le revenu qu’elle gagne lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de al famille. Son stock actuel de bois de chauffage étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 100 tas de bois de chauffage.
texts.en:
K. Titi is a married women who has three children. She resides with her family in the Agoè Adougba district. Her husband is retired. And since her income was no longer able to cover all household expenses, she got started in 2007 in the commerce of firewood. Thus, the income she earns enables her to help with family expenses. With her current stock of firewood depleted, she's requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 100 piles of firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Mrs. Riza C. is 33 years old and married to Pedro C., who is a fisherman. They are blessed with four children and live in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a new member of the Paglaum MPC micro-finance program, and runs a small stand selling snacks. She is applying for a loan to buy more snack items to sell to her customers.  She hopes that the increased income made possible by this loan will allow her to better provide for her family's needs. Mrs. C.'s goal is to have her own canteen one day, and to be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, and spices to make snacks to sell her customers.

loans.name: Samalie Nabukalu ‘S Group

texts.en:
Samalie is 31 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 10 months and 11 years. Her two older children go to school. She owns a five-room house where she lives with her family, and also takes care of additional family members--her mother and her late brother's two children. Samalie has access to electricity and piped water at home, and the family gets three meals a day. 

Another member of Samalie's loan group, Leticia, makes a living running a retail shop in a nearby suburb. She uses public transport to get to and from her store. Samalie gets about 20 customers a day and sells to all types of people. She works seven days a week and rents her business location. She has been in this line of work for 10 years, and made a living selling milk before that. This is her twentieth loan since joining MCDT ten years ago. Immaculate wants to use this loan to buy more things for her shop, and hopes to own a wholesale business some day.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her shop

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells a local variety of gin, popularly known in Nigeria as "ogogoro." She hopes for a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more ogogoro for sale. She hopes to use this loan to meet the demands of her customers, and she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ogogoro for sale.

loans.name: Abla Emekonawo

texts.fr: Madame A. Abla est une résidente du quartier de sogbossito, elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits génériques, elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006. Elle a ouvert à cet effet sa boutique dans laquelle elle exerce ce commerce. Ne disposant pas d’assez de produits génériques, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 2 cartons d’EFFERLAGAN, 2 cartons de GRIPPE WATER, 1 carton de PARCETAMOL et 1 carton d’IBUCAP. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est enseignant.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Abla is a resident of the Sogbossito district. Her work involves selling generic pharmaceutical products. This is a business she started in 2006. She then opened her shop and does business there. Lacking enough merchandise, she's requesting a loan from WAGES that will enable her to buy two boxes of EFFERLAGAN (reduces pain and fever), two boxes of GRIPE WATER (for colic or stomach ailments in infants), one box of PARCETAMOL (pain reliever), and one box of IBUCAP (for pain and inflammation). She is married to a gentleman who is a teacher.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is an entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. She sells groceries in the central city market. She is married and raising two kids.

Yuliya’s business is flourishing. This is due to the fact that she carries a wide assortment of merchandise that is always in demand, and she has loyal clients who often come to shop from her. Yuliya has been successfully running this business for six years and has about 21,000 Hrivnya in turnover capital. Her monthly profit amounts to 2,400 Hrivnya.

Consistent demand for her products, combined with Yuliya’s integrity, positive reputation, and good credit history, only add to the successful development of Yuliya’s venture. Today she is seeking a loan for 8,000 Hrivnya to re-stock her merchandise. She is hoping to generate additional income with new food products and increased sales.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory and to purchase new food products for sale.

loans.name: Mosurat

texts.en: Mosurat is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells cooked foods such as rice, beans, and fufu. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers, and she sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Hellen Nakato's Group

texts.en:
Hellen, 24, is single with no children. She resides with her parents. The family lives in a five-room house. Hellen takes care of her father and mother, plus the three orphaned children of her late sister. She has access to electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day.

Hellen sells charcoal in Busega, one of Kampala's city suburbs, and also acts as a sales agent for animal feed. This is how she earns a living. She uses public transportation to and from shopping. Hellen receives about 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. Rent for the use of her business premises is about 40000/= per month. She has been engaged in this business for three years now.

This is her tenth loan since joining MCDT five years ago: she has been a member of this same group, with the same group members, ever since she joined.

Hellen wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and animal feed. She dreams of owning a permanent shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and more animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Mrs. Daisy T. is 48 years old. Her husband Gil is a fisherman. Daisy is a mother of five: four of her children are in school and the youngest is a two-year-old boy. Her husband is tireless in his support of the family through fishing, and Daisy works in tandem with Gil in selling the fish in their neighborhood.

In order to obtain added income, Daisy manages a small food store. She manages her business well: in fact, the income from the store allowed her to acquire more fishing materials.

She would like to utilize her loan to purchase a pumpboat machine for fishing. She wishes to improve their livelihood and hopes that someday all her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase a pumpboat machine for fishing.

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Mrs. Melodina B. is 49 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer and they own a little parcel of land. Although it is her husband who cultivates this land, gardening has also become her own primary activity. It began as a back-yard gardening project and eventually led to selling a few of her garden vegetables during market day.

She’s thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for providing them with financial assistance in the past. She is now applying for PHP 20,000 to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for her garden. She also wants to buy a cow.

She has many plans for the future. One of her dreams is that someday, she will be the one supplying vegetables in the market.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers and a cow.

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married with two sons. Her family lives in Belaya Tserkov. Tatyana owns a small vending container to sell women’s outerwear in one of the local markets of her hometown called “Comfort.” Tetyana has been in business for eight years. Presently, she has 35,000 Hrivnya invested in merchandise and her average gross income amounts to 17,000 Hrivnya. Net profit teeters between 3,000 and 3,600 Hrivnya a month.

Tetyana is seeking a loan of 4,200 Hrivnya to purchase affordable clothing items for further retail sale this spring/summer season. She is hoping to continue building a solid venture with stable income. Being an enterprising and determined person, Tetyana is a good example of a focused entrepreneur who knows what she wants from life and how to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke is 42 years old and married with three children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She hopes to own a big supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two sons, Rooslan and Andriy. She lives in Belaya Tserkov and sells women’s clothing, yarn, and knitting supplies in the local covered market called “Comfort." Larisa has a vending container and 40,000 Hrivnya in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 15,000 Hrivnya and her net profit is slightly over 3,000 Hrivnya a month.

Larisa is an average Ukrainian entrepreneur. She seeks to maintain a stable income and to be able to provide for her family and herself. One of Larisa’s sons is disabled and she tries her best to provide for all his needs as well as make his life brighter and filled with positive emotions.

Larisa is used to hard work and she is always ready to work extra hours to ensure a better standard of living for her family. This time, she is requesting a loan of 6,100 Hrivnya to stock her inventory for the spring/summer season.

loans.use: To restock inventory of clothing, yarn, and knitting supplies for sale.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en: Remelyn has been married for one year and she is blessed with an eight-month-old baby. Her husband works in a construction firm as a technician in Cebu City. She receives a monthly allowance for the family's needs. The family stays with her mother at Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. She has been a Paglaum MPC member for more than a year and is now availing a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 for her fourth cycle. With regards to her previous loan accounts, they were paid thoroughly and without default. She has a sari-sari store in a location which she hopes will lead to success, with God's grace. She is doing it all for her baby's future. She was interested in Paglaum MPC because it has such good services and programs, especially on their insurance products.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store such as noodles, laundry items, and other inventory

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is a hair stylist and she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and drinks in her salon. She hopes for a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Florence Namuwonge's Group

texts.en: Florence is 36 years of age and married with four children between the ages of seven and 16 years. All her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she lives with six people and takes care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and no piped water at home. The family gets three meals per day. Florence sells second hand clothes in Owino market, which is one of the busiest markets in Kampala City. That is how she earns a living. She uses public transportation to and from work. Florence receives about 30 customers per day and sells to all categories of people. Florence works seven days per week and pays rent for her business premises at 20,000 UGX per month. She has done this business for one year now and is faced with the challenges of both high transport costs and the rainy season. She works from an open place, and when it rains she doesn’t receive any customers. This is her third loan ever since she joined MCDT and she has been with MCDT for one and a half years, working with the same group mates. Florence wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She aspires to see her business grow bigger.

loans.use: To buy more bales of cloths

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a carpenter earning Php 200 a day, but sometimes carpentry work is not available. That's why, aside from being a carpenter, he also does odd jobs just to get additional income for living. The couple is blessed with two children. Both are still in elementary school.

Felicidad is already on her second loan cycle amounting to Php 5,000.00. The proceeds of this loan are for the purchase of additional ingredients for her snack-vending business, such as "Banana Que," "Maroya," Toron and many others.

She is expecting a 20% mark-up on cost for her small business. She is hoping that in the near future she can open a "Sari-Sari" store (mini grocery) and wishes that her children can finish their college studies and have an income of their own.

loans.use: For the purchase of ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Sekinat

texts.en: Sekinat is 36 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Serifat

texts.en: Serifat is 56 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She sells cosmetics to make a living. She is an active LAPO client. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Mrs. Juanita G. is 64 years old and married to Mauresio G.. They have four children who have all been married already. She looks after the care of her grandchild while her daughter is abroad. Their source of income relies on her business: fruit and vegetable vending. They sell their products during market day in their town and the neighboring municipality and cities. Both husband and wife manage their business well and, in fact, it is still making ongoing progress now. She needs capital, so she is borrowing the amount of PHP 20,000.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 45 años, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos. Hace más de 9 años instaló una tienda en su vivienda, en los inicios fue difícil captar nuevos clientes, pero hoy ha superado esta barrera y sus hijos son los que la ayudan en la atención cuando ella está muy ocupada. Su tienda está abierta todos los días, excepto los domingos, cuando Carmen descansa de su labor de toda la semana. Aunque la competencia ha aumentado, esto no la desanima, pues con el buen trato y la calidad de los productos que ofrece ha fidelizado a sus clientes y se proyecta hacia un futuro de crecimiento, diversificando su mercadería y ampliando el espacio de su bodega. Es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella desea seguir trabajando en su banco comunal porque le permite ahorrar. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen, 45, lives with her children in her own house. Over nine years ago she started a store in her house. In the beginning it was difficult to get new customers, but now she has overcome that obstacle. Her children help in the store when she is very busy. Her store is open every day except on Sunday, when Carmen rests from working all week. Even though the competition has increased, this does not worry her. Her customers are loyal because of the good treatment they receive and the quality of the products she offers. Because of this, she is on her way to a future where she can grow, diversify her merchandise, and expand the store’s space. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She wants to continue working with her community bank because it allows her to save. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married. His family lives in Vinogradovo. Pavlo owns a business selling household items and sunglasses in the central market of his home town. He owns a small vending kiosk right at the entrance to the marketplace. Pavlo started this business 7 years ago. Currently, he has about 35,000 Hrivnya in inventory. His gross income amounts to 15,000 Hrivnya.

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 12,000 Hrivnya to increase inventory and his proceeds as a result. One of his long-term plans is for the expansion of his business. Pavlo has benefited from the lending services provided by “Nadiya Ukraine” previously and has established a reputation for honesty as he worked with the organization. We believe this loan will provide further assistance to Pavlo as he seeks to develop his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To increase assorted inventory

loans.name: Oluyemisi

texts.en: Oluyemisi is 40 years old and she is divorced with 2 children. She sells drinks in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Magnita

texts.en: Mrs. Magnita S. is 45 years old and married to Carlito S.. They have 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman and their source of income is fishing. She needs the loan amount of PHP 15,000 for the acquisition of a new fishing boat and machine. Her husband works hard to sustain the needs of their children and the whole family. They are very thankful to Paglaum Coop and Kiva for the assistance and trust given by them.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and machine

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicine to make a living. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres en la casa propia de ellos. Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y también en ocasiones al bordado de fustanes que aprendió a elaborar desde su niñez. Trabaja todos los días, sin excepción, en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo y en la crianza de sus animales (ganado vacuno y ovino) en su establo. Gladys es una gran ayuda para sus padres y se constituye en el sostén de su casa, su deseo es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su establo y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tienen. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y también de los demás integrantes mutuamente. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de sacos de abono para esta campaña de siembra. También comprará insumos y materiales (telas e hilos) para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her parents in the house that they own. She does agricultural work and also makes embroidered slips (underskirts), which she learned to make as a child. She works everyday without fail, taking care of her farmland and raising livestock (cattle and sheep) in her stables. Gladys is a great help to her parents and supports most of the household. She wishes to keep improving the infrastructure of her stables and increasing the number of animals that she has. This is her second loan with MFP; she is very happy to belong to a community bank because it allows her to improve the quality of her life while also helping other members improve their quality of life. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer for this sowing season. She will also buy supplies and materials (cloth and thread) for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and materials for embroidering

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 40 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, se inició vendiendo poca mercadería y en la actualidad ya tiene mayores cantidades. Jenny trabaja vendiendo las prendas de vestir a personas conocidas y en ocasiones, en los días de feria comercial, vende de manera ambulante. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, el deseo de Jenny es mejorar sus  ingresos, y para ello está viendo la posibilidad de adquirir cada vez más mercadería al por mayor para aumentar sus ventas. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, desde que trabaja en su banco comunal se ha sentido muy apoyada por su grupo, y aunque puedan existir diferencias siempre existe el momento de la reconciliación. Jenny esta solicitando esta cantidad de dinero para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa y también de zapatos que le están solicitando sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny is 40 years old and lives with her children in her own home. Five years ago she began to sell clothing. She began by selling a small selection of merchandise and currently has a larger selection. Jenny works selling clothing to people that she knows and on occasion, on the commercial fair days, she is a traveling saleswoman. It is through this that she obtains the necessary income for her home. Jenny’s dream is to better her income, and to do that she is looking to acquire more merchandise at wholesale to increase her sales.

This is the second time that she has a loan with MFP. During the time she has been working with her communal bank she has felt very supported by her group, and although there can be differences the moment of reconciliation always exists. Jenny is soliciting this amount of money for the purchase of a larger quantity of clothing and also shoes that her customers are asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase of her merchandise

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Mrs. Angelita L. is 52 years old and married to Aurelio, a farmer and a carpenter. She is a MIGS, or Member in Good Standing, with Paglaum PMC under the Microfinance Program of Palayan 1 Center. Pig raising was her project when she borrowed the amount of PHP 20,000 for pigs and feed. She wants to have more additional pigs and also a pig pen someday. She hopes also to have their own concrete house and lot.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz Maria tiene 38 años, vive con sus 5 hijos en L. casa D. su hermana. Allí mismo, trabaja vendiendo hierbas medicinales, atendiendo los malestares D. las personas D. su comunidad con productos naturales, también ofrece masajes y otros tratamientos según L. necesidad del paciente. En esta actividad tiene una experiencia D. 10 años, se inició poco a poco y con L. experiencia adquirida su servicio ha ido mejorando cada vez más. El buen trato es un factor muy importante que mantiene L. fidelidad D. sus clientes, comenta Luz Maria. Para el futuro está planeando mejorar L. infraestructura D. su tienda para surtirL. con más y mejores productos. Es L. segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, conocer esta forma D. trabajo, en un banco comunal, le ha permitido ser una mejor persona, forjando el valor D. L. solidaridad. El dinero que solicita es para comprar mercadería, y D. esta forma mejorar el stock D. su tienda D. medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a 38-year-old woman who lives with her 5 children in her sister’s house, which is where she works selling medicinal plants. She cares for patients’ ills in her community with natural products, offering massages and other treatments patients may need as well. She has 10 years of experience in this field, and she has been improving little by little since she started out. Luz Maria states that good customer service is an important factor that maintain’s customer loyalty. She is planning on improving her store in the future so that she can restock it with more and better products. This is the second time she requests a loan from MFP. Learning this form of work in a microfinance institute has allowed her to be a better person, inculcating the value of solidarity. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can improve her natural remedy products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ariyo

texts.en: Ariyo is 38 years old and is married with 3 children. She sells sarongs, lace, and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs, lace, and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, lace, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Romalda

texts.es: Romalda tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijos, y por ahora está viviendo en una casa que le dieron a cuidar. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida y paralelamente a las labores agrícolas. Los días miércoles y sábados, que son días de feria comercial en su localidad es cuando vende sus platos de comida de forma ambulante, el resto de días trabaja en los cultivos que tiene en tierras arrendadas. Con estas dos actividades Romalda sostiene sola a sus 2 hijos que están en edad escolar, sabe que todo trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio, y por esta razón continuará, sin descanso, su trabajo diario, con el fin de mejorar su producción agrícola e implementar mejor su negocio de venta de comida. Es la segunda vez que Romalda tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal porque la ha aprendido a invertir adecuadamente su dinero, además es un espacio donde ha hecho muy buenas amigas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de platos y ollas nuevas, así como abarrotes por sacos para abastecerse en la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Romalda is a 30-year-old woman with two children. For now, they are living in a house that she is looking after. She has been in food sales and agriculture for the past 3 years. On Wednesdays and Saturdays, which are designated as street market days in her community, she sells fast food as a street vendor. During the rest of the week, she works on rented crop fields. Romalda supports her 2 school age children on her own with these two jobs. She knows that all jobs require much sacrifice, and for this reason, she will continue to work everyday without resting, with the aim of improving crop production and strengthening her fast food business. This is the second time that Romalda requests a loan from MFP. She is very happy to be a part of her microfinance institute because it has taught her how to properly invest her money. Furthermore, it provides her with a space in which she has made good friends. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase new pots and plates, as well as goods by the sack, so that she can stock her food business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Awawu

texts.en: Awawu is 39 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Alice Nalukwago‘S Group

texts.en: Alice is 32 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 2 months and 15 years. Four of her children go to school. She owns a six room house and takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Alice has a stall where she sells tomatoes and onions in lugala, one of Kampala city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to get to and from shopping. Alice receives about 15 customers a day and sells to all types of people. She works seven days a week and doesn’t pay rent charges as she works from her home. She has done this business for three years now.  This is her second loan since she joined MCDT and has been with MCDT for one year, working with the same group mates. Alice wants to use this loan partly to pay school fees for her children and also to buy boxes of tomatoes and onions. She aspires to one day go directly to farmers without involving third parties.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Luzira Posta Babirye Catherine Kitibwa Group

texts.en: B. Catherine K. is a single 34 year old who raises two kids who are not hers.  They are aged 13 and 9 years and both go to school. She is using the loan to sell air time, poles for building houses, and to stock a boutique which has shoes and clothes. She has been in the business for over 3 years. Her business is growing and she likes serving people in her community with food supplements, timber and building poles, and at the boutique (shoes and clothes). She is active, hardworking and encouraging. She desires to help the needy.

loans.use: To sell air time, poles for building houses, and to stock a boutique which has shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Bilikisu

texts.en: Bilikisu is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs and local gin.  She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and local gin to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 13 años. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica al bordado, esa larga trayectoria la ha mantenido gracias a su buena labor. Estos trabajos pueden durar hasta un mes, dependiendo de la complejidad de los diseños, lo que Rosalina produce servirá para las fiestas costumbristas de su localidad, donde las mujeres lucen faldas y chales con vistosos bordados. Para Rosalina este trabajo es un entretenimiento, el cual le permitió no descuidar la atención de sus hijos que hoy ya son personas mayores y están muy agradecidas a su madre por su protección y educación brindada. Para el futuro, Rosalina desea seguir dedicándose a esta labor porque no requiere de grandes esfuerzos físicos para realizarla. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a trabajar por el bienestar común de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de hilos de diversos colores y telas, que son los materiales indispensables para la elaboración de sus bordados artesanales.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 42-year-old woman who lives in her own house with her husband and 13-year-old son. For over 22 years, she has been embroidering for a living. She has been in business for such a long time thanks to the fine quality of her work. It could sometimes take her up to a whole month to finish embroidering, depending on how complicated the designs are. Rosalina makes clothing for her community’s traditional festivities in which women wear skirts and shawls with bright and colorful embroidery. For Rosalina, this line of work is a form of entertainment. It has allowed her to care for her children, who are now mostly all adults and are very grateful to their mother for always protecting them and providing them with an education. In the future, Rosalina would like to stay in the embroidery business because it does not require great physical exertion. This is the second time she requests a loan from MFP, and she is committed to work for her microfinance institute’s well-being. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase fabric and thread in various colors, materials that are indispensable for producing handmade embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for embroidering

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. She sells poultry feed to her customers. She hopes for a loan  of N140,000 in order to purchase more bags of poultry feed to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags poultry feed to sell

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es: Sofia tiene 28 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Trabaja todos los días en su cafetín, ubicado dentro de un jardín de niños (institución educativa de nivel inicial) cercano a su localidad. Todas las mañanas atiende los gustos de sus pequeños clientes y los maestros de la institución. Ofrece golosinas, bebidas y platos de comida, para ello, en algunas ocasiones, sus hijos la ayudan, y para Sofía es una gran alegría poder estar con sus hijos, y generar para ellos, ingresos económicos. Sus proyectos a futuro son de seguir adelante con este negocio mejorando cada vez más para aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, durante este tiempo de trabajo demostró ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos, hoy se compromete, una vez más, a seguir con esta actitud positiva. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor, así como víveres para la preparación de los menús diarios.
texts.en:
Sofia is 28 years old; she lives with her two children in a rented house. She works everyday in her small café located within a children’s playground (at a kindergarten school) near her town. Every morning she serves her young customers and the teachers of the school. She offers candy, drinks and food, and on some occasions her children help her with the work. It makes Sofia really happy to be with her children and to generate economic earnings to provide for them. Her future projects are to continue advancing this business, improving her sales and earnings a little more each time. This is her second MFP loan. During this period of work she has demonstrated being punctual and responsible in her loan payments. Today she promises, once again, to continue her positive attitude. The money she’s requesting will be invested in the purchase of wholesale candy, as provisions for the preparation of the daily menus.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy and other ingredients for food preparation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzira Posta Namara Bilton Group

texts.en: N. Bilton is a single lady with 2 daughters aged 16 and 9 who both attend school. She will use the loan to purchase ladies' used skirts, blouses, jeans, suits, and dresses to sell in her boutique. This is her fifth year owning the boutique. She wishes to start more than 3 branches of boutiques in different places.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' used skirts, blouses, jeans, suits, and dresses.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo en una casa arrendada. Trabaja todos los días en su principal fuente de ingresos, que es una vulcanizadora donde ofrece el servicio de reparación de llantas de automóviles y con su compresora llena de aire las llantas de los autos de sus clientes. Este trabajo lo realiza junto a su esposo, quien es parte importante en el negocio, ambos se esmeran para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios, por ello, sus clientes van aumentando progresivamente. A las personas que atiende principalmente son choferes de unidades de transporte público, y el acceso a su local es estratégico, pues se encuentra en el paradero de la mayoría de las líneas de transporte. Para mas adelante, Sonia y su esposo ven la posibilidad de implementar su vulcanizadora con la venta de repuestos para automóviles. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y trabaja incesantemente para que ella, y cada miembro de su banco comunal sean beneficiados. El dinero que ahora solicita es para mejorar la infraestructura de su local y abastecerse de más  herramientas adecuadas para su labor.
texts.en:
Sonia is 35 years old, and she lives with her husband in a rented house. She works every day at her principal source of income, which is a vulcanizing business. She offers the services of repairing automobile tires, and filling the tires on her clients' cars with her air compressor. She carries out this work together with her husband, who is an important part of the business. They both work hard to improve the quality of their services, and because of their hard work, their customers progressively increase in number. Among their clientele, the majority are drivers of public transportation vehicles. Sonia and her husband strategically located their business by the bus stop where the majority of bus lines complete their route, so as to provide the drivers with easy access to their services. For the future, Sonia and her husband see the possibility of adding the sale of spare auto parts to their vulcanizing business. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she works incessantly so that she and each member of her communal bank may succeed and continue to receive loans. The money that she asks for now will be used to improve the infrastructure of her business site and to supply herself with more adequate tools for use in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejorar la infraestructura de su local

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende verduras en un mercado de la zona central de la ciudad donde vive, todas las mañanas, con la ayuda de su esposo, carga la mercadería que transporta hacia el mercado, luego se dedica, durante todo el día, a ofrecer sus productos, con un buen trato a las personas, verduras de calidad y un precio justo, lo que le garantizará el retorno de sus clientes. Vilma cuida bastante la presentación de sus productos, ya que de eso dependen sus ventas y ese ritmo de trabajo la hace sentir muy satisfecha, porque este negocio es un pilar en el sostenimiento de su hogar. Para más adelante, Vilma desea tener un puesto en el mercado amplio y propio donde pueda ofrecer toda clase y variedad de verduras. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por ser parte de su banco comunal, porque es un espacio de crecimiento personal y empresarial, por ello se compromete a seguir trabajando por el bienestar en común.Vilma está solicitando este préstamo para comprar más verduras al por mayor, y otra parte para pagar el transporte al mercado.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in their own home. She has sold vegetables for ten years at a market in the center of the city where she lives. Each morning she loads the merchandise to take to the market with her husbands help. Then she works all day offering her products while treating people well. Good quality vegetables at a fair price is what guarantees that her customers return. Vilma presents her products nicely since her sales depend on it. She is very happy with the rhythm of work because this business is a pillar that her house stands on. Later on Vilma would like to have a large stall of her own at the market where she could offer all types and varieties of vegetables. This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She is very thankful to be part of her community bank because it’s a place to grow personally and professionally. She is committed to continue working for the common good. Vilma is applying for this loan to purchase more vegetables at wholesale and partly to pay for transportation to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a vender pescado en todas sus variedades y plátanos, este negocio lo tiene en la parte de afuera de su casa en un pequeño kiosco que mandó a construir para esta actividad. Con esta labor ya lleva un lapso de 2 años y le va muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se relaciona con varias personas, como también hace muchos amigos, ya que es muy jovial al atender. Abraham considera que su negocio es rentable porque sus productos se venden diariamente, además se encuentra ubicado en un buen lugar, por donde transitan muchas personas y es el único que vende este tipo de productos en esa zona. Ya tiene 4 préstamos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comuna porque existe mucha comunicación entre sus compañeros, y sobre todo, que son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más pescados y plátanos en un costo de 500 soles, lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción (madera y calaminas), para hacer algunos arreglos a su kiosco, ya que necesita de una refacción.
texts.en:
Abraham is 48 years old and lives with his wife and their four children in their own house. He works selling all varieties of fish and bananas. He has the business outside his house in a small kiosk that he had built for this. He has had this job for 2 years and it is going well. He likes his job a lot because he deals with various people and makes many friends since he is very cheerful while serving. Abraham believes his business is profitable because his products sell daily. Besides, he is located in a good place where many people go by and he is the only one that sells these kinds of products in that area. He already has 4 loans with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). He likes to work with his community bank because there is a lot of communication among his coworkers and above all because they are punctual with their payments. He will buy more fish and bananas with 500 PEN of the money he is applying for. He will invest the rest in construction materials (wood and corrugated iron) to fix up his kiosk which needs repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola B. of Nigeria sells a locally made gin, popularly called Ogogoro. The demand for her product is high and she hopes to be able to meet the increased demands of her customers. She would like to make loan of N100,000 to purchase more inventory of locally made gin to resell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more locally made gin for resale

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien es policía, y ambos son padres de una hija de 8 años, que cursa estudios primarios, la casa que habitan es propia. Ella es propietaria de cinco motocarros, los mismos que son manejados por chóferes particulares que contrata para realizar transporte de pasajeros (taxi). Estos vehículos los tiene hace 4 años, los mismos que trabajan de lunes a sábado en un horario de 5 de la mañana hasta 9 de la noche. Dina es la encargada de administrar las ganancias de sus motocarros, verificar su estado y llevarlos a hacerles mantenimiento o reparar si tienen algunas fallas. Dina está muy contenta, porque hasta el momento este negocio le está resultando muy rentable. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y todavía no sabe como es el trabajo en su banco comunal, pero ya ha notado que son personas unidas y muy comunicativas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un garaje seguro, ya que sus motocarros, en la actualidad, se guardan en un espacio fuera de su casa, a la intemperie corriendo el riesgo de robo.
texts.en:
Dina is 41 years old and lives with her husband who is a policeman. Both are parents of an 8-year-old daughter who is in primary school. They own the house where they live. She is the owner of five three-wheeled light vans with private drivers she hires to transport passengers (taxi). She has had these vehicles for 4 years and they run from Monday thru Saturday from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. Dina is in charge of administering the profits from her vehicles, verifying their condition and taking them for maintenance work or repairs if they have any problems. Dina is very happy because this business has been very profitable up to now. It is the first time she has had a loan with MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma). She doesn’t know how the community bank works yet, but she has already noticed that the people are united and very communicative. She will have a safe garage built with the money she applied for since she currently keeps her vehicles in a space outside her home, unprotected and running the risk of theft.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a garage for her vehicles

loans.name: Kankelen Group

texts.fr:
