Le groupe Kankelen est composé de quatre femmes, toutes mariées  vivant équitablement dans des familles monogamiques et polygamiques. Elles  sont âgées en moyenne de 38 ans avec  2 enfants et habitent  toutes dans le quartier Bamanankin du village de Togo (4ème région administrative du Mali).
 Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage et font la vente de sounbala et de pâte d’arachide. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux premiers prêts.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  3 tonnes d’arachide en gousse au grand marché de Ségou. Ces gousses sont décortiquées ,  les graines obtenues sont triées, grillées, débarrassées de toutes les impuretés, elles sont ainsi  transformées en pâte d’arachide qu’on peut utiliser comme telle en confiture dans du pain, dans les bouillies des enfants et plus fréquemment  celles des malades dénutris ou dans certains plats locaux à base de feuilles vertes ou encore dans les sauces locales ‘’Tigadèguè nan’’ laquelle est  très prisée dans nos milieux et surtout dans les zones de Malinkés et Dogons. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes à domicile, en ambulant au village et au grand marché de Ségou (légumes kôrô).
Elles  espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 24000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans le remboursement du prêt, la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes, funérailles et circoncisions) et la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (savon, pétrole et habillements).
Elles ont pour ambitions l’achat de matériels agricoles : charrues et bœufs de labour afin d’obtenir  une très bonne production car c’est lorsque l’autosuffisance alimentaire est assurée qu’on peut entreprendre beaucoup d’autres activités.
texts.en:
The group Kankelen is composed of four women, all married, living equitably in monogamous and polygamous families. The women average 38 years of age and two children each. They all live in the Bamanankin district of the village of Togo (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of married and community, and they sell sounbala (a condiment made of fermented seeds) and peanut butter.

The group members are on their third solidarity loan, after having correctly repaid the first two loans. They plan to use the loan to buy three tonnes of peanut pods at the grand marketplace of Ségou. The pods are shelled, and the peanuts are obtained, sorted, roasted, rid of impurities, and are thus processed into peanut butter. It is used as such on bread, in porridges for children and more often for undernourished patients, in certain local dishes made from green leaves, or yet in local sauces, such as "Tigadèguè nan", which is very popular in our area and especially in Malinké and Dogon areas. Sales are made to customers composed mostly of women, cash or credit accepted, in homes, door-to-door in town, and at the grand marketplace of Ségou (kôrô vegetables).

The group members each hope to realize an average monthly profit of 24,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan, to participate in societal events (marriages, baptisms, funerals, and circumcisions), and to cover certain family expenses (soap, kerosene, and clothing). Their ambition is to buy agricultural items: plows and oxen in order to obtain a very good yield because when your self-sufficiency in food is ensured, you can take on a lot of other work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola J. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She hopes to have more children in the future. Bola sells sarongs; her customers are mainly married women and young girls. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Elenise

texts.es: Elenise es madre soltera, tiene 40 años de edad y vive con sus cuatro hijos que ya trabajan y la apoyan en lo posible, la casa que habitan es propia. Se dedica a vender productos de belleza como; perfumes, desodorantes, talcos, shampoo. etc. Elenise es una mujer muy peculiar, ya que también fabrica carbón, el mismo que vende a los restaurantes de su zona; además es propietaria de un motocarro que manejan sus hijos haciendo taxi. Estas labores, las viene ejerciendo desde hace 2 años y le va muy bien, ya que gracias a estos negocios está saliendo adelante. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas, lugares, intercambia ideas y hace muchos amigos. Más adelante, Elenise quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. Ya tiene 2 préstamos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos los integrantes son cumplidos y puntuales, no tiene queja alguna. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá equitativamente en sus tres negocios, incrementará la cantidad de productos de belleza que vende, aumentará su producción de carbón y hará mantenimiento a su motocarro.
texts.en:
Elenise is a single mother; she’s 40 years old and lives with her four children who already work and support her as much as possible, living in a house that they own. She sells beauty products such as perfume, deodorant, talc powders, shampoos, etc. Elenise is an unusual woman, in that she also provides coal, which she sells to restaurants in her neighborhood. In addition, she owns a motorcar for which her children are taxi drivers. She’s been running these jobs for two years now, and it’s going very well, and thanks to these businesses, she is moving forward. One thing she likes about her work is that she gets to know a lot of people and places, and she likes exchanging ideas and making many friends. She’s had two loans with MFP, and she likes working with her community bank because all the members are courteous and punctual; she has no complaints. She’s requesting money to invest equally in her three businesses. She will increase the quantity of beauty products she sells, augment her coal production and make repairs on her car.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her three businesses

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina E. is 32 years old and married with three children. Her husband is employed as a driver. Sabina has received an education through junior high school. She operates a chop bar (eatery) in Yamoransa, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 1989.  She will use her loan to expand her chop bar and improve the quality of the food she prepares. She currently uses her income to help pay for school fees for her children. With new profits from increased business, she plans to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Expand her chop bar and improve the quality of food she prepares

loans.name: Djiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djiguisèmè sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygames avec en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier bozokin de Kirango Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et dans l’association traditionnelle des femmes de Kirango.
Après trois prêts correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé  pour acheter, 200kg de poisson qui serait séché avant la revente, 17 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 15sacs de 50 morceaux de savon, des ingrédients pour la fabrication des boissons locales  (80kg de gingembre, 90kg d’oseille de Guinée, 8sacs de sucre et des essences). Elles s’approvisionnent, en bois de chauffe à Djibougou, en poissons au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec les pêcheurs et quant aux autres produits à la foire de Diamarabougou. Le poisson est revendu dans la cité administrative de Kirango, à Ségou, à Dougabougou et à Diabali  et les autres produits en détail à travers les quartiers de Markala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
 Elles  espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 46.000FCFA par mois, qui sera essentiellement utilisé pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Djiguisèmè are women who are married for the most part in large polygamous families, and they average 49 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in the Bozokin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and in the traditional women’s association of Kirango.

After correctly repaying three loans, the group members are on their fourth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy 200 kg of fish (to be dried and then sold), seventeen cart-loads of firewood, fifteen 50-count sacks of soap, and some ingredients for making local beverages (80 kg of ginger, 90 kg of dried hibiscus flowers, 8 sacks of sugar, and some flavorings). Supplies of firewood are gotten in Djibougou. The fish is gotten from fishermen on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango. As for the other goods, these are gotten at the Diamarabougou fair. The fish is resold in the administrative section of Kirango, in Ségou, in Dougabougou, and in Diabali. The other goods are sold retail across the districts of Markala to customers composed primarily of women.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 46,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to augment the working capital. Their ambition is to buy a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nneoma

texts.en: Nneoma E. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and drinks for a living.  She is hoping for a loan of N50000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela C. is 30 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions like noodles, tooth paste, etc. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more stock to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe Sindiya ont en moyenne 47 ans et   5 enfants. Le groupe est composé de 4 veuves et de 4 femmes mariées polygames. Toutes ces femmes vivent dans le quartier bamanan kin de Kirango Markala (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce  de poisson sous toutes ses formes (frais, fumé et séché) et se sont connues à travers cette activité au marché et des liens de mariage car leurs maris viennent d’une même famille.
Pour promouvoir leur petit commerce ces femmes de la même grande famille se sont organisées pour intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire,  après avoir bien remboursés les prêts précédents.
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 600 kg de poisson dont une partie sera séchée avant la revente, une tonne d’oignon dont une partie serait conservée pour la période hivernale (moment de hausse du prix) et 10 sacs de facoye (plante sauvage utilisée dans les sauces surtout au nord du Mali). Elles se ravitaillent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango et en condiments à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou. Les poissons sont revendus à Ségou, Boussin, Cinzana gare et Konobougou ; les condiments sont revendus en détail au marché de Kirango à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisée essentiellement dans l’entretien des enfants et  l’épargne. 
Elles ont pour ambition  d’acheter des bœufs et des matériels agricoles  pour faire la riziculture.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group Sindiya average 47 years of age and 5 children each. The group is composed of four widows and four married polygamous women. All these women live in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The women do commerce in fish in all its forms (fresh, smoked, and dried), and they known one another through this work at the marketplace and through ties of marriage, since their husbands come from the same family.

To promote their small business, these women of the same large family have organized themselves to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan following the repayment of the preceding ones.

This loan will serve to buy: 600 kg of fish (a portion will be dried and then sold), a tonne of onions (a portion would be retained for over-wintering when prices go up), and ten sacks of facoye (a wild plant used in sauces especially in northern Mali). The supplies of fish are gotten on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango, and the condiments are gotten at the weekly fair of Diamarabougou. The fish are resold in Ségou, Boussin, Cinzana Station, and Konobougou. The condiments are sold retail at the Kirango marketplace to customers composed primarily of women.

The group members each intend to realize an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used essentially in caring for the children and in building up savings. Their ambition is to buy oxen and agricultural supplies to grow rice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary C. is 28 years old and married with four children. She hires VCD's to her customers to make a living. She is hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more VCD's to hire to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To Purchase more  VCD's

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: La señora Elida tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar con madera y tienen una hija. Tiene en su casa su pequeña bodega en donde vende productos de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.), y bebidas. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de un año y atiende todos los días a cualquier hora D. día. Lo que le gusta de su bodeguita es que mediante la mismo se relaciona con muchas personas y darles una buena atención es primordial, menciona Elida. La rentabilidad de su negocio se muestra en que Elida es la única persona que tiene una bodega en la zona donde vive, por lo que no tiene competencia. Para más adelante quiere constituir un minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos la obtención de sus necesidades diarias. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y en el poco tiempo que tiene con su banco comunal ha notado que existe mucha unión. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá comprando productos de primera necesidad para implementar su negocio adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Elida is 58 years old; she lives with her husband who works with wood; they have one daughter. She has a small grocery store where she sells basic necessities (eggs, beans, rice, milk and bread, etc.), and drinks. She’s already been doing these activities for one year; she’s open for business everyday, all the time. What she likes about her work as a grocer is that she gets to interact with lots of people. Giving them good service is essential, Elida mentions. The profitability of her business illustrates that Elida is the only person in the neighborhood that has a grocery store, a competency that she didn’t have before. In the future, she wants to build a minimarket, thus enabling her neighbors to have their daily needs met. This is her first time requesting a loan with MFP, and in the short time that she’s interacted with the community bank she’s noticed tremendous unity. The desired loan will be invested in buying basic necessities to effectively operate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, los mismos que son solteros y trabajan; también vive con su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar como albañil. La casa donde viven es propia. Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas en la parte de afuera de su casa, ya que se encuentra ubicada frente a un parque donde existe mucha concurrencia de personas que degustan de sus delicioso juanes (plato típico de la región selva peruana). A Elizabeth le gusta su trabajo porque le mantienen ocupada y se siente útil ante la sociedad, además le es rentable porque su comida y bebidas se venden diariamente y sin esfuerzo. Para más adelante quiere mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para vender tranquilamente. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que sus compañeros son personas responsables y puntuales. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de los ingredientes para los juanes y más bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 54 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, who are single and work. She also lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer. The house where they live is their own. For 3 years she has been dedicated to the sale of food and beverages in the area of outside of her house, since it is located next to a park where a lot of people gather who enjoy the taste of her delicious juanes (a typical dish of the Peruvian forest region). Elizabeth likes her work because it keeps her busy and she feels a useful part of society. It is also profitable because her food and beverages are sold every day without effort. In the future she wants to have a stand built where she can sell peacefully. This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her communal bank because she has noted that their members are punctual and responsible people. She will invest the money that she requests in the purchase of the ingredients for the juanes and for more carbonated beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated water and ingredients to make the food she sells

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma V. R. tiene 46 años vive en Licapa, distrito de Paijan, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro. de primaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que no le gustaba ir al colegio. Tiene 01 hijo que ya no depende económicamente de ella.
Norma se dedica a la venta de ladrillo, iniciò su negocio vendiendo fruta durante 10 años, luego se dedicò a la venta de ropa, que abandonò debido a que era muy cansado para ella.  Con el capital que tenia decidió empezar la venta de ladrillo en sociedad,  pero al tiempo tuvo que cambiar de domicilio y empezar sola el negocio que le es muy rentable, con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado comprarse 2 carros que utiliza para repartir el ladrillo. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el sector llamado chuin bajo.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de carbón.
Con el crédito de 3000 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de carbón, briqueta y leña para el horno de ladrillo.
Norma tiene el gran sueño de  tener un horno de ladrillos maquinados.

loans.use: compra de carbón, briqueta y leña

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Chávez García tiene 40 años, es presidenta de su Banco Comunal, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Gladys se dedica a la venta de menú (comida), iniciò su negocio hace 5 años, primero vendiendo marcianos y luego en un comedor donde ella cocinaba para las socias y gente particular, con el tiempo decidió poner su negocio en su casa donde ahora vende su menú y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias obtenidas a logrado comprar los utensilios y ollas para su negocio el mismo que desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de marcianos. 
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de primera necesidad para la venta de menú (insumos).
Nancy sueña con tener una bodega y un restaurante en Virú.
Ella pertenece al club de madres de su sector.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy Chávez García is 40 years old. She is a president of her Communal Bank. She lives in Human Settlement Aurora Díaz, district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through the 3rd year of secondary school, then abandoned her studies because her parents did not have the economic means to continue supporting her. She has 2 children that depend on her economically. Gladys is dedicated to her restaurant (food) business. She started her first business 5 years ago selling frozen popsicles and then worked in a dining room where she cooked for the members and for private parties. In time she decided to put her business in her house where she now sells her dishes and has many clients. With the profits she obtained she has managed to buy the utensils and pots for her business that she runs in her residence. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her Communal Bank, called "The Auroras in Action II", she invested in the purchase of supplies for the preparation of popsicles. With the loan of 500 soles, that will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest n the purchase of basic supplies for the sale of her dishes. Nancy dreams of one day having a grocery and a restaurant in Virú. She belongs to the mothers club of her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making foods for sale

loans.name: Jessica Jacquelin

texts.es:
La señora Jessica Jacquelin P. C. tiene 32 años, es secretaria de su Banco Comunal, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 4to de secundaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que se casò y se dedicò a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Jessica tiene una bodega, cuando empezó su negocio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, luego se dedicò a ayudar a su madre en la bodega que ella tenìa hasta que decidió asociarse con ella.  Al principio tenían una pequeña bodega que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, con las ganancias obtenidas ha comprado 02 vitrinas para sus productos. El negocio le es muy rentable y lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la elaboración de alimentos para surtir su bodega.
Jessica sueña con viajar a conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Ms. Jessica Jacquelin P. C. is 32 years old and lives in the Humano Aurora Díaz settlement in the Salaverry district of the Trujillo Province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is her microfinance institute’s secretary.

She studied up to her 4th year of secondary school, but had to leave her studies because she got married and focused on her household. She has 2 children who depend solely on her. Jessica has a general store. She started out by selling beauty products, but then, while helping her mother with her general store, she decided to become her business partner. Initially, they had a small general store, but it has been growing little by little. They were able to purchase two display cases with their profits. Her business, which she runs from her own home, is very lucrative.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her microfinance institute called “Las Auroras en Acción II,” she purchased calling cards. With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase ingredients so that she can make meals and sell them in her general store.

Jessica dreams of traveling to Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make meals

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de su hija de 15 años, que estudia el nivel secundario, la casa que habitan es propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros (taxi) desde hace 2 años. Para poder obtener mayores ganancias en menos tiempo, sale en la moto en las llamadas “horas punta”; de 6 a 10 de la mañana, y de 4 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche. Lo que le gusta a Felicia de su negocio, es que las ganancias son diarias y sostienen los gastos diarios familiares. Pero debido a que en su ciudad, el principal medio de transporte son las motos, hay gran demanda, pero también mucha competencia, por lo que día a día tienen que luchar por hacer la mayor cantidad de servicios. Con MFP ya tiene 2 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son solidarios, y cuando hay un problema todos colaboran para solucionarlo. El dinero que solicita es para comprar un motor nuevo para su motocarro.
texts.en:
Felicia is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and the father of her 15 year old who is studying in high school. The house that they live in is their own. She is the owner of a motorcycle which is driven by her husband, who has been transporting passengers for two years. To be able to make more money in less time, he will use the motorcycle in rush hours from 6:00 to 10:00 in the morning and from 4:00 in the afternoon to 8:00 at night. What Felicia likes the most about her job is that the earnings are daily and sustain daily expenses. Because the main mode of transportation in her city is motorcycles, there is a great demand, but there is also a great deal of competition. Because of this, they have to fight day to day to have the greatest amount of service. She already has two loans with MFP, and she likes to work with her comunity bank because her colleagues are in solidarity and when there is a problem, they all work together to fix it. The money that she requests is to buy a new motor for her motorcycles.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor for her motorcycle

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
For four years, Hagar A. has sold secondhand clothing and also prepares kenkey (a cooked, fermented white maize food) for sale at Siwdo. She is married with one child and received an education through junior high school. Hagar’s husband also works as a trader.

Hagar is responsible for helping to pay for various household expenses such as food for the family. Her loan will be used to add more capital to her business of selling used clothing and also to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of the kenkey. She plans to reinvest her profits to further increase her success.

loans.use: To invest in used clothing business and to buy carn and plantain leaves for the preparation of kenkey

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria P. P. tiene 47 años, es fiscal de su Banco Comunal, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que se casò y se dedicò a su hogar. Tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 02 aun dependen económicamente de ella.
Ana se dedica a la venta de menú (comida) y de petróleo, iniciò su negocio hace 20 años en el puesto que era de su madre, al principio vendía poco pero con el tiempo se hizo de clientes. También se dedica a la venta de petróleo hace 15 años, su negocio es muy rentable con las ganancias que obtuvo a comprado utensilios para su menú y cilindros para el petróleo.  Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para la venta de menú.
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de petróleo para ampliar su capital de trabajo.
Ana tiene el gran sueño de comprar un terreno donde pueda poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Maria P. P. is 47 years old. She is her microfinance institute’s fiscal officer and lives in the Humano Aurora Díaz settlement of the Salaverry district, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied up to her 3rd year of secondary school, but had to abandon her studies because she got married and focused on her household. She has 5 children, 2 of whom still depend on her financially.

Ana sells meals and fuel for a living. She started her business 20 years ago, using her mother’s stand. At first, she did not sell much, but as time went by, she expanded her clientele. She has been selling fuel for 15 years now, and her business is very lucrative. With her profits, she was able to purchase utensils for her food business and drums for fuel. She runs her business out of her own house.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan from the “Las Auroras en Acción II” Microfinance Institute in purchasing the ingredients necessary to prepare her meals.

With this 1,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase fuel so that she can increase her business capital.

Ana dreams of purchasing a plot of land on which she can build a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel

loans.name: Alicia Petronila

texts.es:
La señora Alicia  Petronila H. D. Calderón tiene 51 años, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 5to D. primaria, abandono los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola y se dedicó a trabajar, tiene 08 hijos y ninguno depenD. D. ella económicamente.
Alicia se dedica a la venta D. menú y cerveza, iniciò su negocio hace 8 años con la venta D. menú (comida) al principio no tenia muchas ventas pero se hizo D. clientes al poco tiempo.  Hace 1 año inicio la venta D. cerveza que le ha sido muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Ella es socia nueva del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, con el crédito D. 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. cerveza.
Alicia tiene el sueño D. construir su casa.
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia Petronila H. D. Calderón, 51, lives in Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province , La Libertad department, Perú. She finished the 5th graD., but she left school and went to work because her parents did not have the economic means to keep supporting her. She has 8 children who are economically independent of her. Alicia sells menu item type food and beer. She started her business 8 years ago selling food. At first she did not have many sales, but in a short amount of time she got customers. A year ago she started selling beer, and that has been very profitable for her. She runs her business in her own home. She is a member of “Las Auroras en Acción II” community bank. With a loan of 300 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy beer. Alicia dreams of building her house. She belongs to the mothers’ club in her sector.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi is a fishmonger who sells fresh fish and also smokes some of the fish she buys to sell in Bosomtwe. She has had this business since 2005. Asi M. is married with six dependents. She received an education through primary school. While Asi trades fish, her husband is employed as a mason.

Asi uses her income to pay for various household expenses such as buying food for the family. She will use this loan to purchase additional fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Asi plans to further increase her capital by reinvesting in her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for resale as both fresh and smoked fish

loans.name: Fatima De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Fátima
texts.en: Mrs. Fátima

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies to improve and diversify her crops

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos en edad escolar. Implementó su negocio en su propia casa, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, ella es Técnica en Enfermería de profesión, y también brinda el servicio de aplicar inyecciones, pero solo bajo receta médica. En esta actividad tiene un periodo de 2 años, y atiende durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus pacientes, los mismos se sienten bien y la recomiendan. Más adelante, Luz quiere ambientar un consultorio con todo lo necesario, así como un espacio para la venta de medicinas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con este, ya son 5 préstamos que trabaja con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes se ayudan entre sí y son organizados. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más medicamentos para ir implementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old. She lives with her partner and father of her 4 children, who are all in schooling age. She implemented her business selling medications at her own home. Her profession is Nurse Technician so she can also apply injections under medical prescription. She has been doing this type of activity for two years. She receives patients all day long. What Luz likes about her job is that she can give her patients a good attention, which makes them feel well and recommend her. Luz wants to eventually have her own clinic with all the equipment necessary and have a different space to sell medication and give her patients a better reception. This loan would be her 5th with MFP. She likes working with her communal bank because the members help each other out and are organized. Luz will use this loan to purchase medications to keep on building her business.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua N. has been a chop bar operator in Bosomtwe since 2004. She also sells groceries. She is divorced with four children and received an education through junior high school. Akua is responsible for paying for her family’s basic expenses such as utility bills, food and school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her profits by purchasing more food supplies and increasing her stock of groceries for sale. She hopes to use her expanded capital to reinvest back into the business so to further her success.

loans.use: For purchase of food supplies for a chop bar and to increase stock of groceries

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. tiene la edad  de 38 años, habita en la Francia número uno, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus  hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios , doña Rosa desde hace dos años trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que atacan al cultivo , ya que estos carecen de insumos por falta de financiamiento , ella inicio la actividad agrícola con ayuda de sus amigos que le regalaron los hijos de piña y sus propios esfuerzo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder expandir mas cultivo .El financiamiento obtenido lo va invertir en la comprar de fertilizantes  e insumos para que la producción de piña sea de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa M. is 38 years old. She lives in France number one, next to her husband, who works to help her with the home expenses. Their plans with respect to their family is to improve their children's living conditions and support them in their schooling. Mrs. Rosa has been working in agriculture for two years. Her biggest difficulty is dealing with plagues that attack her crops because she doesn't have the necessary inputs due to lack of financing. She started her farming activities with the help of her friends, who gave her pineapple seeds as a gift and also due to her own efforts. Her future plans include expanding her crops. Rosa will use this loan to invest it into purchasing fertilizers and inputs to improve her pineapple crops' quality.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and inputs for her pineapple crops

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos que son su razón de ser. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño ambiente frente a su casa. Adicionalmente, el negocio que mejores ingresos le genera es la exportación de pescado de agua dulce a otras ciudades, ya que los peces del río que está en su ciudad son muy demandados por su delicioso sabor. La idea de Rayda es seguir trabajando arduamente para poder construir o alquilar un local más apropiado para su bodega. Con MFP ya tiene 4 créditos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos y coordinados. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en un costo de 200 soles, con lo restante, adquirirá pescado para llevarlo a vender a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Rayda is 35 years old. She is a single mother. She has three children who are her reason for being. For three years she has been selling groceries and essential goods in a small area in front of her house. Additionally, the business that provides her with the most income is the exportation of freshwater fish to other cities because the fish from the river in her city are in great demand due to their delicious taste. Rayda's idea is to continue working arduously to be able to construct or rent a more appropriate location for her store. She has had four loans from MFP, and she likes to work with her community bank because all of her colleagues are fulfilled and coordinated. With the money she solicits, she will buy more groceries and essential goods at a cost of approximately $64.00 (200 PEN). With the rest, she will acquire fish to bring to sell in other places.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is married and has 6 dependant children. For 4 years she has worked as a trader, cooking rice and stew that she sells at Siwdo. Her husband is employed as a soldier. Abena uses her income to help pay the family’s bills.

Abena will use this loan to purchase rice in larger bags, along with other ingredients, which she will cook and sell to her customers, who don't eat before leaving their homes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase rice in larger bags, and other ingredients

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married with 3 children. She has received an education through junior high school. While Agnes works as a trader, her husband is employed as an auto mechanic.

For 6 years, Agnes has sold minerals such as Coca Cola and Malt in Siwdo. She uses her income to help pay for the family’s expenses. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional drinks for resale. Agnes plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business in order to promote her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional drinks for resale

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
La señora Julia Marina A. D. González tiene 50 años vive en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito D. Rázuri, provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no continuo estudiando debido a que se caso y se dedico a trabajar. Tiene 03 hijos D. los cuales ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Julia se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza y ropa, cuando inicio se dedicaba a la venta D. joyas, luego a la venta D. ropa interior, con el tiempo dejo las joyas y empezó ampliar su negocio D. ropa con la venta D. jeans, polos y camisas, así como la venta D. productos D. belleza. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido comprar una vitrina para su negocio y un mototaxi que alquila. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. joyas.
Con el crédito D. 2000 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. repuestos para su mototaxi.
Julia tiene el sueño D. tener una tienda granD. D. ropa y productos D. belleza.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia Marina A. D. González is 50 years old and lives in Puerto Malabrigo, in the Rázuri district of the Ascope province, department of D. La Libertad, Perú.

She finished her secondary education, but was unable to continue with her studies because she got married and started to work. She has 3 children, none of whom depends on her financially.

Julia sells beauty products and clothing for a living. When she started out, she used to sell jewelry, then undergarments. As time passed, she stopped selling jewelry and started to expand her clothing business by selling jeans, shirts, and T-shirts, as well as beauty products. With the profits earned, she has been able to purchase both a display cabinet for her business and a motorcycle taxi, which she rents out. She runs her business in her own home.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her microfinance institute called “Manos Unidas” (United Hands), she purchased jewelry.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase spare parts for her motorcycle taxi.

Julia dreams of owning a bigger clothing and beauty product store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Benny Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Benny Margarita A. P. tiene 28 años, es tesorera de su Banco Comunal, vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió la carrera de técnica de contabilidad, carrera que abandonò debido a que salió embarazada y se dedicò a su hogar. Tiene 01 pequeño hijo que depende enteramente de ella.
Benny tiene una pequeña bodega, cuando empezó vendía marcianos, luego se dedicò a la venta de mazamorra y cachangas (postres de la regiòn). Con el tiempo empezó la venta de golosinas que poco a poco fue ampliando con la venta de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y ahora tiene una bodega màs surtida.  Con las ganancias que obtuvo ha iniciado la venta de desayunos escolares, el mismo que le es muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de una licuadora para preparar sus marcianos (helados de hielo).
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos y compra de útiles escolares para la campaña escolar.
Benny tiene el gran sueño de comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benny Margarita A. P., 28, is the treasurer of her community bank. She lives in Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She studied bookkeeping, but she left the career when she was pregnant, and she became a homemaker. Benny has a small store. She started out selling popsicles, and later started selling “mazamorra” and “pachangas” (regional desserts). In time she started selling sweets, and little by little she expanded her sales by adding ingredients for food preparation. Now she has a better stocked store. With the earnings that she had, she started selling school breakfasts, which is very profitable for her. She runs her business in her home. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Las Auroras en Acción II”, she bought a blender to make her popsicles. With a loan of 1200 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy ingredients for food preparation and school supplies for the start of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food preparation and school supplies

loans.name: Carol Davis

texts.es:
La señora Carol Davis tiene 35 años vive en Saucipe, distrito D. Paijan, provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no siguió estudiando debido a que se casò y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente D. ella.
Carol se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, al inicio se dedicaba a la crianza y venta D. patos (aves) junto con su esposo, negocio que tuvo durante 5 años y que dejò para iniciarse en la venta D.  ropa, el cual también abandonò para dedicarse a la venta D. productos D. belleza desD. hace 1 año, negocio que desarrolla actualmente en su domicilio y que le da muchas ganancias. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado.
Con el crédito D. 1500 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. productos D. belleza para ampliar su capital D. trabajo.
Carol sueña con ser directora D. Unique.
texts.en:
Carol Davis is 35 years old and lives in Saucipe, in the district of Paijan, province of Ascope, in the department of La Libertad of Peru. She completed high school but did not continue her studies as she got married and then dedicated herself to her home. She has two children who are financially dependent on her. Carol sells beauty products. She started in business raising and selling ducks (birds) with her husband. She had that business for five years and stopped in order to begin selling clothing, which she also abandoned to sell beauty products, which she has been doing for a year now. She runs her business from her home and it generates good revenues. With her first loan of 300 soles which she received from her community bank, "Manos Unidas”, she bought a balanced feed for her animals. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy beauty products to increase her working capital. Carol dreams of becoming a director with Unique [Unique is a beauty products company].

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Elvia Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Elvia Domitila tiene 55 años D. edad, es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, vive en Licapa, distrito D. Paijan,  provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do D. secundaria, dejò D. estudiar debido a que su madre no la quiso apoyar. Tiene 06 hijos D. los cuales 01 depenD. económicamente e ella. 
Elvia se dedica a la venta D. ropa y a la siembra D. caña (àrbol D. donD. se extrae la azucar) y espárragos.  Al principio tenìa una bodega que cerrò cuando se cambio D. domicilio, entonces iniciò la venta D. ropa, productos naturales y productos D. belleza, negocio que abandonò cuando su hijo se enfermò, luego retomo la venta D. ropa, negocio que desarrolla desD. hace 14 años.  Con las ganancias obtenidas, iniciò hace 4 años, la siembra D. caña y espárrago, negocio que le es muy rentable y que desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra D. productos naturales.
Con el crédito D. 2500 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. urea y abono para sembrar caña y espárrago.
Elvia tiene el gran sueño D. poder comprar a sus hijos un terreno donD. puedan construir sus casas.
texts.en:
Elvia Domitila is 55 years old. She is the president of her communal bank; she lives in Licapa, Paijan District, Ascope Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She completed 8th graD. but had to leave school because her mother didn't want to support her. She has 6 children, one of whom still depends on her economically. Elvia sells clothing and grows sugar cane and asparagus. At first she had a grocery store but she had to close it when she moved. She then began selling clothing, natural products, and beauty supplies but she had to leave this business when her son became ill. She later began again to sell clothing and has been doing this for the past 14 years. With her profits she began four years ago to invest in the growing of sugar cane and asparagus, a business that is quite profitable and she undertakes from her own home. She used her original loan of 300 soles, which she got from "Manos Unidas" communal bank, to purchase natural products. With the new 2500 soles loan, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase urea and fertilizers for her sugar cane and asparagus crops. Elvia dreams with being able to purchase a plot of land where her children may be able to build their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase urea and fertilizer to grow sugar cane and asparagus.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Jorge Chávez S/Nº - Caserío El Porvenir, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella. Motivada por su espíritu emprendedor, con el  primer crédito de S/. 300.00, inicio su  propio negocio de Venta de comida y bebidas gasificadas (gaseosas), dando alimentación diaria a sus  pensionistas y clientes esporádicamente, donde ella siempre los atiende con su carisma y buen trato . En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio en un ambiente ubicado en su  misma casa, està contenta con lo que hace y tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, comprará  paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz y azúcar en kilos, verduras y  pollos vivos; parte del dinero lo utilizará también comprando mas mesas, sillas, y accesorios para brindar un mejor servicio. Se siente muy feliz, ya que sola supo salir adelante con sus hijos y gracias a Manuela Ramos que la apoyo bastante, cuenta con su negocio donde ella misma toma las decisiones de sus ingresos y egresos.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives in the El Porvenir settlement, Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She is single, 42 years old, and the mother of 4 children, one of whom still depends on her economically. Motivated by her enterprising spirit, with her initial loan of 300 soles, she began her own business preparing and selling meals and soft drinks daily providing food for her customers with her customary charisma and good service. Currently, she continues with this enterprise which she undertakes from her own home. She is happy with her work and has been working with the communal bank for two years. With this 2000 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she intends to purchase various brands of soft drinks in a variety of flavors and sizes as well as raw materials in bulk, such as rice, sugar, vegetables, live poultry, etc. for the preparation of her meals. A portion of the funds will be used to buy tables, chairs and accessories to offer still better service. She is very happy that she was able to raise her children alone and, thanks to Manuela Ramos who helped her quite a bit, she now has a business in which she herself manages all decisions regarding income and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for meal preparation.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora A. is married with 3 children. She has received an education through primary school.

Dora has been a trader in Bosomtwe since 2006, selling foodstuffs such as rice, tomatoes and groceries. Her husband is also employed as a trader in the same area. Dora uses her income to help pay her family’s expenses, like utility bills and food.

Dora will use this loan to purchase to purchase additional provisions and food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business Dora plans to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions and food supplies for resale

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la salida de Carhuapoma S/Nº - Caserío de El Porvenir, del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y no tiene hijos. Se iniciò con un capital S/. 1,000.00 motivada por el espíritu emprendedor tanto de ella como de su esposo.  Instalaron su negocio de fabricación y venta de ladrillos, ya que contaban con un terreno grande y con la materia prima como es la arcilla para la preparación de los ladrillos. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que por la calidad de sus productos trabaja con instituciones publicas y privadas  con pedidos de ladrillos en millares. También en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, las mismas que ofrece entre sus amigos y vecinos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, una parte lo invertirá en la compra de combustible en galones, leña en tercios para asado de los  ladrillos  y con la otra parte  comprará  ropa como pantalones, blusas, polos para damas, caballeros y niños, en diferentes tamaños y modelos. Ambos, su esposo y ella toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea establecer  su negocio con una tienda de ropa. 
Martina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martina belongs to the Community Bank “Virgen del Rosario” and lives at the Carhuapoma S/Nº exit – El Porvenir hamlet, Bellavista District, San Martin District. She is married, 35 years old and does not have any children. She began with 1,000 Peruvian soles, spurred on as much by her own entrepreneurial spirit as by that of her husband. They set up their business making and selling bricks, and they have a large plot with the raw material clay for making the bricks. Now they are carrying on the business that, because of the quality of their products, is working with public and private institutions with orders for thousands of bricks. Also, in their spare time they sell clothes to their friends and neighbours.

With this loan of 3,000 soles, which will be repaid within 6 months, one part will be used to buy liquid fuel and firewood for baking the bricks. The other part will be used to buy clothes such as trousers, blouses, women’s, men’s and children’s polo shirts in different sizes and styles. Both she and her husband make the decisions regarding the income from their business. They would also like to set up a clothes shop business. Martina is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fuel and firewood

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: La señora Flor Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Av. Fernando B. Terry S/Nº - Caserío El Porvenir, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella. Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su propio negocio de Venta de Productos de Belleza, empezó vendiendo productos a pedido por catálogo de la línea EsiKa, CyZone y Avon, poco a poco fue haciéndose de su propio stock. Hoy continúa con su negocio ubicado en su misma casa, donde sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que canceL. a un  plazo de 06 meses, incrementará su negocio, ya que tiene un carácter alegre y un carisma para con sus clientes, el dinero lo invertirá comprando más productos para su stock como perfumes, colonias, lociones y desodorantes para damas y caballeros; polvos, cremas y maquillajes para rostro. De Manuela Ramos nos comenta "...que es una bonita organización, que ayuda a las mujeres que no tienen una salida económica, a desarrollarse y progresar con la misma oportunidad que el varón. Es una mujer emprendedora y capaz de realizar y cumplir sus sueños".
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Maria, belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank. She lives on the Av. Fernando B. Terry S/Nº - Caserío El Porvenir, Bellavista district, San Martín department. She is 28, married, and has 1 dependent child. With her first loan of 300 PEN she started her own business selling beauty products. She started selling products through catalog orders for the EsiKa, CyZone, and Avon lines. Little by little she was acquiring her own stock. Now she continues with the business, which is located in her own home. Her main customers are neighbors and friends. She has been working with her community bank for 2 years, and it is going well for her. She has regular customers who place monthly orders. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will repay in 6 months, she will expand her business. She is happy by nature, and she has the charisma to work with customers. The loan will be used to stock up on more products like perfumes, colognes, lotions, women’s and men’s deodorants, powders, creams, and make up. She says that Manuela Ramos, “… is a beautiful organization that helps women who do not have economic options develop and progress with the same opportunity as a man.” She is an enterprising woman who is capable of making her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Félix G. S. de 51 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla, vive junto a su madre de 80 años de edad y un hermano de 25 años de edad. Félix posee una tienda en la cuál vende una variedad de productos de primera necesidad como alimentos enlatados, productos de uso personal, golosinas entre otras cosas más. Félix solícita un préstamo con el fin de poder introducir más productos a su negocio, de esta manera él espera obtener mayores ganancias, a través de las cuales pueda solventar todas sus necesidades y las de su madre. Félix es un señor que por su edad y preparación le es muy difícil encontrar un trabajo estable, es por ello que el trabaja muy duro por mantener las ventas de su negocio, y es así como a través del préstamo él espera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Félix G. S. is 51 years old, resides in the municipality of Santa Tecla, and lives with his mother who is 80 years old and a brother who is 25 years old. Félix runs a store where he sells a variety of staples such as canned foods, personal care products and candies among other things. Félix solicits a loan for the purpose of introducing more products to his business, through this he hopes to improve his profits so that he can fund his own necessities and those of his mother. Félix is a man who has a hard time finding stable employment due to his age and background, it is for this reason that he works very hard to maintain the sales of his business and he hopes to better his sales with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of more products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: A. est une femme mariée qui  a  02 enfants. Elle habite avec sa famille le quartier  d’agoè démakpoè . Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2007.pour pouvoir gagner plus de bénefice sur son commerce, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Sokodé où le sac de charbons de bois est moins coûteux.Voulant actuellement rehausser son stock de charbons de bois elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 32 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
A. is a woman who is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Aagoè Démakpoè district and generates revenues through commerce in charcoal. She started this business in 2007. To be able to earn more from her business, she gets her supplies from the country's interior in the city of Sokodé, where sacks of charcoal are less expensive. Now wanting to replenish her stock, she's requesting her first WAGES loan to buy 32 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: La señora Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi cdra. 05, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella. Dada su ganas de progresar y de sacar a su familia adelante, con su  primer crédito de S/. 300.00 iniciò su  propio negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas,  para lo cual compró a plazos una congeladora para mantener heladas sus productos muy solicitados por el intenso calor reinante en la zona. Este negocio le permite tener ganancias por lo que continùa con su actividad, teniendo siempre como meta vender estos mismos productos pero al por mayor. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos como gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, agua mineral con gas y sin gas también en diferentes marcas y tamaños  y así satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Pilar, manifiesta un agradecimiento enorme a Manuela Ramos por permitirle salir adelante con lo que ella se propone y seguir creciendo como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Pilar belongs to the "La Libertad" communal bank. She lives in the Bellavista District of San Martin Department. She has a life partner, is 29 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are still dependent on her. Given her desire to progress and bring her family forward, she used her initial 300 sol loan to start a business selling soft drinks for which she bought, on installments, a cooler to keep her drinks cold something very necessary given the hot weather that is usual in her area. This business produces profits that allow her to continue her activity her goal being always to continue selling these products but now at wholesale. With this 1500 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of more product such as soft drinks of various brands, flavors and sizes as well as sparkling and still mineral water of various brands and sizes thereby satisfying her customers's demanding tastes. Pilar expresses her enormous gratitude towards Manuela Ramos for allowing her to go forward with what she proposes and to continue to grow as a woman and and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in a variety of flavors and sizes.

loans.name: Pura

texts.es: La señora Pura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en Jr. Apolonia Nº 474 - Caserío de El Porvenir, del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.Se inicio con un capital de S/. 500.00 junto a su esposo emprendieron su negocio de fabricación y venta de ladrillos quemados.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que ofrece a las instituciones publicas y privadas que son sus principales Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando leña en tercios en cantidades y galones de petróleo para quemar los ladrillos igualmente  moldes de acero para la fabricación en serie del producto. Se siente orgullosa de aportar económicamente al ingreso familiar y verse realizada como mujer y como empresaria. Pura, esta feliz por el gran apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, gracias a la ONG salio adelante y en su negocio le esta yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Pura belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives in the El Porvenir settlement, Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She has a life partner, is 35 years old, and has two children, both of whom are still dependent on her. She and her husband began with an initial loan of 500 soles which they used to begin a business consisting in the manufacture and sale of bricks. She currently is involved in the same activity and offers her product to public and private institutions which are her main customers. She has been working with the bank for 4 years. This 3000 sol loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, will be used to buy wood and oil used in the firing of the bricks as well as steel molds used to mass produce the bricks. She feels proud to be able to contribute to the economic well-being of her family and to see herself develop as a woman and as a businesswoman. Pura is happy for the great help that Manuela Ramos gives her since it is thanks to the NGO that she has been able to get ahead in her business and is doing very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and gallons of oil.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is married with two children and received an education through junior high school. Peter works as a trader in Siwdo, selling items such as milk, Milo, sugar and soap. He has been trading since 2006, along with his wife who also works as a trader. Peter uses his income to help support his family and pay for their expenses.

Peter will use the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell and with the new profits from his expanded business, Peter plans to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for his store

loans.name: Yolly

texts.es:
La señora Yolly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Av. Bellavista Carretera Marginal – Caserío El Porvenir, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. 
Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos dependen D. ella. Por iniciativa propia emprendió su negocio D. Confección D. Vestidos con un capital S/. 1,000.00 comprando inicialmente una máquina D. coser.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, sus confecciones los ofrece a sus clientes y amigos conocidos, asimismo trabaja con pedidos a medida, nos cuenta que le va muy bien y genera ingresos a diario. Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, lo comprará telas D. algodón y licra en metros,  colores y diseños diversos,  hilos en diferentes colores, blondas, elásticos y adornos diversos, insumos necesarios  para confeccionar ropas interiores y D. dormir en varias tallas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, en lo personal desea implementar su negocio con un taller más granD. y establecido. Yolly manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos y al Banco Comunal por hacer cada día D. ella una mujer con muchas expectativas.
texts.en:
Yolly belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives in the El Porvenir settlement, Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She is married, 34 years old, and the mother of 3 children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Her initial 1000 sol investment was used to purchase a sewing machine with which she makes clothing. Currently, she is engaged in the same activity offering her confections to clients and friends alike. She also makes custom maD. clothes and she relates that she is doing well and making profits daily. With this 3000 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she intends to purchase bolts of cotton fabric and lycra in various colors and designs as well as various threads, elastics, facings and decorations; raw materials necessary for the manufacture of underwear and sleeping wear in various sizes and styles for men, women and children. She makes her own decisions in her business and her plans are to enlarge and improve her workshop. Yolly is grateful to Manuela Ramos and the communal bank for daily reinforcing her as a woman with great expectations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabric and thread.

loans.name: Melvith

texts.es: La señora Melvith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. San Martín S/Nº - Caserío D. El Porvenir, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen D. ella. Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 y las ganas D. salir adelante  emprendió su negocio D. venta D. comida como los tradicionales juanes y anticuchos, que luego decidió cambiar por la crianza y venta  D. gallinas vivas que los cría en la huerta D. su propia casa  para luego ofrecerlo en el mercado principal D. la ciudad y a los dueños D. conocidos restaurantes. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, comprará  100 gallinas bebes para criarlos, alimento balanceado y vacunas para que crezcan sanas y gordas  para luego venderlos, también comprará  20 gallos y 20 gallinas grandes para que se reproduzcan. Este negocio le rinD. muy buenas ganancias.  Es ella quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, es una mujer emprendedora, perseverante y mira siempre el futuro con mucho optimismo. Melvith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que viene recibiendo.
texts.en:
Melvith belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank. She lives in the village of El Porvenir in the district of Bellavista, department of San Martín. She is married, 34 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are still dependent on her. With her first loan of 300 soles and the desire to progress, she opened her business selling prepared food such as traditional "juanes" [boiled rice and meat wrapped in leaves] and anticuchos [marinated pieces of beef heart on skewers]. She later decided to change businesses and began raising and selling live chickens which she raises in the garden of her home in order to later offer them for sale in the main market of the city and to the owners of well-known restaurants. With the loan of 2,000 soles which will be repaid in six months she will buy 100 young chicks to raise, balanced feed and vaccinations so that they will grow to be healthy and fat for later resale, as well as 20 roosters and 20 hens so that they will reproduce. This business is very profitable. She is the one who makes the decisions about the revenues and profits from her business; she is an enterprising woman, persevering and always looks to the future with great enthusiasm. Melvith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy young chicks to raise, as well as roosters and hens.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.es: Merlita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Comercio cdra. 04 – Caserío La Libertad, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos independientes.Se inicio vendiendo abarrotes en pequeñas cantidades, a las que agregó la venta de cosméticos, ubicando su negocio en su propia casa. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 que cancelara a un plazo de 06 meses, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. También invertirá en la compra y  venta  de productos de belleza, que en sus tiempos libres se dedica a ofrecer a sus amistades y conocidos. Ella maneja todas las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más  segura y responsable y llena de esperanzas. Merlita, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, esperando que sigan así para apoyar a demás mujeres que quieren trabajar y emprender su negocio.
texts.en:
Merlita is a member of the communal bank “La Libertad” and lives in the village of La Libertad, district of Bellavista, area of San Martin. She is married, 40 years old, and has two children, both independent. She began selling groceries in small quantities, to which she added the sale of cosmetics, locating her business in her home.

With this loan of 1500 PEN which she will pay in a period of six months, she will buy more products to supply her business such as sacks of rice and sugar, products for personal hygiene and house cleaning, sodas, and various products for maintaining her customers’ satisfaction. She will also invest in the purchase and sale of beauty products which she offers to her friends and acquaintances in her free time. She manages all of the profits of her business. Personally, she feels more secure and responsible, and full of hope.

Merlita shows her appreciation for Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as a business owner and a woman, hoping that they continue in the same way by supporting more women who want to work and to launch their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase articles of the first need and beauty products

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: La señora Maruja, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Cáceres cdra. 05, del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 06 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.S u primer crédito de S/. 300.00 le permitió aperturar su negocio de venta de salchipollo(pollo frito acompañado de papas y cremas) para lo cual cuenta con un carrito salchipapero en donde prepara sus productos que tiene gran acogida entre sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que le da muchas satisfacciones personales, familiares y económicas.  Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando sacos de papas, repollos, tomates; pollos desviscerados e insumos para la preparación de sus cremas, como también paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores y tamaños, para así satisfacer el exigente gusto de sus clientes.Se siente una mujer luchadora e independiente, gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos, salio adelante junto con su familia y hoy esta en mejores condiciones y estabilidad económica, ya que sus ventas se incrementan día a día.
texts.en:
Ms. Maruja Vasquez is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” (Virgin of the Rosary) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Bellavista district of the department of San Martín. She is a single 45-year-old mother of 6 children, one of whom is still her dependent. Her first 300.00 PEN loan allowed her to open up her salchipollo (fried chicken with potatoes and cream) business. She has a food cart in which she prepares the street food that is so popular with her patrons. She is currently running this same business, which gives her plenty of personal, family, and financial satisfaction. She has been working with the microfinance institute for 4 years. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase sacks of potatoes, cabbage, and tomatoes, cut-up chicken, and the ingredients needed to make her sauces, as well as crates of different sizes and flavors of soft drinks, so that she can satisfy her demanding customers. She feels like a very hard-working and independent woman. Thanks to Manuela Ramos’ support, she and her family have been able to get ahead in life, and she now has better living conditions and financial stability because sales have been increasing on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make street food

loans.name: Magaly Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Magaly Isabel G. C. tiene 28 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 4to de primaria, abandono los estudios debido a que vino a vivir a Trujillo y no quiso estudiar, tiene 02 pequeños hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Magaly se dedica a la venta de pollos, inició su negocio hace 3 meses comprando 15 pollos para criar que luego vendió y le ha sido muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Ella es socia nueva  Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú”.  Con este crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pollos y alimento balanceado.
Magaly sueña con tener una bodega en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Magaly Isabel G. C. is 28 years old and lives in El Cortijo in the Trujillo district of Trujillo Province, in the La Libertad region of Peru.
She went as far as 4th grade, quitting school once she moved to Trujillo and no longer wanted to study. She has two young children who completely depend on her.
Magaly sells chickens from her home. She started her business 3 months ago by purchasing and raising 15 chickens, which she later sold. This was very profitable for her.
She is a new member of the “Nuevo Perú” Communal Bank. With this loan of 300 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase chickens and chicken feed.
Magaly dreams of setting up a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is a hair dresser and also sells different types of soft drinks Nyankomasi. Janet has received junior high school education.  She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a designer.Janet has been selling different types of drinks and worked as a hair dresser since 1986. She is responsible for paying utility bills, feeding, school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional hair shampoo and other her dressing materials for her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase capital of business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional hair shampoo and other her dressing materials for her work.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena N. is a trader selling provisions in Swidu which she has done since 1995. She is married with four children and received an education through junior high school. While Abena makes her living as a trader, her husband works as a carpenter. Abena is responsible for paying various family expenses such as utility bills and food. Her loan will be used to purchase additional provisions for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business in order to further increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions for resale

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi A. works as a trader in Siwdo, selling goods such as yams, tea and bread. She has three children and has been employed as a trader for four years. Asi uses her income to pay for the expenses of her family, such as providing proper food and nutrition for her children. She will use this loan to purchase additional goods for resale. Asi plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: María Teresa
