texts.es: María Teresa Q. V. D. S. D. 65 años D. edad resiD. en San Martín junto a su hijo. Ella posee una tienda en su propia casa, ahí comercializa golosinas, bebidas, shampoo, y otros productos más. María tiene 40 años D. poseer su negocio, y es por esto que es muy conocida en el lugar, contando con la fidelidad D. muchos clientes. María Teresa, es una mujer que goza D. muy buena reputación, ya que al morir su esposo ella tuvo que trabajar muy duro para poder seguir adelante junto a su hijo. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital D. trabajo necesario para aumentar más productos en su tienda y D. esta manera tener una vida más tranquila, en la cual posea todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna en su vejez.
texts.en:
María Teresa Q. V. D. S. is 65 years old and lives in San Martín next to her son. She has a store in her house where she sells sweets, drinks, shampoo, and other products. María has had her business for forty years and is therefore very well known in her area and can count on loyal clients. María Teresa enjoys a great reputation because since her husband died she has had to work very hard to get ahead, together with her son. She's asking for a loan so she can get the necessary working capital to increase the amount of products she has in her store. In this way she can have a more relaxed life in which she'll have everything necessary to have a dignified life in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de más productos para negocio.

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es: Wilber Alexander R. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su tía y un sobrino de 12 años de edad, su madre se encuentra en los Estados Unidos y él se debe encargar de todos los gastos del hogar. Wilber a pesar de ser muy joven posee su propio negocio, en el cual se vende ropa de cama, para niños y adultos. A pesar que su madre le brinda la ayuda económica, esta no da a abasto, es por ello que Wilber solícita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa nueva y usada de manera que pueda brindar mayor variedad de precios y de producto a las personas. De esta manera Wilber espera mejorar su economía, y poder obtener un mejor estilo de vida junto a su tía y su sobrino.
texts.en:
Wilbur Alexander R. Martinez is 28 years of age. He resides in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his aunt and a cousin of 12 years of age. His mother is in the United States and he is in charge of all the household expenses. In spite of being very young, Wilbur has his own business, in which he sells clothing for children and adults. Despite the economic help his mother provides, it does not provide him with enough for supplies. It is because of this that Wilbur is asking for a loan, with which he will be able to buy more new and used clothing so that he can provide a greater variety of prices and products to his customers. In this manner, Wilbur hopes to improve his economic situation and be able to obtain a better standard of living with his aunt and cousin.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new and used clothing

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua D. works as a trader in Bosomtwe selling provisions and food supplies such as koko (millet/corn porridge). She has been a trader since 2001 and her husband works as a miner. Afua is married with four children and received an education through primary school.

Afua uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses such as food and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase additional food supplies as well as other goods for resale. Afua will use the new profits from her expanded business to continue taking care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional food supplies as well as other goods for resale

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Doña Marcela Q. D. S. esta casada con el señor Paulino S. Ortiz, que trabaja en una empresa D. reciclaje con vehiculo propio, tiene un hijo que aún depenD. económicamente D. ella, doña Marcela tiene dos negocios que atienD. al mismo tiempo dos negocios, su principal que es su tienda D. barrio y su centro D. reciclaje D. botellas D. plástico, vidrio y nylon.
Su negocio principal que es la tienda D. barrio, consiste en la compra y venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad como arroz, fideo, harina, conservas, refrescos, lácteos, etc. El mismo que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio al igual que su empresa D. reciclaje.
Con el crédito lo que busca con su crédito es surtir mejor su tienda y con esto mejorar sus ingresos y el nivel D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Marcela Q. D. S. is married to Señor Paulino S. Ortiz, who works for a recycling company, driving his own car. The couple have one child, who is still dependent on them. Doña Marcela runs two businesses at once: the main one is her corner store, the other is collecting plastic, glass and nylon waste for recycling. Her store sells basic necessities, such as rice, beans, flour, preserves, drinks, milk, etc. She runs both her store and the recycling business out of her home. With this loan, Doña Marcela will increase the range of products she sells at her store and thus, increase both her income and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock a corner store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women who meet monthly at Luisa’s house in the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes. Luisa is 38 years old and lives with her partner and their five children, who are 13, 11, 6, 3, and 9 months old. Luisa works as a cook for the local Municipal. She cooks for Wawawasi (“Baby house” in Quechua), its childcare program, preparing meals for 11 babies and 55 children each day. She cooks alone, though she works with two people who help her serve the food. She cooks mostly stews.

Luisa also raises small animals like pigs, guinea pigs and hens at her home. Right now, she has one pig and 30 to 40 guinea pigs (a Peruvian delicacy). She raises the animals from the time they are small, then fattens them up and sells them to buyers, who travel to Andahuaylillas from Cusco and bring the animals back to the city to cook and serve in restaurants. Luisa is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy hens and guinea pigs. Hens cost 12.50 soles per pair, and guinea pigs cost 22 soles per pair. She expects to sell the hens for 40-45 soles apiece and the guinea pigs for 20-25 soles apiece in three to four months. Though hens sell for more when fully grown, they also cost more to feed and maintain, Luisa says. 

Luisa’s goal for the future is to open a chain of hotels in Andahuayllillas. She says there are many tourists who visit the small town to see its church (which is nicknamed “America’s Sistine Chapel” because of the elaborate 17th century frescos painted on its walls and ceiling), and she sees a promising business opportunity.

loans.use: To buy hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Edith Karina

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy.
Edith es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Edith junto a su esposo tienen un bar llamado Palizada, en donde vende bebidas variadas y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica. Además en los últimos meses aperturó una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su mama.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Edith son que su hija que esta delicada de salud mejore, y su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy.

Edith lives with her husband. She is 22 years old and has one daughter. Edith and her husband have a bar called Palizada where they sell various beverages and on Saturdays and Sundays sell local food. In addition, in recent months she opened a grocery store in her mother's house.

Edith needs a loan of $325 (1000 PEN) which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Edith's dreams are that the delicate health of her daughter improves and her business continues to grow.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy.
Justina es viuda, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Justina tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías como ají molido, ajo molido, productos que ella misma prepara, además vende verdura picadas.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de comino, pimienta, sal, ají colorado.
Los sueños de Justina son tener una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank, Tu Ángel Lucy.

Justina is a widow, 45 years old, and has three children. Justina has a stall in the 12 de Abril market, in which she sells spices such as ground chili and garlic, products that she prepares herself. She also sells diced vegetables.

Justina needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($324 USD), money that she will invest in the purchase of cumin, pepper, salt and chilies.

Justina’s dreams are to have a grocery store in her home and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cumin, pepper, salt and chilies

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Gomes L. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en San Caralampio loma Negra en Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las cosas del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de 13 años que actualmente estudia y una niña de 10 que también estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar la vivienda, para poder darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos y apoyarlo en sus estudios , desde hace diez años trabaja como productor , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio la actividad agrícola con el apoyo de su suegra que el brindo una manzana de tierra para que la trabajará . Los planes hacia un futuro en sus cultivos es poder diversificarlo, con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener una producción buena y vender bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Roberto G. L. is 27 years old and lives in San Caralampio, Negra hill en Ticuantepe with his wife who helps him with household matters. They care for their two children, a 13-year old boy that currently goes to school and a 10-year old girl that also attends school. Their plans as a family are to improve their home, to have a better quality of life for their children, and to help them with their studies. For ten years, he has worked as a producer. The major problem that presents itself is the lack of financing. He began his agricultural activities with the help of his mother-in-law, who gave him a parcel of land so that he could work. His plan for the future of his crops is to diversify. With this financing, he will buy fertilizer and consumables so that he will be able to have a good harvest and good sales in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables and fertilizer to improve his harvest

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy.
Nancy es casada, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Nancy tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende papa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los compra en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Nancy es ser mayorista y tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy Microfinance Institute.

She is a 32-year-old married mother of two. She has a stand in the 12 de Abril market, in which she sells a wide variety of potatoes everyday. She buys her goods at the city’s wholesale market.

Nancy needs a loan of 600.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing potatoes.

Nancy dreams of becoming a wholesaler and having her own wholesale market in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis owns and operates a hair salon, where she offers cuts, colors, perms and a variety of other beauty services. She has had her salon for five years now. She works alone, 7 days a week, from 7 am to 7 pm. Gladis’s goal for the future is to improve and expand her hair salon by moving into a new, larger space and buying new furniture. Gladis is 37-years old and lives with her partner and their three children who are 20-, 12- and 5-years old.

Though the hair salon is her primary source of income, Gladis has a side business buying and selling jora (white corn that is dried, soaked in large earthenware pots until germination, then boiled). She buys the jora from local producers in the town of San Jeronimo and sells it to people who make their own chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer.

Gladis plans to use her Kiva loan to buy jora. Each sack contains 182 kilos of corn, and costs 300 soles. She plans to buy a total of six sacks with her loan of 1800 soles, and estimates that she will make about 550 soles in profit after selling all of the jora.

Gladis is a member of the Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy corn for making chicha

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes. 
Sabina es casada tiene 60 años, tres hijos que son mayores y están casados.
Sabina es de Iquitos llego con su familia  Lima a los 8 años, estudio enfermería la ejerció hasta que se jubilo hace dos años, a la par ella empezó a vender en su casa  bizcochitos, galletas así empezó poco a poco  hoy en día tiene una bodega-bazar.    
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de loceria, compra en las fábricas. 
Desde que esta en Finca, ha implementado más su negocio, su negocio ha crecido, aprendió a mantener su negocio, ha no gastarse el capital y seguir invirtiendo.  
El sueño de Sabina es buscar otro local para ampliar su negoció
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Sabina is 60, married, and has three grown and married children. Sabina is from Iquitos. When she was 8, she and her family came to Lima. She studied to be a nurse, and she worked as a nurse until her retirement two years ago. At that time she started to sell cakes and cookies in her home. Now she has a store-bazaar. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy crockery, which she would buy from the factories. Since she has been with Finca she has been able to better establish her store, and her business has grown. She learned to how to manage her business, to not waste money, and to keep investing. Sabina’s dream is to find another location to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crockery from the factories.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Margarita es casada tiene 53 años, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales los  dos menores de  12 y 9 años están  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Margarita  trabajaba  en casas limpiando, cocinando y vendiendo de todo, hasta que se sintió cansada y  comenzó criando en su casa dos cerditos cuando crecieron los mato y vendió la carne  y recupero el doble de ganancia, se dio cuenta que con los chanchos ganaba mas
Empezó a comprar  más cerditos, alquilo un corral para criar cerdos, hoy tiene 40 cerdos.  
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de alimentos para cerdos y medicinas para cerdos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, su capital ha crecido, aprendió de las charlas que se dictan en el Bancomunal, también ha aprendido ahorra.  
El sueño de Margarita es poner un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de las Mercedes." Margarita is 53 years old and married. She has 6 children; the 2 youngest (the 9 and 12 year old) study in the state school. Margarita used to work cleaning houses, cooking, and selling everything until she felt tired and began raising 2 piglets in her home. When they got older, she killed them and sold the meat making double the profit. She then realized that she could earn more with pigs. She began to buy more loans, rented a corral to raise pigs, and today has 40 pigs. Margarita needs a loan of 800 soles, to buy food and medicine for the pigs. Since she has been a member of Finca, her capital her grown. She has learned from the talks her Communal Bank offers and she has also learned to save. Margarita’s dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margarita necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de alimentos para cerdos y medicinas para cerdos.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata has a snack kiosk in a local high school where she sells lunches as well as snacks, drinks and sweets to teachers and students. Fortunata has had her kiosk for the past year. Prior to running the stand, she raised small animals like guinea pigs and hens at her house. Fortunata is 31-years old and is married with four children. Her oldest child is 11 while the youngest is just 18-months old.

Fortunata starts cooking and preparing food at her home at 7 am each day. She spends three and a half hours in preparation, then leaves for school. Her busiest time of day is 11:30 am, when the students have their lunch recess. Fortunata earns about 30 soles a day in profit, depending on how many competitors are working near the school on a given day.

Fortunata is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy fruit, yogurt, and cookies in bulk. She expects this supply to last for about three months. She has pledged to repay her loan in full and on time. Fortunata is a member of the Las Triunfadoras (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy fruit, yogurt and cookies in bulk

loans.name: Marleny Yanet

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Marleny es soltera, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Marleny tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende verduras, además por las tardes vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en el parque de la ciudad.
Marleny necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas variadas.
Los sueños de Marleny son mejorar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the Communal Bank "Rikchary," which means, "Awake" in Quechua. Marleny is 29 years old, single, and has a son. Marleny has a place in the central market in the city, Ayacucho, where she sells vegetables. She also sells sweets in the afternoons around the city park. Marleny needs a loan of 1200 soles that she will invest in buying a variety of sweets. Marleny has dreams of improving her business and building a home.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de golosinas variadas.

loans.name: Jaquelin Sugey

texts.es: La joven Jacqueline Sugey González Martínez, tiene la edad de 26 años,  habita en la comunidad las enramadas carretera a Ticuantepe, ella es soltera, actualmente habita en casa de sus padres, la joven tiene a su cargo un hijo de tres años de edad, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar económicamente para poder darle bienestar a su hijo, la joven trabaja como cajera en un mini-súper  , ella solicita un financiamiento para construir un cuarto aparte y poder tener una mejor condición de vida .El financiamiento lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. Lo cual da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo de poder cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
The young Jaquelin Sugey G. M. is 26 years old, lives in the Enramadas community on the road to Ticuantepe. She is single and currently lives with her parents. In her care, this young woman has a 3-yeard old son. The plans she has for her family is for financial improvement, to be able to provide for her son. She works as a cashier in a mini-mall. She is requesting a loan to be able to build a separate room so as to have better living conditions. The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials. She is grateful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) for their support towards her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material to make a new room.

loans.name: María Elpidia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Brigida M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de refrescos los cuales son elaborados por ella misma todos los días y ofrecidos en su establecimiento en dicho mercado.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera comercializarlos en su localidad para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua Brigida Martinez runs her business selling fresh fruit drinks, all of which she makes and sells herself in the market.

She is recurring to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase fresh fruit with which to make her fruit drinks and sell them through her stand, in order to continue supporting her humble home. She has been a loyal client of Ceprodel and she hopes that her loan will be granted to her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For ingredients to make fruit drinks.

loans.name: Smith

texts.es:
Smith es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Smith es casada tiene 47 años. Dos hijos de 27 y 26 años, que trabajan.
Smith termino la escuela estatal, se preparaba para postular a la universidad y salio embarazada, sus planes cambiaron. Su mama vendía en la parada kiliando y ella le  ayudaba, aprendió y se independizo puso su puesto de venta de papa al por mayor; su esposo administra el negocio.   
Smith necesita un crédito de 1800 soles, para la compra de mercadería de papa 300  kilos.
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos han ayudado ha incrementar mas su negocio, aprendió a escuchar ha preguntar a opinar y ha desenvolverse. 
El sueño Smith es viajar a provincia para comprar papa en las chacras.
texts.en:
Smith is a member of the Community Bank Virgen de las Mercedes. Smith is married and is 47 years old, having two children aged 27 and 26 years old. Both are working. Smith completed high school and was preparing for university but she became pregnant and her plans were changed. Her mother conducted sales in the Kiliando station and she used to help her. Having learned from her experience she became independent and set up her own stand selling potatoes wholesale. Her husband administers the business. Smith requires loan in the amount of 1800 soles to purchase a 300 Kg load of potatoes. Since she has been working with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) the loans have helped her expand her business, and she has learned to listen, ask, and to speak up and to get involved. Smith's dream is to travel to another province to purchase potatoes in the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Smith requires a loan in the amount of 1800 soles to purchase a 300 Kg load of potatoes.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Ursula es conviviente  tiene 30 años, dos hijos de 9 años que esta en la escuela estatal y un de dos años.
Ursula termino el colegio pero no quiso estudiar nada, no le gustan los estudios, quiso dedicarse al negocio, ella creció viendo a su mamá trabajar vendiendo pescado y ella iba a trabajar con ella, al tiempo salio embarazada se independizo y empezó a vender pescado en el Terminal   pesquero.  
Ursula necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería de  pescado. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a trabajar con honestidad, aprendió como administrar mejor su negocio.  
El sueño de Ursula es tener un negocio propio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ursula is a member of the Community bank Virgen de las Mujeres.

Ursula has a common law partner and is 30 years old, and she has two children - one is 9 years old and attending school and the other is two years old.

Ursula completed her schooling but she did not want to study further becasue she did not like school. She instead wanted to start a business. She grew up watching her Mom working and selling fish and she wished to work with her. She became pregnant and she became independent and started selling fish in the fish market.

Ursula requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles, to purchase fish.

Since she has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned to conduct an honest business and to better administer the business.

Ursula's dream is to have her own convenience store one day.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ursula requires a loan in the amoutn of 1000 soles to purchase fish.

loans.name: Esperanza Yolanda

texts.es:
Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Esperanza es casada, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Esperanza se dedica al alquiler de aparatos topográficos a diferentes empresas, instituciones, actividad que realiza todos los días en su casa. 
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de 2 prismas.
Los sueños de Esperanza son ahorrar para techar su casa y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Community Bank Rikchary, meaning Awaken in the Quechua language.

Esperanza is married, she is 35 years old and has 3 children. She dedicates her time to the rental of topographic instruments to differents companies, and institutions, a business she carries out from her own home.

Esperanza requires a loan in the amount of 1500 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of 2 prisms.

Esperanza's dream is to save enough money to be able to put a roof on their house and to see her children go to university.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 prisms.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela runs an ice cream shop from her home in Andahuaylillas and also sells lunch from a stand in the town’s market. Her daughter helps her run the ice cream shop so that she can dedicate herself to preparing meals. At her lunch stand, Gabriela serves set lunch menus, starting with a soup (made of quinoa, wheat or potatoes) and followed with a main course of stew, rice with chicken, chicken pasta, saltado (beef or chicken stir-fried with french fries and vegetables and served over rice), or matasca (a traditional Peruvian beef and potato stew).

Gabriela starts cooking each morning around 7:30 am so that she’ll be ready to start serving her clients at 11 am. She has been working this way for about four years now. Gabriela is 42-years old and is married with four children. Three of her children are adults while the youngest is still an adolescent.

Gabriela is just getting her ice cream business up and running again since she doesn’t serve ice cream during the rainy months from January to March. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to invest in her ice cream shop. She makes all of the ice cream from scratch, so she needs to buy raw ingredients like milk, sugar, flavoring and food coloring. She will buy fresh whole milk from local producers for 1.30 soles per liter, and 50-kilo sacks of sugar for 90 soles apiece.

Gabriela’s goal for the future is to improve and expand her ice cream shop by buying a more modern mixer, a bigger freezer, and small carts so that local children can sell her homemade ice cream around town.

Gabriela is a member of the Las Triunfadoras (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, food coloring and flavorings to make ice cream

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Victor A. se dedica desde hace 17 años a la venta de platanitos fritos en bolsa en el Mercado Mayoreo siendo esta actividad el único sustento que le permite mantener a su familia. 

Todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el señor Victor fríe los plátanos en su casa y luego los introduce en bolsas para comercializarlos en todo el mercado. Una estrategia que utiliza es que por lo general se establece en un área donde venden juguetes para niños ya que este lugar es muy visitado por los compradores y allí aprovecha para vender sus platanitos. No solo se mantiene en este lugar sino que  también se mueve por todas las calles del mercado ofreciendo los platanitos y busca la manera de cómo venderlos todos para así obtener sus ganancias. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito a lo inmediato para la compra de los plátanos y las bolsas para continuar con su trabajo en el mercado.
texts.en:
For the past 7 years Victor A. has been selling fried plantains in the Mayoreo Market, this being the only source of support that permits him to feed his family. Every day since the very early morning hours Victor fries the plantains in his home and puts them in bags to sell them in the market. One of his selling strategies is to place himself next to vendors who sell toys in the market, since these spots are the most visited by his potential clients. He also walks the streets of the market selling his product and he looks for ways to sell out to improve his earnings. Currently he has sought out the help of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner), seeking a loan to purchase bananas and bags to be able to keep working in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas.

loans.name: Olga Carmen

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Olga viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra papa y luego los vende en la selva ayacuchana.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa variada.
Los sueños de Olga son tener casa propia y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the community bank named “Rikchary”, which means "Wake up" in Quechua. Olga is in a common law marriage, is 40, and has 3 children. Olga travels to regional fairs to buy potatoes to later sell in the Ayacuchana jungle. Olga needs a loan of 3000 PEN to buy different varieties of potatoes. Olga’s dreams are to have her own house and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different varieties of potatoes.

loans.name: Esteban Miguel

texts.es:
Esteban  es socio del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Esteban es soltero, estudió para profesor de  educación primaria, pero no lo ejerció.  
Trabajaba como empleado en una tienda de abarrotes por años con el dinero juntado decidió comprar sacos de arroz y menestras  los vendió a los vecinos y decidió abrir en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. 
Esteban necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra mercadería y hacer pagos a los proveedores. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser solidario y mas de la cultura de crédito, le ayuda para orientar a sus clientas. 
El sueño de Esteban  es ejercer su carrera y seguir  creciendo en el negocio
texts.en:
Esteben is a member of his community bank, Virgen de las Mercedes. Esteban is single. He studied to be an elementary school teacher, but he has not taught. For years he worked as an employee in a grocery store. With the money he put together, he decided to buy sacks of rice and legumes and sell them to his neighbors. He decided to open a grocery store in his house. Esteben needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy merchandise and pay his suppliers. Since he has been with Finca he has learned to save, to be supportive, gained more knowledge about loans, and how to direct his customers. Esteban’s dream is to work in his profession and to keep his business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pay his providers

loans.name: Juan Israel

texts.es:
Juan Israel A. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica a su negocio de pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos a sus clientes estando ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. 

Hoy en día el señor Juan ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de sus productos para así ofertarlos en su pulpería y continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida por medio de su negocio al que se dedica.
texts.en:
Juan Israel A. is a very hard working gentleman. He has a grocery store, and he offers all types of products to his customers. His business is located in the Mayoreo market in Managua. Juan is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy products. He will sell the products and continue improving his living conditions through his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Haydee es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, Haydee tiene un hotel llamado Los Cactus que esta ubicado en la Provincia D. Sucre, actividad que inicio hace pocos meses, también esta implementando un recreo.
Haydee necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. mesas.
Haydee sueña con que su ultimo hijo culmine sus estudios e implementar un modulo D. ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua. Haydee is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. Haydee has a hotel called Los Cactus that she opened a few months ago. It is located in the Sucre Province. She is also establishing a retreat.

Haydee needs a loan of 600 PEN, money she will invest to buy tables.

Haydee dreams that her last son finishes school and does a course on cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Paulina es casada, tiene 52 años y 9 hijos, Paulina venD. artesanía variada, su local esta ubicado en una calle céntrica, local que es alquilado. Además tiene un bar en la casa D. su hijo en la ciudad D. Huanta para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. un personal.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas D. alpaca.
Los sueños D. Paulina son ahorrar para los títulos D. sus hijos y surtir con mas productos su tienda.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua.

Paulina is 52 years old, married and has 9 children. Paulina sells various crafts. Her shop is located on a central street. The shop is rented. She also has a bar at her son’s house in the city of Huanta where she counts on staff for help.

Paulina needs a loan of 1200 PEN, money she will invest to buy alpaca wool sweaters.

Paulina’s dreams are to save for her children’s degrees and fill her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca wool sweaters.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brigida H. se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa atendiendo en su establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario se desempeña con gran esfuerzo en su negocio.

El motivo por el cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta forma contribuir al mejoramiento de su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brigida H. works in clothes sales, tending her business in the Mayoreo market every day with great energy. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel is to receive credit with which she will buy products to improve the business in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Roberto Simon

texts.es: El señor Roberto Simón R. López tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en las pilas orientales en Masaya, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos un varón de 13 años que actualmente estudia y le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, el otro varón de doce años solamente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos para poder darle un bienestar mejor , don Roberto se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años el rubro que trabaja son los granos básicos y hortalizas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio como agricultor por el apoyo de un amigo , con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder tener una buena cosecha y poder vender sus productos a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Simón R. López is 39 years old and lives in Las Pilas Orientales in the department of Masaya with his wife who helps him with household expenses. They care for their two sons, one who is 13 and currently studying and helping with the farm work, and the other who is 12 and just goes to school. The plans that Don Roberto has for his family are to improve the living conditions so that he can give his sons better well-being. He has worked in agriculture for 12 years raising basic grains and vegetables. The major difficulty for him is the lack of financing. When he began farming he was helped by a friend, and now financing will help him to buy supplies and fertilizers so that he can have a good harvest and sell his products for a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and supplies to improve crop production

loans.name: Dora Josefa

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Dora A. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa en su propio tramo el cual ha logrado mantener gracias a sus esfuerzos y su gran espíritu de superación en el negocio.

Ella posee dos pequeños hijos a los que ama mucho y les debe de brindar las condiciones necesarias para que ellos estudien y es este negocio la fuente de ingresos para sus pequeños. El motivo por el cual hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa para comercializarla en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, Mrs. Dora A. works in her clothing business, selling from her own stall which she has succeeded in maintaining thanks to her great effort and her spirit of enterprise. She has two small children she loves dearly, and for them she must provide the necessary conditions for them to study. It is her business that is the source of income for her children’s education. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel is to apply for credit for the purchase of clothing which she will sell at her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Victor R. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de pollo el cual posee desde hace 16 años siendo este ingreso el único con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y por sus dos hijos.

Actualmente la razón por la que el señor R. ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra del pollo para así ofrecerlo en su localidad y continuar mejorando su situación económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, Mr. Victor R. dedicates himself to his business of selling chicken. He has worked in this business for 16 years and it has been the only source of income to support his family which consists of his wife and two children. Now, he is coming to Ceprodel to ask for credit so that he can buy chicken to sell at the market, thereby continuing to improve the economic conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: La señora Ángela U. T., tiene la edad de 24 años. habita en el barrio las enramadas carretera a Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como transportista desde hace once años para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar; ya que ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una niña de siete años y una bebe de 19 meses de vida, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda para darle un mejor bienestar a sus pequeñas ya que quiere hacer un porche por que le afecta el sol y la lluvia en tiempos de invierno . Ella se desempeña como cajera en un mini-marcket desde hace siete años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento ya que no se le aprueba lo que solicita y eso le afecta en su presupuesto ya que tiene que comprar materiales hasta donde le de el desembolso, el financiamiento lo va a invertir en compra de materiales para lograr sus meta de poder tener su porche, este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios que ha proporcionado a su familia, y espera seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ángela U. T. is 24 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of Enramadas on the road to Ticuantepe with her husband and their two children, a seven-year-old daughter and a nineteen-month-old baby girl. To cover household expenses, he has worked as a trucker for eleven years, and Ángela has worked as a cashier in a mini-market for seven years. Wishing to improve their living conditions and to provide more comfort for her children, she plans to build a porch to protect them from the sun and the winter rains. The major difficulty is that if she is not approved for financing she cannot buy the materials needed to build a porch. With financing she can invest in materials to achieve her goal of building the porch. This is her fourth lending cycle with Afodenic and, thanks to the benefits these loans have brought to the family, she hopes to continue working with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to construct a porch

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
La señora María R. con gran dedicación labora en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos y bebidas el cual posee en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario se esfuerza para obtener el capital financiero para subsistir.

Actualmente ella requiere de la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y por este motivo espera en que Ceprodel le brindará las oportunidades por medio de la obtención de dicho crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R., with great dedication, works in her business which is the production and sale of food products and beverages. She is established in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua where she works every day to make enough money to survive. At this time she needs to purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare the foods, and for this reason she hopes that Ceprodel will offer her the opportunity to get ahead in her business by providing the credit to make this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages and raw materials for food products

loans.name: Nidia Marilu

texts.es:
Nidia es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchary que significa Despierta en quechua.
Nidia es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Nidia junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de cerveza, para lo cual tienen un local ubicado en una avenida transitada, además tienen una taberna.
Nidia necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ron, wisky.
Los sueños de Nidia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y aperturar otro local.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the Rikchary Community Bank which means Wake Up in quechua.

Nidia is 31 years old, married and has 2 children. Nidia and her husband sell beer. They have a place on a busy avenue and they also have a pub.

Nidia needs a loan of 2100 PEN, money she will invest to buy rum and whiskey.

Nidia’s dreams are that her children become professional workers, to have her own home and to open another place.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rum and whiskey.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Juana es conviviente tiene 43 años, cinco hijos, dos gemelos de  22 años, uno de 16, 14 y 7 años, que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Juana se dedica ala venta de productos de belleza por catalogo hace doce años y a dar menú en su casa. 
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió a ser solidaria,  a seguir creciendo en el negocio, recibe mucha motivación, de la promotora.   
El sueño de Juana es poner un salón de belleza, por que ella estudio en el colegio.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. Juana, 43, is in a common law marriage. She has five children, 22 year old twins, a 16 year old, a 14 year old and a 7 year old. They go to the state school. For two years Juana has been selling beauty products by catalog. She also has been making and selling meals in her home. Juana needs a loan of 1400 PEN to buy beauty products. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to be supportive, to keep her business growing, and received a lot of motivation from her bank representative. Juana’s dream is to open a beauty salon; that is what she studied in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Resplandor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Resplandor inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, muchas D. las socias fueron invitadas por L. promotora para integrar este nuevo banco Comunal..

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. condimentos, comidas, carne, comida, abarrotes en general, ropa, animales menores.


Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 450 soles, haciendo un total D. 3,750 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, fideo, golosinas, pollos, menestras, ropa y carne.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un local propio, mejorar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Resplandor (Brightness) started its first cycle with ten members, many of whom were invited as the reason for starting this new communal bank. The members have different businesses such as the sale of seasonings, meals, meat, food, general groceries, clothes, and small animals.

The members need loans of differing amounts such as 300 PEN, 600 PEN, 450 PEN, making a total loan of 3,750 PEN from the communal bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, pasta, candy, chickens, vegetable stew, clothes, and meat.

The members dream of having their own business location, improving their businesses, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, pasta, candy, chicken, vegetable stew, clothes, and meat.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa F. se ha destacado por ser una excelentísima cocinera que elabora alimentos para luego ofertarlos en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora F. hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así mejorar su situación económica y beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa F. has distinguished herself as a very excellent cook who prepares food which she later sells in the wholesale market in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. It is important to point out that Mrs. F. today goes through the need to invest in her business, and for that reason she seeks support from Ceprodel, to benefit from a loan and thereby improve her financial situation and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of premium material
